loans.name: Rutzi

texts.es:
La señora Rutzi es socia del banco comunal Las Bellas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad y un hijo.
Son tres ciclos que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado de la zona y lo realiza en horas de la mañana, tiene que madrugar para poder tener la comida lista para atender a sus comensales.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 soles junto a unpequeño capital que tiene, comprará: 1 juego de ollas, 1 cocina, 1 balón de gas, 1 estante, servilletas, condimentos.
Todas éstas cosas le hacen falta para poder trabajar cómodamente.
Su trabajo queda lejos de su casa, pero tiene que trabajar para poder llevar de comer a casa, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de la localidad y casi no está con ellos.
Está tranquila porque trabaja para sacar adelante a su hijo que todavía está a su cargo, agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad de darle un pequeño capital  para iniciar su negocio
texts.en:
Rutzi is a member of the Las Bellas Communal Bank in the Calleria district, Ucayali department.  She is 45 years old, and she has one son.

She has been working with loans from Manuala Ramos for three cycles.  She sells food at a market in the area.  She does this in the morning hours.  She needs to rise with the sun in order to be able to have the food ready to take care of her customers.

She will use her new loan for 1,000 soles together with a little money that she has to buy a set of pots, a cooker, one tank of gas, a shelf, napkins, and condiments.  She needs all of these things to be able to comfortably work.

Her work is far from her house, but she has to work to be able to put food on the table.  Her husband works for a company in town, and he is hardly ever with them.

She is at peace because she works to get her son, who is still under her care, ahead.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity of giving her a small amount of capital to start her business.

loans.use: to buy a set of pots, a cooker, one tank of gas, a shelf, napkins, and condiments.

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de ropa, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 7 y 3 años de edad, el negocio de la venta de ropa lo tiene desde hace 10 años, aprendió el oficio por la necesidad de tener ingresos para su numerosa familia, su horario es de 6:00am a 2:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa, camisetas, blusas, ropa interior y de niños, con esta inversión su negocio estará más diversificado, espera que así pueda tener mayor afluencia de los clientes en consumo.
Su objetivo es permanecer con el negocio, ya que sus hijos dependen de ella y prácticamente su única fuente de ingreso es el negocio.
texts.en:
María, who works selling clothing, is a single mother of 5 children aged 18, 16, 14, 7 and 3.  She has had her business selling clothes for 10 years; she learned the trade because of the need to earn income for her large family.  Her hours are from 6:00 a.m. to 2:00 pm.

She is currently seeking a loan to buy clothes, shirts, blouses, underwear and children's clothing.  With this investment her business will become more diversified, she hopes that in this way she can get a greater flow of customers buying things.

Her goal is to stay with the business because her children depend on her and practically her only source of income is the business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shirts, blouses, underwear and children's clothing.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with four children, one boy and three girls. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mbodze has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also sells dried fish for another source of income. 

She faces a major challenge of seasonality since during rainy season customers are few. She dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour and sacks of dried fish. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour and sacks of dried fish.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is a 37-year-old woman and married. She has one daughter, and she lives in Gaza city in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.  Mervat's husband has a blacksmith shop where he makes metal doors and windows and fixes home metal accessories.

Mervat took out a loan from FATEN to help her husband purchase the metal-cutting machine he needs which will save him time when he replaces his old one.

Mervat is a conservative woman as are most Gaza inhabitants, therefore her husband is photographed instead of her.

loans.use: to purchase a metal-cutting machine for her husband.

loans.name: Lugendo Group

texts.en:
Robert, who is in his mid 20s, is single.  He has been running a library business and a barber shop and selling music on telephones for three years now.  He works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to increase his business by buying more CDs, DVDs, VCDs and to buy one more shaving machine. His dream is to one day be able to buy land of his own.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Lugendo," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase on business  by buying more CDs, VCDs, DVDs and to buy one more shaving machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. She has a business selling sugar and maize flour in Jigomoni Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan she will use to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and flour to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, a 20-year-old young mother of two children. has been buying and selling bananas for four years to serve the daily needs of her family. Despite her young age, Rowena is proficient in life, working hard to ensure that her children avoid making the mistakes she made, such as entering into an early marriage.

Seeking to continue her interrupted dreams through her children, she is requesting a loan of P7,000 to buy bananas, avocados and ginger as additional goods to sell every market day. The extra income will be allotted to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bananas, avocados and ginger as additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Sanabarhan's Group

texts.en:
Sanabarhan is the leader of this group. She is 36 and married to a construction worker whose monthly salary is 5000 soms. Together with her husband she brings up two daughters and two sons. The sons and the older daughter are at school and the second daughter is preschool age (under seven). Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 6000 soms, Sanabarhan started to sell dishes at the market. In this way she earns about 5000 soms per month. With the profits gained from the trade she purchased livestock for breeding. At the moment she keeps a cow and a calf.  With money received from the loan Sanabarhan wants to purchase two livestock animals for breeding, fattening and further reselling. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La señora Jesusa, se encuentra casada, y tiene 4 hijo de los cuales solo 3 viven con ella. Su esposo y su hijo viven en el departamento de Santa Cruz. La señora Jesusa solo mantiene a sus 3 hijos.
Ellos viven por la zona de la Maica Sud,una zona periferica de la ciudad de Cochabamba donde se dedica a la venta de leche cruda y ademas se encarga de cuidar el tanque de enfriamiento que hay en zona, por lo que los vecinos le pagan de forma mensual.
Jesusa cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganado lechero, y esta leche ella lo vende a su vecina para que pueda entregar a la Planta Industrializadora de leche Pil Cochabamba.
La Sra Jesusa requiere el credito para poder pagar un anticretico para un terreno donde siembra alfa, el cual le servira de alimento para sus vacas. Asi sus animales podran producir mas leche, y mejorar sus ingresos y poderles dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jesusa is married and has 4 children. Only 3 of them live with her. Her husband and son live in the department of Santa Cruz. Jesusa only supports her 3 children.  

They live in the area of Maica Sud, an area on the outskirts of the city of Cochabamba. She sells raw milk there, and she also is the caretaker of a cooling tank in the area, which her neighbors pay her for every month.

Jesusa has 4 heads of dairy cattle and she sells the milk to her neighbor who delivers it to the Pil Cochabamba Milk Industrialization Plant.
Jesusa needs the loan to be able to pay for a plot of land where she grows alfalfa to feed her cows. This makes her animals produce more and will improve her income so she can giver her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make payments on a plot of agricultural land

loans.name: Revilla

texts.en:
Revilla is 39 years old, married and has one child. Revilla works very hard to provide for her family.

Revilla runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Revilla has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Revilla would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: 02.02.07 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiệp works in agriculture- farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sales.

Hiệp is 61 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a seven member group, the 07 Đông Hải solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Hiệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiệp has successfully repaid three loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiệp has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Hiệp faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiệp hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Jean Bosco is 39 years old, married and has three children, only one of whom goes to school. Jean Bosco, who has been selling fish for eight years, has requested this loan to buy more fish to sell. He wishes to use the new profits to reinvest in the business so that he can become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza, 28, lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children.

Eliza has a karaoke shop that provides entertainment, with customers paying 5 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per song. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for the electricity of the service.

Eliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity of her service.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Edison planned to expand his corn farming business to increase his yields and income to support his family's needs. He is a farmer who has four school-age children. He wants to continue sending them to school to earn a degree and become professionals someday. Although farming is a difficult business to manage, but through patience and sacrifices he can able to earn enough and support his family. 

To work out his plan, Edison is asking for additional capital of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay for the labor cost required in planting corn. He is hoping that this loan will help him to increase his yields this coming harvest season and believes that his patience and hard work will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay for the labor cost required in planting corn.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman with three children. She is 29 years old and resides at Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Conchita owns and operates a vegetable farm, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month she earns 7,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Conchita has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Conchita wants to make improvements to her house and to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sisilia

texts.en:
Sisilia is a 40-year-old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is married and has six children between the ages of 25 and five.  All of them go to school. 

Sisilia runs a food store business, and she has been in the business for six years. She has one employee. Sisilia heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients, and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase food items like cabbages, eggs, oranges, carrots and many others to sell. In addition to this business; Sisilia has no other source of income.

In five years time, Sisilia would like to increase the business size, to have a good store. Her major challenges include, issues of school fees and home expenses. 

Sisilia says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially for women, for helping them with capital to start up a small scale of business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like cabbages, eggs, oranges, carrots and many others for her food store.

loans.name: Hauda

texts.en:
Hauda is a 25-year-old Lebanese woman. She is engaged, and she lives with her parents and her one sibling. Her parents pay for all of her family's expenses.

In 2009, Hauda started to work as hair dresser from her home. She has customers from all over the neighboring villages. She explains that her customers are loyal and believe in her beautiful and fashionable style.

Currently, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new cosmetic products, which she feels will increase her job productivity by 30%. In the future, she plans to request more Kiva loans so that she can expand her business and provide even better services.

loans.use: to increase her productivity by purchasing new cosmetic products

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is from the village of Shirak in Armenia.  She is married with two children – a 20-old-daughter and a 22-year-old son.  Ruzanna has a high school education.  She just recently moved to the village of Shirak from the city of Gyumri and has been farming for the past three years.  She is a hardworking person and dreams of owning her own bakery one day.  She is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fuel.  This investment should increase the family income by fifteen percent.  As Ruzanna is saving for her bakery, she is keeping her debt below twenty-five percent of her invested equity in the business.  She likes living in Shirak surrounded by good friends and relatives.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fuel

loans.name: Akam Divine

texts.en:
He is married with one child and they all live in a one-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced many challenges in life among which are the death of both parents which caused him to drop out of school, insufficient finances to successfully manage his business, and the inability to educate his child.

With this new loan he has requested, he will buy provisions store items such as sweets, chewing gum, and vegetable oil. He will buy Maggi, pens, and notebooks. He will also invest part of the loan in the credit transfer business, which means he will buy credit cards for resell. Part of the loan will be used to pay rent, and the rest will be used to transport the items from the market where he purchases them to the retail site. 

He holds a positive view of this business succeeding because he has been involved in  this business for the past seven years and with the experience gained over the past years, he is very sure to obtain maximum profit from the business. With this business activity, the community will have a regular source of provision items.

With the profit from this loan, he will educate his child, provide three square meals to his family, cater for his child's medication and provide other necessities to his family. He will also expand his business. He prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals, together with the training offered to members at GHAPE meetings.

loans.use: to buy items for a provision store like bonbons, biscuits, pens, and credit cards.

loans.name: Chrisnal

texts.fr: Chrisnal est âgé de 30 ans. Il est marié et père d’un jeune enfant. Pour trouver de quoi prendre soin de sa famille, il revend des articles divers. Il demande ce prêt pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use: augmenter son stock

loans.name: Allahverdy

texts.en:
Allahverdy has been engaged in this business since 2003. Before he rented this tea-house. Having borrowed the loan amount of $400he bought tea-pots, chairs, tables and this tea-house. He has a lot of clients. His tea-house is a small and he wants to expand the area of his place. All in Absheron region talk about the taste of his tea. Clients have rest over a traditional cup of refreshingAzerbaijani tea in his tea-house. His tea help to people to forget about their problems.
Now he needs the loan amount of $1000 to expand the area of his tea-house. 
He supports to his family with this business. 
He is 52, married, has 3 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam region Etyemezli village. He settled with his family in Absheron region.

loans.use: To expand the area of his tea-house

loans.name: Babacar

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten members of the Dioubo association, led by Babacar S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The Dioubo group is located in the village of Palmarin. Composed of people motivated by a common desire, the Dioubo group aims to unite its members in order to contribute to the development of the abovementioned village. The Dioubo group has adopted the following objectives: to improve the living conditions of its members, to ease the burden of housewives, and to reduce poverty. Our business activities consist of purchasing fresh fish that we will process, dry and sell in the local market and elsewhere in the departement of Mbour.”

Original French business description:

« Le groupement Dioubo est un groupement de l’éco village de Palmarin. Réunissant des gents animés d’une même volonté, le groupement Dioubo se propose d’unir ces membres afin de pouvoir contribuer au développement dudit éco village. Le groupement Dioubo s’est fixé des objectifs suivants : Améliorer les conditions de vie de ces membres Alléger le panier de la ménagère Réduire la pauvreté Activités :Il s’agit d’acheter de la matière (du poisson frais) que l’on va transformer, sécher et le vendre dans le marché local et ailleurs dans le département de Mbour.»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish, knives and other equipment for producing dried fish

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married and has four children, who are 5, 14, 18, and 21 years old. The family has gone through serious economic problems because the salary her husband earns is too little for them to be able get out of their debts. Two years ago, Elvira began to make and sell flour tortillas to her neighbors and acquaintances. Since it is a food that is eaten a lot in the north of Mexico, she has had good demand and has managed to attract many customers.

Elvira now needs a loan of $250.00, which she will use to buy ingredients she needs to increase her production, and to cover the orders from her customers. She promises to return the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. You can help improve the quality of life for this family by contributing to the growth of this business. Thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvira es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, 5, 14, 18 y 21 años de edad. Su familia pasaba por serios problemas económicos porque el salario que recibe su esposo es muy bajo y para poder salir de sus deudas Elvira comenzó a hacer y vender tortilla de harina entre sus vecinos y conocidos desde hace dos años, como es un alimento muy consumido en el norte de México, ha tenido una buena demanda y ha logrado tener muchos clientes.

En estos momentos, Elvira necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que necesita para incrementar su producción y poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Kouame

texts.en:
Mrs Kouame N. K. is 48 years old. She is married and has 8 children. She lives in Treichville, a popular commercial district in the south of Abidjan. She sells agricultural products wholesale in the Treichville open-air market.

Ms. K. wants to go to the western region of Cote d’Ivoire in order to purchase a stock of yams as it is the production season in that area. This will substantially improve her profit margin and thus her income. Ms.K., whose husband is retired from his job as a secretary at the Ministry of Transport, is presently the main bread-winner for her family.

loans.use: purchase a stock of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in the materials necessary for sandal making

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy I. is 35 years old and married with 4 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells foodstuff and has been in this business for 7 years.  She is requesting a loan of $550 to enable her to buy more foodstuff to sell.  She is currently a LAPO member.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tea farming business.

loans.name: Kabowa 2(B) Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 29 years old and married with four children. She runs a small retail shop where she sells various items to the residents of her village. She plans to use the extra income made possible by this loan to buy a refrigerator and pay her rent. Sarah, Julliet and Rose all sell raw foodstuffs in the market, and like Agnes, want to acquire new items to sell. They will pay pay school fees for their children with the extra money they make from selling these items.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses by buying new items to sell.

loans.name: Xiomara's Group

texts.en:
Xiomara G. M. is the leader of a group of six women who own and operate different businesses in the Altagracia community of Santo Domingo. Xiomara has four children, three boys and a girl, all of whom attend school.

“A good education ensures a better future for poor people,” says Xiomara, as she explains the main reason why she is struggling to support her children's studies.

This entrepreneur will use her loan to buy fuel and other supplies for her husband’s business. Her husband uses his motorcycle as a taxi and offers his services to people in the surrounding areas.

The other members are:

  • Julisa S. L., who will use her loan to invest in the purchase of cloth and other materials to make pillows, cushions and bedspreads for her seamstress shop.

  • Teresa Claribel C. F., the owner and operator of a beauty salon.

  • María Magdalena F. S. and Maria Rosa B. M., who sell beauty products to women of their community.

  • María Oneyda A. U., who plans to use her loan to supply her grocery store.

NOTE: Members of this group warrant each other’s loans. If one of the members fails to repay her loan, the other members must take responsibility for it.

loans.use: To buy fuel and supplies for a motorcycle taxi business

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam I. is married with 2 children. She is 37 years old and has been in business since 2004. She sells building materials and spent years learning the trade. She is from Edo State. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more building materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy building materials for sale

loans.name: Teresa Mercedes

texts.es:
Teresa belongs to the the “Las Azucenas 2” comunal bank, wich is located in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old and is the mother of five grown children. Her husband is electrician. With the first loan of S/. 300.00 that she received from Manuela Ramos, Reyna decided to invest in a business selling food.

In the afternoon she sells items from a menu, and in the evening she sells salchipapa (a dish maD. with potatoes and sausage). With her children’s help, they prepare the foods and share in the housekeeping duties.

With this loan of S/. 1,400.00, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy: a cart from which to sell the salchipapas, soft drinks, and other ingredients for her foods.

Teresa is very happy and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos because it is of great support to her and has taught her many values.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Jr. Contamina 183, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años y es madre D. 5 hijos mayores D. edad, su esposo es electricista. Teresa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. comida. En la actualidad en las tardes venD. menú y en las noches salchipapas, con la ayuda D. sus hijos se dedican a la preparación D. sus comidas y se reparten las tareas domesticas del hogar. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,400 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: un carrito salchipapero, gaseosas, y víveres para sus comidas. Teresa esta muy contenta, Le agradece a Manuela Ramos por que es un gran apoyo para ella y le enseña muchos valores.

loans.use: To buy a food vending cart and ingredients for the foods she makes

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana M. is a 50-year-old married mother who lives in the Hialeah neighborhood and has a 7-year-old son. Her husband supports her with this business, but at night he works as a security guard.

Mrs. M. has been selling scrap metal for a living for a year. She used to sell curd and fried food, but her sales decreased day to day, so she decided to change her business.

With this loan, she plans to purchase iron and aluminum so that she can sell it at a good price that allows her to yield better profits. She would like to increase her sales and consequently improve her home’s condition.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Juana M. tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah III etapa, es casada y tiene un hijo de siete años de edad. Su esposo le apoya en este negocio, pero por la noche se dedica a ser guarda de seguridad.

El negocio de doña Juana es la venta y compra de chatarra, ya tiene un año de tener el negocio, ella anteriormente vendía cuajada y fritos pero sus ventas día a día disminuyeron y optó por cambiar de negocio.

Con el dinero que le presten va a comprar hierro, y aluminio y vender a un mejor precio ya que le permite un mejor margen de ganancia. Desea incrementar sus volúmenes de venta y así mejorar las condiciones su casa.

loans.use: Purchase iron and aluminum

loans.name: Ulugbeck

texts.en:
Ulugbeck M. has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but he has already been a successful borrower. A previous loan helped him to improve his business and increase his income. Mr. M. lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. He is engaged in the family livestock business. Mr. M. has cows and a bull, as well as some rams. He has 25 years’ experience in the livestock business. He also works on the collective farm.

Now Mr. M. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of $775 US for 6 months so he can purchase one additional pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To purchase one additional pedigreed bull

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
N. Muhabbat is 47 years old. She’s married and the loving mother of 4 children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Muhabbat is sells shoes for women and kids in the local market. She has been in this business for 3 years. Like any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need and dreams that all of them shall have a higher education.

Because goods such as shoes for women and kids have good demand regardless of the season of the year, Muhabbat's business is stable and generates considerable income, allowing Muhabbat to support her family. Now Muhabbat needs to increase her working capital to be able to purchase summer shoes. For this she requests 1000 USD for the term of 12 months. Muhabbat thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be timely in her loan payments.

loans.use: Increase working capital to purchase new shoes

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng M. lives in Sarekakeo Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Soy Heang, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. He also helps his wife on the plantation when he has free time. The couple has six children; one is employed in the garment factory; three are attending school; two are too young to work or study and remain at home.

Mrs. Heng M. is requesting a loan to add to her savings and purchase cows to plow her rice fields. This will improve her crop production. Mrs. Heng M. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy cows to plow the rice field and improve crop production

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, tiene 61 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Martha II”, que a pesar de su edad desea tener un puesto para poder vender todas las polleras (vestimenta típica de la región), aunque afirma que la salud ya no le permite coser como antes lo hacía. Su esposo la abandonó con sus 4 hijas pequeñas. Vive en el malecón norte del Río Quillcay s/n, distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz. En dicho lugar elabora afanosamente los trajes típicos, elaborando mandiles, fustanes y polleras.

María logró crecer en el negocio. Ha comprado cuatro máquinas de coser y una remalladora que ahora, con tristeza, no sabe quién utilizará sus herramientas ya que ninguna de sus hijas ha deseado practicar su oficio. Los jueves vende en la av. Raymondi, los días de feria vende en la ciudad de Huaraz.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, adquirirá telas, blondas y ovillos para continuar la producción.
texts.en:
Maria, is 61 years old, a member of the "Señor de Martha II" Communal Bank. Despite her age she wants to have a stand to be able to sell all her skirts (traditional regional clothing), although she says her health no longer allows her to sew as she did before. Her husband abandoned her and left her with 4 small daughters. She lives on the jetty north of Río Quillcay, in the Independence District, in the Province of Huaraz. In that place she painstakingly makes traditional attire, aprons, slips and skirts. Maria managed to grow the business. She has purchased four sewing machines and an overlock. Sadly enough, she does not know who will use her tools as none of her daughters wanted to practice her craft. Thursday’s she sells on Raymondi Avenue, on fair days she sells in the city of Huaraz. With a loan of S /. 300, which will be repaid in four months, she will acquire fabrics, lace and yarn to continue production.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, lace, yarn, etc.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty F. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through the Junior High level. Beauty sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen, processes and preserves them at home, and then sends them to the market at Enyaaye near Elmina. She has done this since 1988. Her husband is a policeman. Beauty uses her income to help pay for the children's school fees and other utility bills. Beauty will use the loan to purchase more fish for processing. With the profits from her expanded business, Beauty plans to help her husband to start building a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 35 años de edad es casada, madre de 05 hijos, no asistió a la escuela y vive en el C.P. Poccona del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno.nnHace 04 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” – Yunguyo con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital para poder comprar habas. A los 25 años de edad empezó con este negocio de venta de granos de la región junto a su esposo  quien la acompaña a vender los días jueves y domingos en el Mercado 15 de Agosto de Yunguyo. Ella no puedo estudiar por que su papa la abandono muy pequeña y tuvo que apoyar a su mama a trabajar.nnCon el crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles que solicitara y que pagara en 04 cuotas comprará  01 saco de habas (granos).nnSu mayor deseo es apoyar a sus hijos  y continuar con su negocio.n
texts.en:
Elena is 35 years old, married and the mother of five children. She did not attend school, and lives in the Yunguyo-Puno province of the district of Yunguyo. She has been a member of the communal bank for four years. Her first loan of 300.00 soles increased her capital so she would be able to buy beans. At 25 years of age, she started in this business of selling regional grains together with her husband who accompanies her to sell on Thursdays and Sundays at the 15th of August market in Yunguyo. She could not continue her education because she was abandoned by her father at a young age, and had to help her mother by working. With the loan of 500.00 soles that she is requesting, and which she intends to pay in 4 installments, she will buy 1 sack of beans. Her greatest wishes are to support her children and to continue with her business.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beans at wholesale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del BC. “Las Violetas II“, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Rioja, distrito de Nueva Cajamarca. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, bebidas gasificadas y útiles escolares. Su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Bolognesi Nro 300 del mismo distrito. 

Con este crédito de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en bolsas, leche, aceite en cajas, detergentes, jabones y útiles de limpieza en general, gaseosas y golosinas diversas para surtir su negocio y cubrir las expectativas de sus clientes. 

La señora Gloria tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con su nieta a quien está criando con apoyo de su hija. Su meta es mantener su negocio bien surtido para garantizar sus ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of Las Violetas II Community Bank. She lives in the Nueva Cajamarca district, Rioja province, in the region of San Martín. She sells groceries, soft drinks and school supplies. She runs her business out of her home, on Bolognesi No. 300.

With this $650 loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, detergent, soaps and general cleaning supplies, and a range of soft drinks and candy to keep her shop stocked and keep her customers happy.

Gloria is 46 years old and lives with her husband and her granddaughter, who she is raising with the help of her daughter. Her goal is to maintain a varied stock so as to ensure sales and meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, detergent, soap. cleaning supplies, soft drinks and candy

loans.name: Mohammad Nasim

texts.en:
Mohammad Nasim is 27 years old and he lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan.  His house is near the Afghan Hotel.  He is single and has a shop in which he sells different kinds of things like drinks, cookies and so on.

He has requested an individual loan of 7000 Afghans for a term of 12 months to complete his stocks and to attract more customers to his business because he is new to this business and wants to buy some other things for his shop.

Nasim is very happy with this loan of Kiva, and especially for the AFSG, which helps poor people, and thanks to all lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stocks and grow his business

loans.name: Thee

texts.en: Mrs. Thee E. is a villager in Tuol Kandaul Thboung village in Kampong Cham province. She is a Khmer noodle seller, while her husband, Mr. Phem Ken, is a construction worker. Since his work place is far from the house, he usually pays a great deal of money for a motorbike taxi to get to work. Thus, Mrs. Thee E. decided to seek a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband and reduce their overall transportation expenses. She is 37 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation to work

loans.name: Osahon

texts.en: Osahon is 39 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. He sells medicine to people in his community. He has been in this business for a long time and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. Osahon hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Bou T. is 46 years old and resides with her husband in the Prey Veng province. She and her husband sell utensils and, together, make about US$4 per day. This couple has two school-aged children. Mrs. Bou T. would like to take out a loan to expand her utensil inventory to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To expand her utensil inventory.

loans.name: Laylo

texts.ru: Лайло занимается куплей продажей косточек от абрикосов на местных рынках Исфары. Оборот ее бизнеса небольшой, но Лайло работает над тем чтобы увеличить свой бизнес. Лайло 39 лет, имеет 3 детей, ее муж находится на заработках в России. В МикроИнвест Лайло пришла недавно и узнав про условия кредитования решила подать заявку на займ. Первая сумма небольшая и если понравиться то она дальше будет увеличивать суммы и надеется значительно расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Laylo purchases and sells apricot pits at the local markets of Isfara. Her turnover is not large, but Laylo is working on growing her business. Laylo is 39 years old, has 3 children and her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Laylo came to MicroInvest recently and after finding out about the credit terms decided to apply for a loan. Her first sum is small and if she likes it, she will further increase her loan amounts and hopes to significantly expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Née en 1947 à Dévikêmé, madame A. Akossiwa est mariée et mère de sept enfants. Elle est une revendeuse de bois, de bois de chauffage, de poissons depuis 20 ans. Soucieuse de sa responsabilité dans l’éducation de ses enfants, elle ne cesse de se débrouiller pour trouver un revenu stable capable d’assurer l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour couvrir tous ces besoins elle décide d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en sollicitant un financement.
texts.en:
Born in 1947 in Dévikêmé, Madame Akossiwa A. is married and has seven children. For twenty years she has sold wood, firewood and fish. Concerned about her responsibility for the education of her children, she is always striving for a steady income to ensure her children's prosperity. To cover her needs, she has decided to supplement her revenue by requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell wood and firewood

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Remi is 42 years old, married, and has two daughters. She sells eggs to people in her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN140,000 (USD 975) to purchase more eggs to sell. She promises to pay back her Kiva loan promptly and she says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea V. is 26 years old and a resident of Pursat Province where she has owned a plot of farmland since she was single. She grows rice and all kinds of vegetable crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother to one lovely young child. She is married to Than, age 26, who also work as a rice farmer with her.

Crop growing is Chea V.'s main source of income to sustain her family. Chea V. is applying for a loan to buy a cow to use for plowing the fields with the rest of the loan to purchase a plot of land for growing crops.

loans.use: To buy a cow to use for plowing the fields and maybe a plot of land

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A., 49 years old, is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. She tells us that one attends the junior high and the others are in the primary school. Agnes lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the family.

Agnes is a trader. She sells rubber and plastic products such as buckets, bowls, and cups, as well as metal pots, pans, etc. in her community. She sells her wares in a shop located at the market square. Agnes also journeys to other towns to sell on their market days. She buys her wares from Accra.

Agnes has been in business for over 23 years and is requesting a loan to buy goods in bulk so that she can increase her stock. She hopes to help her children attain advanced levels in their schooling.

loans.use: To buy plastic products in bulk for sale

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon P. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 34 years old and is single. To make a living, Maricon owns and operates an internet cafe' to local community members. Maricon has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maricon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Maricon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase materials needed to expand her services. Maricon is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be her third from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business. ------------------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Raquel Emperatriz

texts.es:
la sra. Raquel Emperatriz N. S. tiene 2 años de haber iniciado con el negocio de venta de pollo frito, mismo que opera bajo el nombre de POLLOS STEFANNY.
ella inicio el negocio en la casa de una de sus hijas y hace 8 meses lo instalo cerca de donde ella vive.
sus clientes la prefieren  por el buen sabor con que ella elabora el pollo, ella es casada pero su esposo vive en la ciudad capital Tegucigalpa por motivos de trabajo y cada fin de semana viaja para estar con su familia.
ella vive con su hijo, con los ingresos que su negocio le genera le ayuda a su esposo para el mantenimiento del hogar y los estudios de su hijo. ella nos comento que su meta es poder tener una pollera super grande en la cual pueda vender mucho todos los dias, ademas que el pollo es un alimento que se consume mucho en nuestro pais, ya que su precio de compra es mas bajo que la carne de res y es saludable el comerlo.
texts.en:
Raquel Emperatriz N. S. started her business of selling fried chicken two years ago. She started the business, which she calls Pollos Stefanny, in her daughter’s house. Eight months ago she set it up close to where she lives. Her customers prefer her because of the good flavor of her chicken. She is married, but her husband lives in Tegucigalpa due to his work. Every week end he travels to be with his family. She lives with her son. The income generated by her business helps her husband support the household and pay for their son’s education. Her goal is to be able to have a super big chicken store where she can sell a lot every day. Chicken is consumed a lot in her country. Its price is lower than beef, and it is healthy to eat it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken, oil, soft drinks, plates, salsas, paper, chili, condiments, and tortillas

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Mrs. Pheng U. lives in Brovong village in the Takeo province. She is a widow with a child who is 14 years old and still attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns a small field for cultivating rice. Since the local market is far from her house and she spends a lot of money a taxi, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her to travel in the local village.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her to travel in the local village

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal “21 de Febrero”, en el distrito de de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 5 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la educación secundaria  solo hasta 1er grado.  Vive en el Barrio Yaurima.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de compra de ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 900.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar ganado mayor para engorde.  La señora Nancy también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías (prendas de vestir).

Su deseo es  continuar trabajando y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Señora Nancy is a member of the February 21st Community Bank in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 33 years old, married, and has five children. She completed the first year of high school and lives in the neighbourhood of Yaurima. She has worked with Kiva Parner Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy young animals. She now needs a loan of 900 soles to buy livestock for fattening. Sra Nancy also earns her living by making handcrafted clothing. She would like to continue working as long as possible and to educate her children. Nancy likes being able to save with her bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces de Compañía.
Hilda es casada, tiene 51 años y 7 hijos, Hilda se dedica a la agricultura en sus tierras de la comunidad de Compañía, produce verduras que luego comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semillas y abono.

loans.use: Para la compra de semillas y abono.

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito is a tricycle operator for 16 years in their village in Barangcuag Angadanan, Isabela. He supported his family through his gained income from mere tricycle transport business. He is already 38 years old and married to Gina, a public school teacher in their village. They have one daughter, and she is already a nursery.  
  
He wanted to request for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 that will be utilize for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.  Jovito even maintain a farming business but most of the time, his time and efforts go to his transportation activities. He hopes that someday, he could able to give his family a better and successful living with the help of his chosen business for long years.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Santos Gregoria

texts.es:
la señora Santos Gregoria C. tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada con el señor anacleto Montoya Martinez, tienen 06 hijos dos dependen de ellos toda via y los otros cuatro ya se casaron,  Anacleto  dedica  a la agricultura y la señora Santos C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular tambien vende rosquillas los fines de semana, las ventas las realiza con los vecinos de la comunidad. 
Santos esta solicitando el  crédito para surtir su negocio ya que ahorita lo tiene vacio practicamente.
su sueño es que su hija se gradue y termine la universidad.

loans.use: compra de huevos, leche, manteca, arroz, frijoles, pan, azucar, cafe, galletas, sopas, churros, harina de maiz y trigo, tortillas, sal, consome de pollo, chiles, refrescos en polvo

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 25-year-old businesswoman who runs a tailoring shop in Embakasi village in Nairobi. She has been in this business for two years now. She is requesting a loan of Kes.35,000 after successful repayment of an earlier loan to add to her stock of fabrics and purchase an additional sewing machine. She hopes to own a well-stocked boutique as she imports clothes in bulk and this loan will go a long way in facilitating this vision. She describes herself as hardworking and determined. 



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to more than 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to her stock of fabric and purchase an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, de ocupación  mecánico tiene tres empleados con quienes trabaja en su taller  ubicado en su domicilio propio en la zona Luis Espinal Camps El Alto, su estado civil casado su esposa se ocupa de los quehaceres de la casa y cuidando al hijo de 6 meses de edad. 

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de Maquinaria para el taller de mecánica automotriz, de esa forma podrá incrementar su trabajo para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
 
Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Daniel.
texts.en:
Daniel is a mechanic who has three employees who work with him in his workshop, located in his own home in the Luis Espinal Camps El Alto zone. He is married and his wife takes care of the domestic chores at home and cares for their 6 month old son. The loan will be used to buy machinery for his auto-repair workshop, which will help him to increase his workload and satisfy the needs of his clients. This is Daniel's second loan with IMPRO, who evaluated him and approved his application for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of machinery

loans.name: Mach

texts.en: Mrs. Mach M. is a villager in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She breeds ducks for sale and her husband, Mr. Kaem Chhan, grows rice on a 2-hectare field. Mrs. Mach M. is requesting a loan to buy duck feed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing the rice field. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, of whom one  is employed in a garment factory, two attend the local school, and the youngest is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Ramila

texts.en:
Ramila applied to Kiva for a loan, the first time, to help her husband with his taxi business. You can see Ramila's husbandin the picture. She and her husband are very thankfull to Kiva for the loan, which they used for improving the taxi business. Now, Ahmadov's family needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 3 calves. This will be used for improving their cattle breeding business. 

Ramila is very excitied to look after the calves and she thinks that, with the cattle breeding business, she can help her husband to support their family.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves.

loans.name: Edhmie

texts.en: Edhmie T. is from the village of Danao. She is 23 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Edhmie owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She is just starting this business. In 2006, Edhmie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Edhmie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mary Akoth

texts.en:
Mary Akoth O. is in the business of selling clothes. She started this business back in the year 1985 and has never looked back since. She also considers herself as part of the business backbone of her country. She says this can be judged by her 15 years in business in Rongo market and the surrounding markets.

She is the mother of 5 children and a wife.  She would like a loan of Kshs. 40,000.

loans.use: Increase her clothing stock.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en: Abass is a 28-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon. Abass has owned a barber shop for nine years already. Abass requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to change the décor of his shop and purchase beauty products and tools. This is his second cycle, and he has always paid on time. Abass is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed tools for his shop. Abass decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work, because he learned it in an academy, and, more importantly, because he likes his job. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and tools

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana
texts.en:
Juana has already had two loans from FVP, both of which she repaid punctually, and both of which she used for home improvements.

She is requesting a loan to put-in the doors and windows for her house, as she is only lacking a few details like these and then the house will be finished. At this moment she does not have the capital necessary to be able to complete the improvements.

She wishes to fit the doors and windows as she has three small grandchildren and she wants her home to be better for their health. She plans to repay the loan with the income she gets from working as a maid in a private home. Her husband, Gerardo, takes care of the family expenses with the income from his food-selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Putting-in doors and windows

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 35 year old, married man with one child. 

He has been operating a computer service business in Nairobi town for the past four years. As there are many people in the town center, he is in a very strategic position. His customers are mostly staff from the various offices in the town center. He offers typesetting and printing services. His wife Jane is also in business and they live in Cura which is on the outskirts of Nairobi town. 

Antony was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his first loan. He has no previous credit history with other microfinance institutions. He wants to use the money from this loan to buy another computer to improve the service he can offer to his customers.

Anthony hopes to open a computer training institute across Nairobi town. This will improve their living standard and he will be able to meet the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy another computer to improve his customer service

loans.name: Carmen Isaura

texts.es:
Carmen Isaura L. M. tiene 36 años, es casada, y  tiene cuatro hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Carmen trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son papas, maíz, cebada y trigo además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como vacas, borregos, gallinas, cuyes y chanchos los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Carmen le gusta caminar y ver la televisión.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Carmen Isaura L. M. is 36 years old, is married and has 4 children. She lives in the Guaranda area in the province of Bolívar.

The member is part of a small rural Group Enmanuel; it is in an area some 45 minutes from, Cantón Guaranda, capital of the province of Bolívar. There are 17 members in total, it is in a farming and cattle community, they are indigenous and all speak Quechua.

Carmen works in agriculture to increase the household earnings. The crops that she grows most are potatoes, corn, barley, and wheat. Moreover, she breeds animals in her home like cows, lambs, chickens, cuyes (a hamster-like animal) and pigs. The products she sells at home and what she grows she sells in the wholesaler market of Guaranda.

The main culture is the carnival that is celebrated every year in February. Carmen also enjoys walking and watching television.

The member needs the loan to buy products for her field work, mostly fertilizers and manure. Her goal is to have a good source of income for her family. The problems that she has to face are climate related and the diseases that hurt her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Edwing Otoniel

texts.es: El  Sr. Edwin Otoniel E. García   su actividad es trabajar con oro, plata   el tiene cinco  años de  trabajar con este rubro, es padre de tres hijos en edad escolar, es casado actualmente. Es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL  lo utilizo para mejora de su casa y este préstamo ahora lo  quiere para utilizarlo en la compra de oro y plata para ampliar y mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Edwin Otoniel E. García works with gold and silver. He has worked in this field for five years. He has three school age children, and he is currently married. He used his first loan with Ceprodel to improve his house. He wants to use this loan to buy gold and silver to expand and improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to work with gold and silver

loans.name: Perpetuah

texts.en:
Perpetuah W. is a 30-year-old single mother of two children. Perpetuah sells motorbike spare parts in Shanzu, Mombasa, an area where motorbikes are in high demand for transportation purposes. Perpetuah has been selling spare parts for three years and her business is a success. 

This is Perpetuah's first loan from KADET. With the money, she plans to purchase motorbike spare parts for her store in Shanzu. Her main customers are area residents and motorbike operators in Shanzu. She hopes to become a prosperous businesswoman in Mombasa.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike spares parts

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el anexo La Zorra del caserío Arbolsol, un área rural del distrito de Mórrope, conocido en la región por tener a su población dispersa en varios sectores que distan mucho una de la otra, la mayoría de ellas son consideradas como zonas pobres, el distrito pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y el sector se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde que se casó, ella cría animales menores en la parte exterior de su domicilio, especialmente chivos y ovejas, cuando estos ya ha alcanzado un buen desarrollo los venden a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar para adquirir animales y revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. El negocio goza de buena acogida en la zona y le sirve para ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía de su familia.

Antonia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales y alimento balanceado para darles una crianza de calidad y asi poder obtener mas ingresos, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Antonia es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que siempre ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir ayudando a su esposo a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella es muy conocida y estimada por los vecinos del lugar en donde vive.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 49-year-old housewife who lives with her family in the La Zorra annex of the hamlet of Arbolsol. It's a rural area of the Morrope district, known in the region for having a scattered population, where one group lives far from the other. The majority of the groups are considered poor. The district is part of the Lambayeque province, which is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Antonia has been raising and selling animals since she got married. She raises small animals just outside her home, especially goats and sheep. When they are grown, she sells them to the businesspeople who always visit the area to buy animals that they will sell again in Chiclayo. Her business is well received in the area and allows her to help her husband provide for the family. Antonia wants to grow her business by buying more animals and good feed for them so that she can raise quality livestock and earn more money. Because of this, she needs to get her first loan for 1500 nuevos soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa, which will help her meet her goals. Antonia is a hard working woman who has always fought to help her family get ahead. Her greatest longing is to continue helping her husband improve the family's quality of life. She is very well known and esteemed among her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals and feed

location.town: Anexo La Zorra - Caserío Arbolsol - Morrope - Lamb

loans.name: Leyla Marina

texts.es:
la señora Leyla Marina A. tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Jose de la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle. vive en union libre con el Sr. Edwin N., el se dedica al negocio de transporte de personas.

la señora Leyla tiene una pulperia en su casa, esta ubicado en un buen lugar, muy transitado.
el credito lo utilizara para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su nagocio mas, ya que cada dia que pasa su negocio esta creciendo igual sus clientes y tiene que tenerlo bien surtido para complacer todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
su sueño es tener un mercadito bien equipado.
texts.en:
Leyla is 26 years old and lives in the San Jose neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo Valle. She lives with her partner, Edwin, who is in the business of providing personal transportation. Leyla runs a general store from her home. It’s in a good, well traversed location. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise to be able to better stock her business. It grows more each day, as does the number of her customers, so she needs to provide a wider assortment in order to meet her customers’ demands. She wants to have a well equipped market.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Livio

texts.es: Livio, de 34 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Trabajando muy duro, Livio ha logrado que sus chacras se vuelvan muy fértiles y productivas. Todos los días trabaja en sus campos agrícolas, haciendo que sus cultivos cada vez sean mejores. Lo cosechado lo lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde generalmente recibe muy buena paga. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar y verlos desarrollar, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hacia el mercado. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono e insecticidas para preparar y proteger sus tierras.
texts.en:
Livio is 34 years old and a cheerful hardworking gentleman. He lives in his own home and what he wants most is to improve his quality of life. Livio works extremely hard to make his land fertile and productive. Every day he works in his fields to make his crops better with each harvest. He sells his products at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where he generally receives a good price. Livio has been farming for 15 years and what he enjoys most is planting his crops and seeing them develop. However, he considers the most difficult part of his job to be transporting his products to market. Over time, he hopes to acquire new land to increase his production.

This is his second loan with MFP. He has been prompt in repaying his previous loans and hopes to do the same now. In his Communal Bank, he is a responsible member and is always aware of the agreements that have been reached in his group. With the loan of 1500 PEN that he requested, Livio will buy more compost and insecticides to prepare and protect his farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & insecticides

loans.name: Porn

texts.en:
Mrs. Porn O. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them for breeding and for slaughter. In addition, she distills white wine to sell and uses leftovers from the distilling process to feed the pigs. Porn O. has three kids who attend the local public school. Her husband is a farmer and sells firewood. 


Presently, Porn O.’s husband faces difficulties delivering chop-wood from the forest in that he always hires an animal when he needs transportation. To reduce this cost, Porn O. would like to buy a buffalo. This will alleviate the transportation problem in her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en: Ethel A., 40 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by engaging in a food vending business. She lives in Manapla, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 3 children. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Ethel is now borrowing PHP 9,500 so that she can use it as additional working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ethel aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza tiene su domicilio propio en la localidad de el torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, en el barrio Miraflores, es viuda, tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, su única fuente de ingreso es la venta de comida desde hace un año,  antes se dedicaba a l a venta de verduras en el mercado central de la comunidad, también cuenta con la renta que percibe por indemnización de parte de su esposo, el destino del préstamo es para terminar de construir en su vivienda y necesita comprar materiales para de construccion, como ser Cemento, loza, pintura, etc,  es clienta antigua de nuestra institución, por lo cual se siente agradecida por el buen trato que se le ha brindado durante este tiempo.
texts.en:
Esperanza has her own house in the area of El Torno, which is 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz, in the Miraflores neighborhood. She is a widow and has two children who are school-age. Her only source of income is the food stand she has had for one year. Before that she sold vegetables in the central market of the community. She also receives a payment for indemnity for her husband’s death. The loan will be used to finish building her house and she needs to buy materials for construction, such as cement, floor tiles, paint, etc. She is a longstanding client of our institution and she feels grateful for the good treatment that has been shown her during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Maribel Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REAL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Maribel; ella tiene 44 años de edad y la socia es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista; La socia  es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy arriesgada, ella tiene tres negocios, ella comenzó con una tienda abarrotes y venta de regalos en su casa, la cual aún sigue teniéndola pero la administra su familia, La socia también a su vez puso dos locales de venta de ropa para bebes y niños en el barrio de magisterio una de ellas y el otro negocio de venta de ropas para bebes y niños en el centro comercial Cusco; La socia apuesta en sus tres negocios y sin duda ella sabe porque lo hace es una mujer que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y poco a poco lo está logrando, La socia viaja cada 15 días a la ciudad de Lima para traer su mercadería y también viaja a Bolivia donde encuentra más barato los peluches, y ropas para niños. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y venderla.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the "REAL" community bank. She lives in the Santiago district of the province and department of Cusco. Maribel is a 44-year-old single mother with three children. She both takes care of the home and works as a small trader. She is a hardworking and daring woman. She has three businesses. She started with grocery and gift shop out of her home, which still operates under her family's administration. She also has two locations where she sells clothes for babies and children, one in the Magisterio neighborhood and one in the Cusco shopping center. She is well-positioned in her three businesses and clearly knows what she is doing. She is a woman who very much wants to get ahead, and little by little she is getting there. Every 15 days she travels to Lima to pick up her merchandise, and she also goes to Bolivia, where she can find stuffed animals and baby clothes more cheaply. She is seeking this loan to buy and sell her merchandise. Maribel appreciates and thanks you for the credit being given, since it will allow her to grow and to have a better quality of life. She promises to make regular repayments to the loan in the time indicated.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her businesses

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es casada, tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Mercedes tiene una panadería en su casa, su horno es rustico de leña, elabora panes típicos, sus productos los reparte a las tiendas de su barrio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de personal por las noches. Además Mercedes tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, hace algunos meses construyo el segundo piso de casa con ahorros y prestamos que obtuvo.
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras y solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de leña.
Mercedes sueña son comprar maquinas para hacer todo tipo de panes.
texts.en:
Mercedes is married and has got 3 children that are in school. She has a bakery in her house and a rustic, wood-fire oven. She makes typical bread and then distributes her products to neighborhood stores, an activity that she accomplishes with help at night. In addition, Mercedes has a grocery store in her home. A few months ago, with savings and loans that she received, she added a second floor to her house. She is a member of the Communal Bank Obreras and is applying for a loan of 1000 soles to use towards the purchase of firewood. Mercedes dreams of buying machines so that she can make all different types of bread.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Mrs. Hin O., 56, is married to Suy Kem, 60, and they have four children. Two of the children are married and live independently while the other two are single and live at home.

Hin O. owns a milling machine that she uses to provide a service to her neighbors. Usually, she mills rice for the dual purpose of charging fees and getting bran. In addition, she raises a few pigs and crops in her village.

Hin O. has a daughter who is single and who wants to become a grocery trader but doesn’t have enough money to make that possible. This is why Hin O. has requested a loan for her daughter to use to build a grocery store where she will sell items.

loans.use: To enable her daughter to build a grocery store

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano tiene 49 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y desde que se ha casado ha heredado los terrenos que le correspondían. En la actualidad trabaja ininterrumpidamente en la siembra y cosecha de papa y maíz, su esposa siempre ha sido el principal apoyo al igual que sus hijos, ya que esta actividad requiere de mucho esfuerzo y solo no se da abasto. Manifiesta además que le agrada trabajar en el campo porque es tranquilo, pero sabe que todo esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo la recompensa a ello, es buena. Por ello seguirá trabajando en esta actividad con miras de mejorar su producción.
