Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono y semillas.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 49, lives with his wife and three children in his own house. From childhood on he has been a farmer and since he got married he inherited the fields that were rightfully his. He works uninterruptedly farming potatoes and corn. His wife has always been his main helper as have been his children since this activity requires much effort and he wouldn’t be able to do it all by himself. He states that he likes working in the fields because it’s tranquil but he knows that all the effort he puts into his work will yield good rewards. Therefore, he will continue working in this activity aiming to improve production. This is his first loan with MFP. He is happy to know that he can count on financial support. He is also pleased to be part of a communal bank because all the members are people known to him and they are responsible and mutually supportive. He is grateful to all those who will fund the loan he is requesting that will be so useful for his continued progress. He will use the requested funds to buy manure and seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and seed.

loans.name: Germelyn

texts.en:
Germelyn M. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Germelyn is married and has four school-aged children. Germelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling hardware products like toilet bowls and door knobs in the local community. Germelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Germelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Germelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Germelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 38 years old and is a single mother to four children: Josephine (19), Fredrick (15), Ageline (13) and Billy (11). She is from Kisumu.
Antonina has run a retail shop for the past eight years. She is applying for her third loan as she wants to buy 20 liters of salad oil, one sack of sugar, half a sack of rice and several crates of sodas. Her monthly income comes to 10,000 KES.
Antonina's desire is to have a big wholesale shop to supply both cereals and shop items at wholesale prices. She also hopes to purchase land to build a house for her children since she lives on her parent's homestead.

loans.use: To buy salad oil, sugar, soda and rice to add to stock

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.ar: مصطفى في عمر 43 سنة متزوج وعنده  ولدان يحب اولاده وعائلته كثيرا يعمل بجد ونشاط  لديه باص لنقل الطلاب  له في عمله ما يقارب 13 سنة يحب عمله ويسعى الى تطوير نفسه وتأمين كل احتياجات عائلته يريد من خلال اخذ قرض من المجموعة الى شراء فان جديد لتوسيع مصلحته  مستواه التعليمي متوسط لذلك يريد ان يحسن وضعه المادي والاجتماعي ومساعدة اولاده على استكمال تعليمهم زبائنه هم من جيرانه واصدقائه طموح وجدي جدا بعمله وملتزم من حيث تاريخه السابق مع  المجموعة.

loans.use: Wants to buy a new van for the expansion of interest

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny A., 44, is a professional handicrafts decorator, making US$1 each day in the Takeo province. She is married and has five children. Her husband, Phan Proek, makes approximately US$2 every day, selling coconuts.

Ny A. would like a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport coconuts.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.fr: Boniface R. est travailleur de la construction. Il a 53 ans, et il a 2 enfants entre 25 ans et 28 ans. Il va utiliser son pret pour le finissage de une maison d'habitation. Sa strategie pour la croissance de l'affaire est de construire des maisons modernes et chercher des locataires pour les maisons. Il voudrait que son lieu d'habitation sut efficace, et il voudrait aussi augmenter la mode de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Boniface R. is a construction worker. He is 53 years old and has two children aged 25 and 28. 

He intends to use his loan to finish building a dwelling house. His business growth strategy is to build modern homes and seek tenants to occupy them. 

He wants his own home to be functional, and also wishes to improve his family’s living conditions.



.

loans.use: To finish a dwelling house

loans.name: Suidumkan's Group

texts.en:
On December 13th 2010, high school and middle school teachers in several regions of Kyrgyzstan held protests against the Ministry of Education. Their main concerns were the low salaries being paid, which led to a lack of teachers in schools and a low quality education for students.  Why has one of the most important professions such as teaching become one of the least paid jobs?

Suidumkan B. is a leader of this group.   The low salary for teachers made it inevitable for her to start her own  business. In 2000, Suidumkan and her husband, a forester, applied for a loan at a local bank.  The 20,000 soms loan and some of her savings allowed Suidumkan to start a business in cattle breeding. The family business gave them the opportunity to purchase a car  – an old Russian “Jiguli”  model, which helped cut some  transportation expenses.  Unfortunately, 3000 soms of monthly income is too little, so they applied for this loan in order to purchase 12 heads of cattle.  

Suidumkan and her group is thankful to Kiva and all lenders, who are not indifferent to changing their lives. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase 12 heads of cattle

loans.name: Potrerillo 3 Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de Yeny Yuliana G. una integrante del grupo Potrerillo 3 que está ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz, en México. Se ve a las 9 integrantes del grupo en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada y asi sus ganancias aumentaran, al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente satisfecha. Tiene una hija, y espera obtener más ganancia para darle mejor vida a su hija.Luz del Rocio H., es la Tesorera del grupo, tiene bachillerato, es madre y tiene en total una hija. Ella se dedica a la venta de pollos rostizados que inicio hace 8 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar mas insumos para su negocio ya que es la temporada que vende más.
texts.en: This photo was taken at the home of Yeny Yuliana G. a member of the Potrerillo 3 group which is located in Veracruz State, in México. You can see the 9 members of the group in the photo. She sells clothes which she started doing 3 years ago. She is requesting the loan to buy clothes that are in season so that her profits will increase, at the time of requesting the loan she is feeling satisfied. She has a daughter, and hopes to earn greater profits to give a better life to her daughter. Luz del Rocio H.,is the group's Treasurer, she has a high school diploma, is a mother and has one daughter. She sells roast chicken which she started doing 8 years ago. She is requested the loan to buy more goods for her business as it is the season where she sells the most.

loans.use: Invest in their business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha K. lives in the Nakulabye Kiyaye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  

Aisha operates a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, working 7 days a week.  Aisha has requested loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves.  The main business challenges for Aisha include seasonality and competition.  Her goal/aspiration for her business is to own a bridal salon. 

Aisha lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy cream relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is an 18-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has worked in the car mechanics field for one year in order to save up a little money so he can enter the university. His father is the primary income provider of the family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l so he can pay his university fees to stay away from financial troubles with the administration. He is very positive about his future education plans and hopes to meet his desired goals.

loans.use: pay his university fees

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en:
Bryan E. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 28 years old. Bryan is single and has two infant children. To make a living, Bryan owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services to local community members. Bryan has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Bryan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bryan is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for maintanence. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Bryan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for maintenance

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Nob is the wife of Veng. This couple has four children, one of whom is a chef, one is a farmer, and the others are studying in the local public school. She is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where she can plant rice.  She sells some of the rice yield and uses the rest for her family.   Her husband is a construction worker.  His work place is far away from their home. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Nob is asking for a loan for a new motorcycle for her husband's transportation.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a widow with four children, all of whom graduated from school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is house rent. Hannah has operated a tailoring shop business for the past five years, selling to the local residents. In addition she also operated a second hand clothing  business which contributes to her other source of income. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase materials and start a charcoal selling business. She decided to join Yehu because of loan efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and start a charcoal selling business.

loans.name: Hiam

texts.en:
Hiam is a 33-year-old mother of five. She began a bridal salon from her home that has expanded so well she recently moved to a shop in her neighborhood. Hiam employs one woman and has gained a wonderful reputation in her village and surrounding area.

Hiam needs this loan to assist with expenses of moving to a shop outside her home. The funds are paying for additional dresses, decoration of the store and moving of her furniture and shelving.

Hiam wants to see her store continue to expand and eventually to hire more staff. She sees her business as creating a future without economic fear for her family.

loans.use: To cover costs associated with moving to a shop outside her home

loans.name: Hanny Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Hanny está conformado por la señora Crispina va a comprar una licuadora y arpillas de naranja para sus jugos, la señora Dolores va a comprar papelería, la señora Silvestra va a comprar dulces por mayoreo, la señora Patricia va a comprar refrescos, verduras, carnes, gas, para surtir su negocio, la señora Erika va a comprar lencería para surtir su negocio.
Erika tiene 19 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er año de secundaria, ella es soltera tiene 2 hijos Ángel Adair tiene seis meses y Kevin Jesús tiene 4 años,  ella tiene su negocio de venta de lencería  y bisutería, ella solicito su crédito para invertir en su negocio va a comprar sostenes, camisetas, pantaletas, ropa interior para niños y para niñas, bolitas diademas etc. Ella inicio su negocio hace 1 año con un dinero que tenia de unas tandas (forma popular de ahorro en mexico), ella empezó vendiendo gelatinas, después decidió poner su local bien establecido de lencería, su negocio es importante porque de ahí sostiene a su familia a sus hijos, ella se siente orgullosa de su trabajo y de atender bien a sus cliente, además con éste negocio ella puede cuidar a sus hijos; ella quiere ampliar su negocio quiere vender ropa de bebé y lo piensa lograr con las ganancias de la lencería. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que sus hijos crezcan sin carencias y que les pueda dejar un terreno o una propiedad y darles un buen estudio. Las integrantes del grupo les quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos por brindarnos la oportunidad de ayudarnos a emprender un negocio, para mí que soy madre soltera porque a veces es bueno que alguien nos ayude porque a veces no podemos solas, muchas gracias”
texts.en:
The Hanny microfinance group is comprised of Ms. Crispina, who will purchase a blender and sacks of oranges to make juice; Ms. Dolores, who will purchase stationery; Ms. Silvestra, who will purchase candy in bulk; Ms. Patricia, who will purchase soft drinks, vegetables, meats, and propane for her business; and Ms. Erika, who will purchase lingerie to restock her business.

Erika is a 19-year-old who studied up to the third year of middle school. She is single and has 2 children: Angel Adair, who is 6 months old, and Kevin Jesus, who is 4. She sells lingerie and fashion jewelry for a living. She has requested this loan in order to purchase bras, camisoles, panties, undergarments for boys and girls, twin bead ponytail holders, headbands, etc. She started this business a year ago with the money that she had from a tanda--a rotating savings and credit association, which is a popular form of saving money in Mexico. She started out selling gelatin, then decided to launch a lingerie business. This business is very important because she supports her family with it. She feels very proud of her work and of her good customer service. Furthermore, she is able to take care of her children with this business. She wants to expand her business by selling baby clothes, and she plans on doing so with the profits from the lingerie sales. She hopes that her children grow up without want, and dreams that she can give them either a plot of land or a property, as well as a good education. The members of this group would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad that they are grateful for allowing them the opportunity to launch a business. Erika states, "For me, as a single mother, sometimes it is good receive help because at times, we cannot do it alone. Thank you."

loans.use: to purchase lingerie, bras, camisoles, and panties to restock her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently selling fish. She is 25 years old, married, and has four children who all go to school. Rose borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: El señor Agustín es productor lechero y también desempeña el trabajo de albañil y su esposa lo ayuda con las actividades agrícolas. Estas actividades son su principal fuente de ingresos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera para mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi del departamento de La Paz; es casado y tiene tres hijos. EL cliente con el crédito anterior pudo aumentar el ganado que tenia por lo cual se encuentra muy satisfecho y ahora pretende mejorar mucho más su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Agustin is a milk farmer and he also works as a construction contractor. His wife helps her with the agricultural activities. These businesses are their primary source of income. He requires the loan to purchase a dairy cow to improve their earnings. He lives in a house which he owns and it is located in the community of Achacachi in the department of La Paz. He is married and he has three children. With his previous loan he was able to increase his herd, for which is very satisfied. He now plans on improving significantly his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary requested a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She is 35 years old, married and has five children. Mary sells charcoal and hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: María Jose

texts.es:
La señora María José es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 34 años. Ella inicio en Adim con un grupo solidario llamado Cristhiam con el cual tuvo 7 ciclos de los cuales dos fueron kiva y ahora se gradúa al crédito individual. 
Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa y cosmético negocio que inicio hace cuatro años con poco capital con la compra de algunos cosméticos y que con los préstamos ha salido adelante.
La meta de María José es tener una miscelánea donde venda de todo un poco con los espacios distribuidos para ropa, cosméticos, adornos y confites. Mientras describía su rostros se ilumino como transportándose a ese lugar que un día no lejano llegara.
texts.en:
María José is a hardworking and enterprising 34 year-old woman.  She started with ADIM in a communal bank called "Cristhiam" which had 7 loan cycles, 2 of which were funded by Kiva.  Now she has graduated to taking credit on an individual basis.

Maria has a business selling clothing and cosmetics.  She started the business 4 years ago with a small amount of capital that she used to buy some cosmetics; with the loans she has been able to make progress with the business. 

Maria's goal is to have a general store where she could sell a little of everything, with spaces allocated for clothing, cosmetics, accessories and sweets.  While she describes it her face lights up as she is transported to this place that will someday soon exist.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “27 DE MAYO” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Susana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de api, costura, venta de comida, tejedora, venta de ganado, venta de chuño, venta de carne de cerdo.
 
La señora Susana,  indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación del promotor. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de api desde hace dies años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de harina y azucar (que servirá para la elaboración de pasteles de api), los que comprará de la feria de sábado de Batallas, y posteriormente lo venderá en La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud, por las campañas que realiza.
texts.en:
The May 27th Communal Bank is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Community Center. This group consists of 10 members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Susana. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different business such as selling “api” (a breakfast beverage made from corn), sewing, selling food, weaving, selling livestock, selling freeze-dried potatoes, and selling pork.

Sra. Susana says she joined Pro Mujer a year and a half ago after being invited by a promoter. She currently manages a business selling “api” that she started 10 years ago. Susana learned this trade from her mother.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to buy flour and sugar for making the pastries that are served with the “api”. She will buy her supplies at the Saturday fair in Batallas and then sell her products in La Paz. Working in this manner will generate income for Susana so that she can support her family. She is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Susana said that she enjoys the health services that are promoted through the organization’s wellness campaigns.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход проживает в Гиссарском районе. Женат. Детей не имеет. У него среднее образование. Более шести лет Фарход торгует в магазине. Кредит берет для расширения бизнеса, закупа арбузов и дынь.
texts.en: Farhod lives in the Gissar region.  He is married but has no children.  He has a secondary education.  He has worked in sales in a shop for more than six years.  He is taking out a loan to expand his business by buying watermelons and other melons.

loans.use: to buy watermelons and other melons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Elizabeth; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de accesorios para carros, ella vende aceites, tornillos, parabrisas, llantas entre otros repuestos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de accesorios para carros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos y accesorios para carros como tornillo, llantas y parabrisas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Santo Domingo". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Juana Elizabeth. She is 40 years old, single, and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her car accessories business. She sells motor oils, screws, windshield wipers, tires, and other spare parts. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm and it is through this business that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand her car accessories business. She requests a loan to purchase spare parts and accessories for cars, such as screws, tires, and windshield wipers in wholesale.

She is happy to have this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for cars, such as screws, tires, and windshield wipers in wholesale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, single and lives with three family members, two of whom work. 

Since 2009, Ali has been the owner of a cafeteria  where he prepares all kinds of drinks and foods. He has a good experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and his cafeteria is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for $3000 in order to renovate his cafeteria and to pay the annual rent and to buy grilling machinery. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his cafeteria and to pay the annual rent and to buy grilling machinery.

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en:
Borrower Zoljargal is a 28 year-old married woman who lives with her family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  She got a specialized Bachelors degree as a designer in 2010. Her sons attend a local secondary school and kindergarten. 

Her factory served as a workshop since 2006 and then become a company in 2010.   Today she is an owner of “Rose Fashion” company. Zoloo’s spouse helps to her by working as a manager of her company. 

Zoloo is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks loan from Kiva lenders for raw materials.  She intends to increase production before the end of this summer since large numbers of tourists are interested in Mongolian national clothes.

loans.use: to buy raw materials with the intention of increasing production

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory lives in the village of Sto. Domingo Alfonso Lista, a mountainous area in which there is a lot of corn farming. She is happily living with her husband and four children. Glory describes herself as an industrious and patient mother. 

Glory has been raising hogs for almost 10 years. According to her, the business has served as an income source for their daily needs and for the education of her children. Now, Glory is glad because her four children have finished their education.

Glory is looking for a loan of P5,000 to buy feed for her hog raising business. Since her children finished their education, Glory has wanted to develop her business, earn a higher income and save some money for financial security when she cannot work.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel, de 65 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Estelí, esta casado , es padre de 4 hijos, el es comerciante , se dedica a elaborar botas de cuero, su nivel académico es básico solo estudio hasta sexto grado de primaria. Cuando empezó con esta actividad a la edad de 15 años aprendió a elabora zapatos de niños, luego de adultos y después se especializo en botas vaqueras, es una actividad que disfruta mucho ,lleva ya 30 años en este negocio el cual lo ejerce de manera artesanal y con mucho carisma y esfuerzo. 
El solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima  tales como cuero, vaquetas, suelas, para elaborar botas vaquera y también quiere hacerle algunas mejoras a su hogar. Con esta inversión podrá comprar parte del material que necesita para trabajar, podrá elaborar diferentes estilos de botas y ofrecer una mejor calidad. Por lo pronto desea ampliar su negocio , quiere poner una tienda mas amplia de diferentes estilos de botas vaqueras.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel is 65 years old and lives in the city of Esteli. He is married and the father of 4 children. He is a businessman. He makes leather boots. He has a basic education having finished 6th grade in primary school. When he started learning the trade aged 15, he learned how to make girls' shoes, then adult shoes and later specialized in cowboy boots. It is a job he finds very enjoyable. He has been in this business for 30 years  and employs traditional methods as well as a lot of style and effort.

He is asking for the credit to buy raw materials such as leather, cowhide soles, soles to make his cowboy boots. He also wants to make some improvements to his house. With this investment he will be able to buy some of the materials he needs to work. He will be able to create different styles of boots and provide a better quality product. For now, he wants to expand his business. He wants to open a bigger shop that offers cowboy boots of different styles.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather, cowhide soles, soles to make cowboy boots and to make a few improvements to his house.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is a very supportive lady who works with her husband to run a business selling thread rolls. She sells her product to thread sellers in her local market and her work supplements her family’s income. Bashiraan has two daughters and a son. Her son is a mason and her daughters stay at home and do housework. 

Bashiraan is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to expand her family business and buy rolls of thread in bulk to sell to customers. She is hopeful that this loan will make their business more profitable by increasing sales and profits.

Note: "In the photo, one of the members has decoration pieces selling business thats why they are holding decoration pieces".

loans.use: to buy rolls of thread

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 54 years old. She is married with three children. 

Vicenta raises hogs which she then sells. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional feeds for the hogs. 

Vicenta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Vicenta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for the hogs, which are intended for selling.

loans.name: Hotamchon

texts.ru: Хотамчон проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Хотамчон имеет высшее образование, он работал прорабом. Сейчас Хотамчон таксист. Он предоставляет услугу. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 2 года. Кредит берет для оплаты за обучения сына.
texts.en: Hotamchon lives in the Rudaki district.  He is 41 years old, married and has four children.  Hotamchon has a higher education and used to work as a foreman.  Currently, Hotamchon is a taxi driver and provides a service.  He has been involved in this business for two years.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his son's education.

loans.use: to pay for education costs

loans.name: Shatar

texts.en:
Mrs. Shatar, 48, lives with her husband and daughters in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, where she has been working as a cook in the taverna for many years. She also runs a taxi business in order to increase her income, earning over MNT 20.000 each day.
 
Lately, due to damage to her car, it has become too dangerous for her and her passengers to operate the service. Shatar is therefore requesting this loan  to purchase the spare parts required for her taxi repair.

loans.use: to purchase  new spare parts to repair her taxi.

loans.name: Ilolbi

texts.ru: Илолби занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин на рынке. Она в основном продает женские платья и костюмы. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа теплых свитеров.
texts.en: Ilolbi is involved in sales.  She has a store at the market, where she primarily sells women's dresses and suits.  Ilolbi has been involved in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of warm sweaters.

loans.use: to purchase warm sweaters

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Falealupo Uta. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sala owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for this business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas to sell. Sala has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 720 WST a month.

In 2010, Sala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sala has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Sala is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and herbicides. Sala plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Grace has a bakeshop that sells breads, pastries & cookies. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 49-year-old, married woman. She and her husband, Peter, are blessed to have two children.

To earn a living, she has been operating a salon for the past three years. She notes that her monthly income is approximately 6,500 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan through KADET. She was introduced to KADET by an existing KADET client. Nancy plans on using the loan proceeds to buy a blow dryer for her salon. With the anticipated profits generated by the business as a result of the loan, she would like to expand her business. In the future, she dreams of opening a retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer for her salon

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia believes that, " a hard working person becomes successful". She is a hard working mother who helps her husband in managing their corn farming business. She is 56 years old and has four adult-age children. They have been a farmer for almost 23 years and usually earns a profits of P25,000 in every harvest season. They usually spend their income for their food and allowances of their children. Being a hard working parents, they educate most of their children. 

They planned to improve and expand their corn farming business to earn and save for their daily living and future emergencies. But due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional of P20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting corn. They believe that they can able to increase their yields and income as they continue to work and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting corn

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is in farming business in Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC since 2001. Recently, she asks for PHP 7,000.00 to pay for land preparation such as plowing, harrowing and seedbed preparations.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation such as plowing, harrowing and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a lady who despite her age does not feel tired with her work. Mama O., as she is called by all, sells agricultural produce at the market.  She sells items such as fresh palm fruits and pepper in tins. There are increasing demands from her customers daily. To satisfy her customers demands, she is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva in order to buy more goods and sell them in bags.

loans.use: Mama Okoe would like to expand her produce sales.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Mrs Xuan and her husband are old but they have to support themselves because their children are also very poor and they went to another place to earn their living. Mr Thieu is 63 years old and he has a spinal cord problem so he can only help his wife to with house work.

Mrs Xuan sells fish sauce from door to door. She borrowed a loan of $50 with no interest and she repaid this loan already. Her income increased by $1/person/month and her average income is now $12/person/month. Now she asks to borrow a loan of $50.

loans.use: sells fish sauce

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Mrs. Chab H.,  a 47 year old mother of 6 children, lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She runs a farm on a small piece of land growing rice crops and different kinds of vegetables. She typically makes around $5/day in revenue, while her husband and three of her children make a meager salary from working in a small hotel. 
In order to increase the family's savings, Chab H. is asking for a $1200 loan to purchase more seeds to plant on her farm. Another part of money is to buy a motorcycle for her husband's transportation from and to work. 
For the coming year, H. plans to increase the  variety of crops as much as she can so that she will be able to send her children to a local university.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to grow in her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve his shop

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Ms. María is 48 years old and completed her high school studies. She comes from Juanjuí, district of the Mariscal Cáceres province of the San Martín department. She has four children, but only two of them are her dependants. Because of her husband’s work, she moved to Trujillo, in the La Libertad department, and was forced to quit her business of shoe and clothes sales. She later seeked capital to start the business once more. Her neighbor invited her to participate in the “San Judas Tadeo” Communal Bank and, with her first loan of approximately $96, she bought guinea pigs, in order to raise and fatten them and then sell them. With subsequent loans she bought dairy products (cheese and butter), that she brings from Cajamarca and sells door to door. She presently carries out both activities. With the recent loan of approximately $386, received from Manuela Ramos, she will buy more pigs to raise, as well as poultry and food for these animals. Her dream is to be able to accumulate good savings, that will allow her to rest when she is no longer capable of working.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María tiene 48 años D. edad y estudió secundaria completa; es natural D. Juanjuí, distrito D. la Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres del Departamento D. San Martín; tiene 4 hijos, pero solamente dos dependen D. ella. Por motivos D. trabajo D. su esposo, vino a vivir a Trujillo, en el Departamento D. La Libertad, y tuvo que dejar su negocio D. venta D. zapatos y ropa. Luego buscó financiamiento para iniciar nuevamente un negocio; su vecina la invitó a participar del Banco Comunal “San Judas Tadeo” y con su primer préstamo que recibió D. S/.300.00 ($96 aproximadamente) compró cuyes para criarlos y venderlos luego; con los otros préstamos adquirió productos lácteos (queso, mantequilla) que trae D. Cajamarca, los que sale a vender casa por casa; actualmente realiza ambas cosas. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.1,200 ($ 386.00 aprox.) comprará más cuyes para criar, así como pollos y alimento para estos animales. Su sueño es tener un buen ahorro que le permita descansar tranquila cuando ya no pueda trabajar.

loans.use: Purchase of poultry and pigs, and animal food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy P., 41, and her husband, 45, have been married since 1984. They have six children, three sons and three daughters. One of Thavy's daughters is married and weaves silk at home, one of her sons is working in a restaurant in Phnom Penh, and the other children are studying. Thavy and her family are living in a small house on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been a silk weaver since she was 18 years old. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a wooden house repairer. He learned his skill in 1985 and started work that year.

Now Thavy is in the process of building a new house. After getting loans from Maxima many times, Thavy has been able to save some money. Now she is requesting her fourth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. She will add this loan to the money she has saved to build her house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Mayra Maritza

texts.es:
Mayra Gonzales is a single mother with two small children and a granddaughter for whom she is the sole supporter. She sells coconut and peanuts on the outskirts of the central market in Leon. She started the business 12 years ago with a capital of C $ 600 (600 cordobas) which was all the money she had saved throughout her life.

Like anything else, the beginning was difficult when she began selling on the streets of Leon with a small case that contained her products, but then she decided to borrow from Ceprodel and she managed to invest in the purchase of a wooden table. This table has begun to deteriorate during the past few months due to the fact that she sets up her table outdoors in a bad location and due also to the winter rains.

Mayra's credit has been very good with Ceprodel. She had had 22 credit instances and has paid in a timely and responsible manner.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mayra Gonzales es madre soltera, con dos pequeños hijos y una nieta a quien tiene la obligación de mantener por ser el único sustento de su familia. Se dedica a la venta de coco y maní en las afueras del mercado central en León. Desde hace 12 años comenzó el negocio con un capital de C$ 600 (600 córdobas) obtenido por ahorros personales de toda su vida.

Como todo inicio es duro, comenzó vendiendo en las calles de León con una panita donde contenía sus productos pero al haber decidido solicitar créditos en Ceprodel, logró invertir en la compra de una mesa de madera que a medida de que han pasado los meses se ha venido deteriorando ya que la coloca en las afueras del mercado en un lugar al aire libre donde recibe las lluvias de invierno por no tener buenas condiciones en su localidad.

Su record crediticio es de 22 créditos con Ceprodel pagados muy responsablemente en tiempo y forma.

loans.use: To purchase coconut and peanuts (Compra de coco y maní)

loans.name: Leonel Hermógenes

texts.es:
Being a traveling salesman is an activity that requires a lot of sacrifices, including sun exposure and fatigue from walking while hauling the goods to be sold. In spite of this, Mr Leonel R. works selling meat in the streets of his hometown El Sauce, León.

Ever since a very young age, he has been deemed a very hard worker. Since the El Sauce municipality is a livestock area, before starting his current business, he worked in agriculture and livestock, where he learned to work under any conditions, rain or shine.

Nevertheless, Mr. R. currently needs to purchase meat for its sale, and he uses the Ceprodel loans to this end. The money is used to buy meat, and this allows him to support his household.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

El negocio de venta ambulante es una actividad que requiere de mucho sacrificio por la exposición al sol y el cansancio de caminar y cargar con la mercadería que se vende. A pesar de esta situación, el señor Leonel R. se dedica a la venta de carne vendiéndola ambulantemente por las calles del municipio El sauce en León de donde es originario.

Desde muy niño se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y como el municipio El Sauce es zona ganadera, antes de tener este negocio se dedicaba a la ganadería y agricultura donde aprendió a trabajar bajo cualquier circunstancia ya sea bajo sol o bajo lluvia.

No obstante, a pesar de dedicarse a este negocio, el señor R. atraviesa la necesidad de comprar la carne para comercializarla y para esto hace uso de los créditos que le brinda Ceprodel el cual los invierte en la compra de esta carne y por medio de esta actividad lleva el sustento a su hogar de habitación.

loans.use:
Purchase of meat

Compra de carne

loans.name: Budumbuli West G B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Juliana K.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and add more stock. Juliana is 23 years old and is single. She has 1 daughter aged 10 months. Each week, Juliana makes approximately UGX 105000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her personal needs and save the rest. Juliana has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add stock to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Juliana is joined in her small group by Cissy N., Fatuma K. and Ruth K.. Cissy N. has a business running a beauty salon and wants to buy a hair dryer and more braids. Fatuma K. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to increase her purchases. Ruth K. operates a business selling milk and wants to purchase a fridge and increase the quantity of milk available for purchase.

loans.use: To expand grocery business and make more profits

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmen Maria lives in the neighborhood of Domitila Lugo in the capital of Nicaragua, Managua. She is single and has one child. With her work she supports both herself and her kid. She has been selling clothes in the street for the past two years; she feels that her customer base has been increasing and as such she has been expanding her inventory so that she can offer a wider variety of products. One of her biggest dreams is to be able to have a successful business with which she can obtain better earnings and that way have a more stable working capital. Mrs. Carmen is asking for a loan in order to make repairs in her house and that way have greater comfort in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Carmen Maria tiene su domicilio en el Barrio Domitila Lugo de nuestra capital, es soltera y tiene solamente un niño. Con su trabajo se mantiene ella y su pequeño niño. Se dedica al negocio de venta ambulante de ropa desde hace dos años, siente que su clientela ha ido creciendo cada vez más y por ello ha ido aumentando poco a poco sus inventarios para ofrecer más variedad en sus productos. Uno de sus grandes anhelos es tener un negocio próspero donde pueda obtener mejores utilidades y de esa manera manejar un capital de trabajo fijo. Doña Carmen esta solicitando el crédito para invertirlos en mejoras en su casa y de esa manera tener mayor comodidad en su hogar.

loans.use: To make repairs in her home.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo has his own residence. He lives on Antonio Llanque Street in the Villa Ingenio zone located in the periphery of the city of El Alto. He is the father of a boy of three years. His wife is a merchant in a street stall of the city of El Alto, while he is the chauffeur of a minibus whose routes are the streets of the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to pay off the minibus with which he works.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out qualifies IMPRO to offer him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Reynaldo tiene domicilio propio, vive en la Calle Antonio Llanque de la zona Villa Ingenio ubicada en la periferia de la ciudad de El Alto. Es padre de un niño de tres años, su esposa es comerciante en un puesto callejero de la ciuddad de El Alto, mientras que él es chofer de un minibús cuyo recorrido son las calles de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito será destinado para cancelar totalmente los pagos de la movilidad con la que trabaja .

Es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To pay off the minibus that he uses for his transportation business.

loans.name: Zuhrijeta

texts.en:
Zuhrijeta lives in a small village called Čivčije.

She is 54 years old, married, and her and her husband have had one child. Her husband works full time, and she works to support them through her farming business growing vegetables, corn, etc.

This is her second loan, which she is requesting in the amount of 600KM (Bosnian Marks) ($475). Her intent is to buy chickens with this money and use the corn she has grown to feed them. She will then sell the chickens to make a profit.

Through this loan, she hopes to expand her business and grow her income.

loans.use: To buy chickens to fatten and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Thi Ngoai

texts.vi:
Like many other families in the rural areas of Vietnam, Mrs. Ngoai's family mainly focused on farming and raising livestock for a living. In 1999, Mrs. Ngoai joined the TYM Fund and borrowed the first loan of 300,000VND (about 20USD) to invest in raising livestock. Besides livestock, she also invested in planting fruit trees to take advantage of her large garden. Currently, both her husband and she focus on planting fruit trees and raising livestock to increase their family's income. After 9 years, her family's economy has improved tremendously, and she is able to send all her children to school. This time, she would like to borrow 900USD to invest further in planting fruit trees and raising livestock. Her family's monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 200USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by P. Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Cũng như nhiều gia đình khác ở vùng nông thôn Việt Nam, gia đình chị Ngoài cũng có nguồn thu nhập chính là từ trồng trọt và chăn nuôi. Năm 1999 chị Ngoài tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay mức vốn đầu tiên là 300.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Ngoài chăn nuôi, tận dụng đất vườn rộng chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vốn để trồng cây ăn quả . Hiện nay cả hai vợ chồng chị đều tập trung vào chăn nuôi và trrồng trọt để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Sau 9 năm sử dụng vốn vay, nhờ có nguồn thu ổn định từ trồng trọt và chăn nuôi đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển hơn, các con của chị đều được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ.Vòng vốn tới chị mogn muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan,a 37-year-old married man with one child, lives in the region of Baalback, in the Bekaa Valley of Lebanon. Ghassan is a hair designer. Because of the insufficient electricity power supply in his region, Ghassan has to turn on his generator each time clients arrive to his salon. Hence, he needs a loan of $US1,000 to purchase a stock of fuel to be able to use the generator at any time in order to guarantee more comfort to his clients. This step up will allow Ghassan to expand his business and therefore to improve the livelihood of his family. This is the first time Ghassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase a stock of fuel for the electric generator

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a teacher. Joyce has received a junior-high level of education. She is responsible for feeding her family and paying the utility bills.

Joyce has been making spring rolls and chips and selling them near Liverpool Street in Elmina since 2004. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients for preparing spring rolls and cookies. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete the building she started constructing.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make spring rolls and cookies to sell.

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es: La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes”, ubicado en el Jr. 1 de Mayo Nº 663 “Micaela Bastidas”, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad y es madre soltera de una hija menor de edad que aún dependen de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de refrescos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad se dedica a la venta de plátanos, frutas y refresco, para ello se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para ir atender su puesto. Trabaja todos los días, lo cual le  brinda ganancias que le permite cumplir con el préstamo.  nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 racimos de plátanos, 5 kilos de mango, 6 kilos de maíz, un saco de limón, etc. nnGracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha crecido. Tiene el deseo de seguir surgiendo por el bienestar de su pequeña hija.nn
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia is a member of "Mujeres Perseverantes" Community Bank, located at 663 "Micaela Bastidas", Jr. 1 de Mayo in the Calleria District, Coronel Portillo Province, in the region of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and the single mother of a little girl who is still dependent on her. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 2 years. She invested the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, a loan of $100, into the sale of soft drinks. Currently, she dedicates herself to the sale of bananas, fruits and refreshments and to do so, she gets up at 5 in the morning to tend to her stall. She works every day, which earns her enough income to make good on the loans she receives. With this next loan of $425, which will be payed back over 4 months, she will buy 4 bunches of bananas, 5 kilos of mangoes, 6 kilos of corn, a bag of lemons etc. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, her business has grown. Julia has a great desire to keep succeeding for the well being of her little daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of bananas, mangos, corn, lemons etc.

loans.name: Lucia Ernestina

texts.es:
La Señora Lucia Ernestina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta D. frutas y algunos abarrotes, poco a poco está implementando su negocio que está ubicado en su propia casa, lugar donD. acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes que son mayormente los vecinos del su barrio.

Con este préstamo D. S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6  meses, comprará  productos D. primera necesidad como plátanos, naranjas, piñas, papayas, huevos, papel higiénico en paquetes y otros productos D. mayor salida, para  surtir bien su negocio y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan, también quiere implementar su venta D. anticuchos por las noches. 

 Lucia Ernestina tiene 42 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijos que aún dependen D. ella. Ya tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco y está agradecida con el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos que permite crecer en su negocio tanto a ella como también a las demás mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Lucia Ernestina is a member of the Community Bank “Mujeres Creativas”. She lives in the San Martín area, province and district of Moyabamba. She sells fruit and groceries, and she is gradually growing her business. As her business is located at her home, most of her customers are also her neighbors. With this loan of $275 (800 PEN), which will be paid back in 6 months, she will purchase basic staples such as bananas, oranges, pineapples, papayas, eggs, and other popular products such as toilet paper, so her customers can find what they need. She also wants to begin selling a regional dish called ‘anticuchos’ for dinner. Lucia Ernestina is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 dependent children. She has been working with the bank for 4 years, and she is very grateful for the support she has received from Manuela Ramos who has encouraged her to improve her business as Manuela has done with many other working women.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bananas, oranges, pineapples, papayas, eggs, and other popular products

loans.name: Akbar Ghulam Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Akbar Baji is a 58 year old married lady who resides in a famous historical place named Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan.  She has been living in this place for the past 20 years. 

She is an uneducated lady, but she knows the value of education.  She believes that education gives a person success in every walk of life.  She wasn't able to study due to her house’s poor financial conditions.  

Her husband's name is G. M., and he is a property dealer by profession.  He has 6 years of experience in this business.  Her family consists of 13 members.  She has five sons and six daughters.  Her first two sons have government jobs.  The younger to them runs a grocery shop.  The other two are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.  Her daughters stay at home and make embroidered dresses.  

Akbar Baji couldn’t give her daughters a good education but she wants to deliver the art of embroidery to them.  Now, her daughters are able to embroider dresses very easily without their mother’s help.  Akbar Baji is pleased to see her daughters accomplish this art.  She got her daughters involved in this work because inflation is increasing rapidly and it is difficult for a person to manage all of the household expenses.  She and her daughters share part of the income with their family members. 

Akbar Baji successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her son’s grocery shop. 

She is a group leader of a few more members of her locality.  Rukhsana Baji wants a loan to buy utensils to resell.  Razia Baji wants a loan to buy electric switches to resell.  Asia Baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell.  Safia Baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads and colored thread) to make embroidery on shoes.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S. is 50 years old and sells fruit in Kampong Chhnang province. Her business has been around for about three years and she makes US $3.50 every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, because there is high inflation and the weather has not been conducive to a good growing season. 

She is asking for a loan of US $400 to invest in her own fruit business, increasing her stock of fruits to sell. She sees these investments as opportunities that will be able to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To invest on her own fruit business

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз закончив свой очередной займ хочет получить следующий для покупки деревянных досок.Которые относятся к его бизнесу сырьём для изготовления продукции.Ассортиментом его продукции относятся скалки для мучнных изделий, доски,сита.У Абдуазиза свои покупатели которые оптом закупают его продукцию.Микроинвест рад выдавать кредит таким пунктуальным клиентам как Абдуазиз.
texts.en:
After repaying his previous loan, Abduaziz T. would like to borrow money to purchase wooden boards. Abduaziz uses the wood to produce a variety of kitchen tools such as cutting boards, sieves, etc. Abduaziz has many loyal customers, who buy his products wholesale. MicroInvest is happy to broker a loan for Abduaziz, who is a very reliable borrower.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production of wooden kitchen tools

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., 31, is a good housewife who stays at home doing housework and cooking for her family members. Her husband has a business as a moto-taxi driver. On average, he makes US$6 per day. Chea S. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase a trailer for her husband. With the trailer, she believes her husband can make more profit than before. Their family is pictured here.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is forty-eight years old. She is married and has one child, a boy. He is currently pursuing a degree programme in one of the public universities in Ghana. She works to help her husband financially to take care of the family. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a public servant.

Abena deals in all kinds of textiles – shirts, shorts, pants, etc. She deals mostly in children's clothing. She buys from Kumasi and sells in her community. She also treks to villages to sell. Abena has been in business for twenty-four years and wants a loan to procure more bales of textiles. She is hoping to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes for resale

loans.name: Basbibi

texts.ru: Джураева Басбиби проживает  в районе Шахринау. Возраст 32 года . незамужем. Живет с родителями. Обеспечивает семью одна. Имеет небольшой бизнес . Покупает немного товара и реализует его по кишлакам , предлагая из дома в дом. Занимается этим бизнсом уже 6 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот . Таким образом она сможет больше зарабатывать и обеспечить свою жизнь лучше.
texts.en:
Basbibi D. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 32 years old and is not married. She lives with her parents and provides for the family by herself. She has a small business. She purchases a few products and sells them in villages, offering them from house to house. She has been in this business for 6 years now. She plans to get credit in order to increase her turnover. This way she will be able to earn more and to provide better for her life.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Mrs. Melita C., 51 years old, and married with four children, is a resident in Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte. Siare is a coastal area where most of the people's source of income is fishing. Mrs. C., Melita is one of them. Her business is fishing and it answers the basic needs of the community.

Melita started her business with only one fishing boat. Fortunately, she now has four fishing boats and sells the catch wholesale to neighboring towns. She extends support to other fishermen in their community. She's applying for a loan from Paglaum for she believes in providing help to people who are also in the fishing business. Her heart's desire is to continue inspiring people to be hardworking so that everybody will live abundantly.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Ashurhon

texts.ru: Ашурхон - пожилая женщина 62 лет. Замужем и мать 6-х детей. Её муж занимается перепродажей скота на скотном рынке. Он покупает там дешевле, и через неделю продает, если найдется хороший покупатель, который купит его скот за хорошую цену. Ашурхон помогает мужу. За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Ashurhon is an older woman, 62 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children. Her husband trades livestock at the livestock market. He buys there cheaply, and resells after a weeks or so if he finds a good buyer willing to pay a good price. They would like to use a loan to increase their number of livestock and earn more money.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and sale of livestock

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is married and the mother of eight children who are currently in school. She is 50 years old and trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. For lack of adequate working capital, Patience is only able to buy a few small quantities of lace materials, which she then sells. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Gye Nyame’, which means Except God.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg D. is a single mother of five daughters, ages ranging between 11 and 27. She lives with her five daughters and one granddaughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her oldest daughter is disabled and stays home. The other daughters are all students. She has a small sewing shop. She started her sewing business in 2003 with one old sewing machine. Her daughters help in her business whenever necessary.  She sews various clothes for women and men and does clothing alterations by request. Since the start in 2003, she has been doing well; her business capital has increased from 100,000 MNT to 500,000 MNT.  Her second daughter is a professional pistol shooter and has recently improved her national ranking to third in the national pistol shooting competition. She says that she hopes to be financially able to support her career in the pistol shooting sport. In addition, she would like to see all her daughters be well educated and pursue their dreams. She requests a loan to purchase raw materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy silk and cotton

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 27 años, es una mujer comprensiva que vive con el padre de sus 2 hijos pequeños y por el momento habitan en la casa de sus padres. Cuando visitamos a Sonia la encontramos muy triste y a la vez enojada, porque la noche anterior le robaron los choclos de su chacra, los cuales le costaron mucho abonar hasta que maduren. Por esa razón piensa vender los que tiene a un mayor precio en el mercado y posteriormente lo rematará para no tener una mayor pérdida. Sonia se dedica todos los días a las labores agrícolas juntamente con su esposo, ya que le gusta ocuparse en su principal fuente de ingresos económicos. La manera en que ella cultiva es alternada; los meses de enero siembra gladiolos, para cosechar en mayo; en abril es el turno de las arvejas y en octubre la papa, de este modo todo su tiempo está muy dedicada a sus cultivos, generándole muy buenas ganancias. Por esta razón avizora comprar un terreno en los próximos meses donde construirá su casa propia para brindarles mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, donde viene demostrando pagar sus cuotas en las fechas indicadas. Asimismo, le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su banco comunal, donde aprovecha de conversar y pasar un buen tiempo en compañía de sus vecinas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos con los que abonará sus chacras de arvejas que ya están sembradas.
texts.en:
Sonia is 27 years old and is very knowledgeable. She lives with the father of her two small children, and, at the moment, they live with her parents. When we visited Sonia, she was very sad and angry, because the night before her corn, which is very costly until it matures, from her farm was stolen. As a result, she plans to sell the corn that she still has at a higher price in the market, so she won’t end up with a large loss. Sonia works every day in agriculture with her husband, since it is their primary source of income. She alternates the crops that she grows; in January, she sows gladioli, which she harvests in May. In April, she sows peas, and in October, she plants potatoes. She spends all of her time working on her crops, which generates good earnings. Because of this, she will buy land in the next few months, where she will build her own house so that she can offer her children more comforts. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she has made her repayments on time. Also, she likes to attend the meetings at her community bank, where she takes advantage of talking to and having a good time with her neighbors. The money that she requests will be used to buy chemical fertilizers, with which she will fertilize her pea farms that have already been sown.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Mrs. Myrna B., age 47, is the wife of Recolito and the mother of four children, ages 13 -22 years old. Her eldest child is a college graduate, her second child is still studying in college, and the last two are in high school. Both Myrna and her husband lack education, so they have not been employed by any offices. However, Myrna did not accept that as a reason not to earn money and to have a better life. Instead, she and her husband helped one another. 

In 1996, Myrna found an opportunity to acquire business capital. She joined ASHI and she was inspired by the stories of poor women of ASHI. She wanted to become successful like them. Therefore, the loans that she has taken since then are used for her business. Because of the opportunity to borrow, Myrna was able to open variety store and sell vegetables and, recently, she started selling fish. She is courageous enough to take all the risks of running a business. She thought she could be successful because her husband is there to support her and because of a dream she kept in her mind -- having all of her remaining children graduate from college. 

Myrna had never hoped anything but to prevent her children from experiencing the hard life that she and her husband had experienced.

loans.use: Vegetables, fish, and to finance her variety store.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José es un hombre muy empeñoso, tiene 64 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Sabina y sus 2 hijos: Aldo de 17 y Fernando de 11. Él y su esposa trabajan en su puesto de venta de carne de pollo, Sabina es la que mayormente atiende el puesto, ya que José debe dedicarse a la compra de mercadería, por lo que está constantemente de viaje. Es por ello que encontramos a su esposa (en la foto) en su puesto, quien atiende a los clientes siempre con una sonrisa en el rostro. José se dedica mucho a su trabajo para poder brindarle a su familia un buen futuro, sus hijos están estudiando y él quiere que más adelante puedan seguir una carrera universitaria y para eso necesita obtener mayores ingresos económicos. Felizmente, todos son un equipo, tanto su esposa como sus hijos se apoyan en todo, por lo que José confía que poco a poco logrará todos sus objetivos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollos y así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
José is extremely hardworking. He is 64 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Sabina and their 2 children, Aldo (age 17) and Fernando (age 11). He and his wife work together selling butchered chickens. Sabina is mainly responsible for tending to the vending post while José spends his time acquiring the merchandise, which requires constant travel. This is why we find his wife (shown in the photograph) alone at their business. She always greets customers with a smile on her face.

José works in order to give his family a better future and enable his children to pursue their education. At some point, José greatly wants to resume his academic career, but in order to do that, he needs to generate more income. Happily, his family works as a team. José, his wife, and his kids all support one another, so he is confident that they will eventually reach their goals. The money he is requesting will be used to buy chickens in larger quantity so that he can improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens in larger quantity

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Jacinta es casada, tiene 35 años y 5 hijos, Jacinta tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, frutas, verduras, además Jacinta vende ropa en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Jacinta necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.
Los sueños de Jacinta son construir el segundo piso de su casa y tener un carro.
texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the communal bank Amor y Verdad (Love and Truth). She is married, 35 years old, and has 5 children. Jacinta has a store in her house where she sells a variety of groceries including fruits and vegetables. In addition, she sells clothes in various markets in the region.

Jacinta needs a loan of 1,500 soles that will be used to purchase clothing.

Jacinta dreams of adding a second story to her home and having a car.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Katumba 2 – United Atusalirwe Gertrude Group

texts.en: A. Gertrude is 36 years old, and is single with two school-aged children. She also takes care of one dependent. Gertrude has owned a retail shop for over four years. She is using her loan to add stock, such as sugar, salt, soap, maize flour, etc., to expand her business. She is a very hardworking woman and hopes her business prospers.

loans.use: To purchase stock such as sugar, salt, soap, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Eddy Pantaleon

texts.es: For thirty years Eddy’s family has raised pigs, now that his parents are older, Eddy will take over. The family raises pigs and sells the meat, Eddy’s vision is to establish a store in which he can sell the family-raised pork.  This loan will go towards the purchase of another pig and corn to fatten it. Because of the loan, Eddy is able to buy corn in bulk, ensuring that he gets a good price. When he is able, Eddy will purchase several pigs and raise them as a herd. Eddy has a long history with Fundación León 2000 and this will be his fourth Kiva loan, his credit is excellent. The cost of transportation is a difficulty he faces when he travels to different areas to find a good pig.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Baasanhuu

texts.en:
S. is a 43-year-old single mother of twin 16-year-old sons. She and her two children live in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in one of the ger districts on the outskirts of the city. Her two sons attend university and she operates a clothing-making business in a rented room. 

She began her business in 2005 after working as a dressmaker in a local clothing factory. After several years of hard work and determination, her working capital now exceeds 400,000 tugrugs (~280 USD) with a monthly net profit of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). Her hope is to keep growing her business so that she can afford to pay her sons’ tuition and keep improving their quality of life. S. is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase a new, more efficient sewing machine and more clothing fabric for her growing business.

loans.use: To purchase a new, more efficient sewing machine and more clothing fabric for her growing business

loans.name: Solei

texts.es:
Solei tiene 34 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija de 13 años y dos sobrinos en la casa de su madre.

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso y de zapatos, en un puesto del mercado de su localidad. Gracias a esta labor está logrando solventar los estudios de su hija, a quien espera ver, más adelante, como una buena profesional. 
Lo que le gusta a Solei de su trabajo es relacionarse con varias personas y aprender sobre el comercio y las técnicas de venta. Por otro lado, cree que su negocio le es rentable porque el precio de las prendas es muy accesible. 
Para el futuro desea tener una tienda donde puede vender su mercadería con mayor comodidad.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está muy entusiasmada con conocer más sobre la forma de trabajo en un banco comunal y ya ha notado que sus compañeros de grupo son personas confiables y muy responsables. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa de segundo uso para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Solei is 34 years old and a single mother. She lives with her 13 year old daughter and two nephews in her mother's house.

For the past 3 years she has dedicated herself to selling used clothes and shoes in a stand in her local market. Thanks to this work she is able to pay for her daughter's studies, who she hopes will one day become a good professional. For her work Solei wants to make contacts with various people and learn about business and selling techniques. She believes that her business is profitable because the price of her clothing is very affordable. For the future she hopes to have a store where she can sell her merchandise with greater convenience.

This is Solei's first loan with MFP. She is very enthusiastic to know more about working with a communal bank and already has noticed that her group members are reliable and responsible people. Solei will use the money she is asking for to buy more used clothes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Genoveva's Group

texts.en: Rice farming is the main source of income of Genoveva B., 54. She supports five children. Her 2-hectare rice field is just enough to provide for their basic needs. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to avail a low-interest loan to finance her business. She’s requesting 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy necessities for the farm and sustain her family.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora U. is from the village of Gud, San Isidro. She is 42 years old. Flora is married and has two school-aged children.

To make a living Flora runs a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling different products in the local community. Flora earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Flora joined ASKI services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora is requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

About ASKI
