ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma C. is from the village of Marabulig 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 56 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Thelma owns and operates a business selling doormats, rugs, sofa bedding, and pillows to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Thelma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joyce Atieno

texts.en:
Joyce Atieno O. is a former voluntary secretary of an organization in Rongo, Kenya. This she begun back in 2007 after college but when employment was not forthcoming, she decided to venture into trade and started her current clothing business.

Joyce Atieno is 35 years old and is single. She would like a loan of Kshs 30,000 which will go to stocking her business and expanding into more markets.

loans.use: To restock her clothing business

loans.name: Anita

texts.fr: Née en 1983 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, C. Anita vit depuis 7 ans environs au quartier Dédokpo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GOVOU Arnaud, Anita est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Cependant, Anita ne vit pas avec son mari. Anita  supporte donc seule, les charges de son enfant. Anita a fréquenté jusqu’au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Anita mène comme activité la vente de tissus, par le système de distribution. Anita a déjà sept ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. C’est à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin, que Anita achète ses produits. Anita a bien remboursé le premier crédit qu’elle a obtenu de ALIDé. Anita sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, en vue de mieux satisfaire la forte demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
Born in 1983 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, C. Anita has been living for about seven years in the Dédokpo district in Cotonou.  Married to GOVOU Arnaud, she is the mother of one child who is in school  However, she doesn't live with her husband.  She is therefore alone in supporting her child.  Anita attended secondary school only.  To provide for herself and her child, she has a business selling cloth through the distribution system.  She already has seven years of experience in this domain.  Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin, is where she purchases her goods.  Anita has repaid the first loan she obtained from ALIDé.  She is requesting a second one from ALIDé with the goal of increasing her stock of goods, so as to satisfy further the strong demand from her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bolts of fabrics

loans.name: Sayavush

texts.en:
Sayavush Q. is 43 years old and is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of goods like cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many other items in his grocery store which he built five years ago. Today he is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to increase his stock. 

Sayavush is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to increase his stock

loans.name: Ma. Junosie

texts.en: Ma. Junosie J., 45 years old, has a sari-sari store. Aside from the store, she also sells food and raises pigs to supplement their income. She has four children that she supports going to school. Ma. Junosie would like a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise, piglets, feed and food ingredients.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig feed and additional ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Liz Marili

texts.es:
La Sra. Liz Marili, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 48 años y  02 hijos todos independientes.

Su esfuerzo emprendedor y las ganas de salir adelante le valieron para iniciar su negocio  de Venta de Productos de Belleza de diferentes líneas como Unique, Esika, Leonisa y Avon, negocio que le va bien. Es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida. Con su préstamo de 300 Nuevos Soles compró productos de belleza para su stock . 
Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas.
Liz Marili, se siente una mujer realizada, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en iniciar su negocio
texts.en:
La Sra. Liz Marili, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 48 años y 02 hijos todos independientes. Su esfuerzo emprendedor y las ganas de salir adelante le valieron para iniciar su negocio de Venta de Productos de Belleza de diferentes líneas como Unique, Esika, Leonisa y Avon, negocio que le va bien. Es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida. Con su préstamo de 300 Nuevos Soles compró productos de belleza para su stock . Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas. Liz Marili, se siente una mujer realizada, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en iniciar su negocio

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprarà productos de  belleza para surtir su negocio.

loans.name: Juaquina

texts.es:
Joaquina tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Reside en la selva alta cusqueña, en la comunidad de “Santa Fe”, donde tiene su casa propia.

Ella se caracteriza por ser multifacética, ya que una actividad no le es suficiente. Es por eso que se las ingenia para no sólo administrar su tienda de abarrotes como fuente principal, sino a la vez cultiva café y cacao, productos que le están dando buenas ganancias. Para la agricultura trabaja con su esposo y en tiempo de vacaciones escolares, sus hijos también la apoyan. Sus productos agrícolas también los vende en su propia tienda, pero por lo general los lleva a los centros de acopio de su localidad. En el futuro, piensa ampliar su tienda de abarrotes, para así ofrecer sus productos a precios más bajos para sus clientes.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente, también menciona estar conforme con los acuerdos que tratan en su banco comunal y en la metodología de trabajo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos para su tienda, en  los que tienen mayor demanda, lo que resta lo usará en el mantenimiento de sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Joaquina is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She has her own home in the community "Santa Fe," in the high cusqueña (frontier or province) jungle. She is multifaceted, one business is not enough for her. Her grocery store is not her only source of income. She also cultivates coffee and cocoa, which products are providing good earnings. She works in agriculture with her husband, and during school vacations the children also help their parents. They sell their harvest in their own store, but take most of their harvest to the local market. She is thinking about expanding her grocery store in the future to offer her products to her customers at lower prices. This is her third loan with MFP (local lending institution); therefore, she is committed to making her payments on time. We also note that she is satisfied with the agreements concerning her communal bank and her loan. This loan will be invested in much-requested products for her store and will be used for the maintenance of her cultivated land.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 38-year-old married man and a father of five children. He and his family live together in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He is in charge of an 18-year-old butchery business; he also sells chicken. He was recently approved for his fourth loan, as he needs to increase his working capital and purchase meat and chicken. He has repaid his previous loans on time; these helped him increase his sales by offering a bigger variety of products to his clients. Youssef is known for the good quality of his meat, as well as his competitive prices.

loans.use: To purchase meat and chicken.

loans.name: Bernandena's Group

texts.en:
Bernandena N. is from the village of Tru-Cut Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Bernandena is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tundan 2.

Bernandena is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Bernandena owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits like banana, mango, avocado and lanzones in the local community. Bernandena has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bernandena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bernandena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Bernandena is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Bernandena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela , de 37 años , vive con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos. Todos juntos viven en su casa que es propia.Se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (pollos), lo cuales compra cuando estan  pequeños (por su bajo precio) y los alimenta hasta engordarlos.Cuando los pollos ya estan crecidos  los vende a un precio mucho mayor. En esta pequeña empresa esta asociada con su cuñada con quien trabaja para sacar su negocio adelante, pues deben estar pendientes de los pollos recien salidos del cascarón, que son delicados y necesitan mayor atención. En las jaulas que tienen han habilitado  bebederos de agua y comida,  para orden y comodidad de las  aves.  Graciela se siente muy contenta y espera ampliar sus criaderos, además quiere comprar más cantidad de pollos , para lograr los ingresos necesarios para el bienestar de su familia.Es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos ya que  no quiere  defraudar a su grupo solidario.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  una nueva parvada, para de esta manera  aumentar sus ventas y ganancias .
texts.en:
Graciela is 37 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and two small children. She raises and sells poultry. She buys chicks, raises them and sells them at a profit. She runs this small company along with her sister-in-law and they work together to move the business ahead. They must pay special attention to the newly hatched chicks, as they are delicate and need lots of attention. They have installed food and water dispensers in the chicken coops, for the birds’ comfort. Graciela is very happy and she hopes to expand her operation and would also like to buy more chicks in order to be able to earn enough income to be able to provide for her family’s well being. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on schedule, so as not to defraud the group. She will use the money from this loan to buy more feed in order to be able to increase her sales and income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chickens

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. prepares Fante kenkey for sale in Abura.To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in a lot, or enough, water to soften the maize. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it to prove for the next day. She divides the proved dough into two and uses one half for her firm half-cooked dough. She mixes it with water to get it into a porridge form, cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture of the dough. Then she mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked portion. She moulds into balls and wraps them in corn husk. She cooks them again till they become soft to eat. Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce, with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey or any other kind of meat or fish.

Ekua is married and lives with six dependants. Ekua has not had any form of education. With the little income she makes from her sales, Ekua helps her husband take care of the family. Ekua will use this loan to purchase more maize to prepare Fante kenkey for distribution to her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to build a kenkey factory in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare Fante kenkey for distribution to her customers

loans.name: Choun

texts.en:
Mrs. Choun P. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Touch Say, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1969 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home and the other one attends school. Her husband is a farmer. 

Choun has been selling potatoes for 20 years. She buys potatoes from farmers in her village and sells to a middleman who comes to buy them at her home. She also assists her husband in his farming business.

Choun does not have enough capital to purchase potatoes under contract before harvest season comes, so she is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to help her capital.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes under contract for resale.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
María del Transito tiene 47 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es soltera y vive con la madre, tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
Ella heredo el negocio de la madre  y tiene 10 años de administrarlo, atiende a sus clientes  en un horario de 7:00 am - 8:00 pm, sus clientes son vecinos y personas que circulan por la zona, actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos, tales como son detergente y productos que le demandan sus clientes, esto contribuirá a tener más articulos, atraer clientes y generar  ingresos que son el principal sostenimiento de esta familia.
Las aspiraciones de María son continuar con su negocio, aprovechar la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio y mejora la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María del Tránsito, 47, lives in San Miguel. She’s single and lives with her mother. She has a grocery store. She inherited the store from her mother and has been running it for 10 years. She is open for business from 7am-8pm. Her customers are neighbors and people who wander though the area. She is asking for funds to buy stock items, like detergent, that her customers ask for. This will allow her to have more items available, attract more customers and generate income which is her family’s main source of support. María’s aspirations are to continue with her store, to take advantage of the opportunity to invest in it and to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy detergent.

loans.name: Esperanza De Jesus

texts.es: Esperanza De Jesús tiene 59 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio en un quiosco hace mas de 4 años que tiene esta negocio, ya que anteriormente se levantaba temprano y salía a recorrer las calles a vender todo tipo de frutas, pues así con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado salir adelante fue así que logro establecer un local en el colegio covisua, pues aquí es donde ella ofrece los diferentes productos a sus pequeños clientes. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos naturales, frutas, pan jugos y galletas. Sueña con seguir con su negocio en el colegio y agrandar su inventario.
texts.en:
Esperanza De Jesús is 59 years old, and she owns a kiosk offering food that she has been running for 4 years: prior to this, she used to wake up very early and walk through the streets to sell various kinds of fruit. This is how, in time, she has succeeded in getting ahead and in opening a shop in a school of the Covisua suburb, where she offers different products to her young customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy core materials such as sweets, natural soft drinks, fruit, bread, juice and biscuits. She dreams of continuing with this activity in the school and of boosting her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different products.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the city of Macupa, Tangub City. She is 47 years old. Elsa is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables, like corn, for sale. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sorin C., 60, is the village bank president selected by the eight members of this group, located in Ta Hing village in Kandal province.  All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Sorin and his wife are farmers who own two hectares of land to cultivate rice, corn and peanut for a living.  With the farm, they work very hard to support their family.
 
Sorin will use the loan from AMK to build a lavatory for his family. This couple has four children, one is a musician and three are students.  They also support the farm.

loans.use: Build a lavatory for family use

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
Farming crops is a specialist skill that 45-year-old Tin M. learned from her grandparents who died many years ago. Her husband frequently works in the fields alongside her as well as working in the construction sector. Tin M. has seen a plot of land in a good location for farming. She wants to be the owner of this land but her personal savings are not sufficient to buy the land. Therefore, she is asking for a loan so that she can afford to buy the farmland, where she will plant crops to make extra profit.
Mrs. Tin M. is married with two children, both of whom are employed and no longer in school.

loans.use: To buy some farmland

loans.name: Irene Rosario

texts.es: La señora Irene de 46 años de edad convive con el Sr. Antonio hace mas de  24 años tienen cinco hijos los cuales tres son independientes, doña Rosario mas conocida como charito vive en el Barrio Villa Alegre zona los lotes. doña charito trabaja como ambulante hace 22 años vendiendo (toallas para baño, toallas para cocina, pañuelos, medias u otros). El credito que se le otorgo al cliente es para la compra de mercaderia compra de soleras y poleras ya que esta empezando la epoca de calor necesita comprar ropa de temporada,  cliente agradecio infinitamente a la institucion  por la agilidad y la eficiencia que se le atendio.
texts.en:
Irene Rosario is 46 years and she has been living with her partner Antonio for more than 24 years. They have 5 children, 3 of which are independent. Rosario, more well known by her nickname Charito, lives in the Villa Alegre neighborhood in the Los Lotes area. Charito has worked as a traveling saleswoman for 22 years. She sells bathroom towels, kitchen towels, scarves, socks, and other items.

The credit granted to Charito is for the purchase of merchandise – sundresses and T-shirts, because the warm weather is beginning and she needs to purchase seasonal clothing. She is infinitely grateful for the institution for the agility and efficiency with which they attended to her.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sundresses and T-shirts

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en: Munhjargal D. is 22 years old and lives with his wife and infant daughter in the Arhangai providence, Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife takes care of their three-month old baby and Munhjargal works as a taxi driver. He began his business in 2007, and since then, has gained many permanent customers. His daily earnings are between 18,000 and 20,000 MNT.  For the future, he hopes to have his own taxi service center.  He says, "I try to provide fast and reliable services for my customers."  Munhjargal is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase necessary parts

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris Elizabeth C. R. es una comerciante de 52 años de edad, madre soltera de una hija de 17 años de edad, y junto a ella reside en el Barrio Guanaste en la municipio de San Esteban, Olancho. 

Desde hace veinte años doña Doris se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general y su Pulperia se llama Vecinos y Amigos, su horario de atención es de 6:00 am a 7:00 pm y mientras ella se ocupa de cuidar el negocio y de los quehaceres del hogar, su hija se va al colegio.  Aprendió a trabajar gracias a que su padre le enseñó y ahora Doris está muy feliz de tener su propio negocio ya que este le ha permitido tener un ingreso económico con el cual ha podido mantenerse ella y su hija, y cubrir los gastos de los servicios públicos de su casa como el agua potable y la electricidad. Su dificultad es que en el barrio hay varios negocios del mismo tipo y eso provoca que las ventas bajen y en ocasiones los gastos escolares de su hija son altos y no tiene como pagarlos.  

Doris solicita el préstamo porque está construyendo su casa y necesita comprar materiales como: madera, bloques y bolsas de cemento, arena, varilla de hierro, y pagar mano de obra, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera ir terminando de construir poco a poco su casa y dentro de un tiempo cerC. pueda mudarse a ella. Su meta es trabajar y esforzarse cada día para que a su hija no le falte nada y también quiere ahorrar para que cuando su hija vaya a la universidad para hacerse profesional. Es su octavo ciclo en FAMA y con los financiamientos obtenidos ha podido ir mejorando su negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doris Elizabeth C. R. is a 52 year-old merchant.  She is a single mother and has a 17 year-old daughter with whom she lives in the Guanaste neighborhood in the town of San Esteban, Olancho.

Doris has been selling groceries for twenty years and her grocery store is called 'Vecinos y Amigos' (Neighbors and Friends).  Her shop is open from 6.00am to 7.00pm and while she runs her business and does her housework, her daughter goes to school.  She learned to work because her father taught her and now Doris is very happy to have her own business since it has allowed her to have an income with which she can look after herself and her daughter and cover her household bills such as water and electricity. Her difficulty is that there are many businesses of the same type in the neighborhood and this means that sales drop.  Sometimes her daughter's school expenses are high and she has no way of paying them.

Doris is requesting her loan because she is building her house and needs to buy materials such as wood, blocks and bags of cement, sand and iron rods.  She also needs to pay workmen.  With the support of the loan she hopes to be able to finish building her house bit by bit and, in the near future, be able to move into it.  Her goal is to work hard every day so that her daughter does not want for anything.  She would also like to save so that her daughter can go to university and become a professional.  This is her eighth loan with FAMA.  With the financing she has obtained she has been able to improve her business and her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en: Hadia J. is currently in the business of selling fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish. Hadia is 25 years old and married. Her husband is a business man. She has four children, two of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more fish

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly D. C. is 37 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Hinigdaan in the municipality of Manolo Fortich, a part of Bukidnon province on the northern Mindanao islands. Jelly plants, harvests and sells rice and corn. She also makes and sells Filipino delicacies like rice cakes and cassava cakes. Jelly has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jelly joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Jelly successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and starts to raise. Jelly is requesting a new loan, her third from HSPFI, of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Elima Jepkochei

texts.en:
Elima K., 50 years old, is married and the mother of three children aged between 18 and 14 years. Elima's spouse, Benjamin Chepkonga, is a peasant farmer who supports her in their day-to-day financial and basic needs.
 
Elima runs a tailoring business which she started two years ago. She makes a monthly profit of KES 3,000. Elima has borrowed a loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to purchase clothing materials to make new dresses to sell for the Christmas season. This is her second loan, having successfully repaid her first. Elima intends to use the profits to open a retail shop and expand her tailoring business. Her dreams and hopes are to open a big retail shop and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien. Elles vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, dans de familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris et enfants. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont mariées et mères de 4 enfants.
La majorité des femmes du  groupe Danaya fond de la teinture et vente de bazins, de chaussure.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
Daly K. qui est un des membres fait l’achat, la teinture et la vente de bazin Elle est très sollicitée car elle a du talent  en dehors de ses vente elles reçoit fréquemment des clients pour des services.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des pièces de bazins et des colorants. Elle se procure de ces marchandises au  grand marché de Koutiala en gros pour  revendre l’article fini c’est à dire les bazins teints en détail au comptant  et a crédit à une clientèle  diverse et variée.
Tandis que Les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55 000FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Daly K.  elle,  compte réaliser  65 000 FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles ambitionnent renforcer leur partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de consolider leurs activités.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of women from the Hamdallaye area of the city of Koutiala who know each other well. They live together in the same area, in traditional households with their husbands and children. They are on average 30 years old, married, and have 4 children.
The majority of the women in the Danaya group dye and sell bazin fabric (a type of damask) and shoes.
To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners).
One of the members, Daly K., buys, dyes, and sells bazin fabric. She is highly sought-after because she is talented. In addition to her sales, she also frequently receives clients for fabric services.
She intends to use her loan to buy pieces of bazin fabric and dyes. She procures these goods at the grand market in Koutiala at wholesale, and then sells the final articles - the dyed bazin fabric - at retail, in cash and on credit, to a diverse and varied clientele.
While the other members of the Danaya group each intend to realize a monthly profit of 55,000 FCFA throughout the loan cycle, Daly K. herself intends to realize a profit of 65,000 FCFA.
In addition to repaying the loans, they use a portion of their income to meet the current needs of their families.
They aspire to reinforce their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: To buy bazin (damask) fabric and fabric dyes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a (natural) gas system and tires

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana tiene 58 años con sus 3 hijos. Ana brinda el servicio de costura, hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, pues con el paso del tiempo ha logrado obtener su propio medio de ingreso. Pues siempre le ha gustado mantener este medio de vida ya que ha sido el único medio de apoyo. Ha tenido muchas dificultades una de ellas ha sido problemas de salud, pero la lucha constante de salir adelante y mantener a su familia ya que es ella quien es responsable del pan de cada día. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de hilos, tijeras, telas, zipper, cintas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Ana is 58 years old and has three children.  She owns a sewing business which she has had for more than 10 years.  Over the years, she has managed to make her living through this business.  She has always enjoyed making a living in this way and it has been her sole means of support.

Ana has experienced many difficulties, including health problems, but she continues to struggle to get ahead and support her family since she is responsible for putting food on the table.  Ana is requesting a loan to buy thread, scissors, fabric, zips, ribbons and other products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Safari

texts.en:
Safari is a married man with eight children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

For over ten years, he has operated a meat goat selling business. He sells at the market to his neighbours and passersby. Safari faces a major challenge of competition and high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to establish a butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase goat meat at a wholesale price and resale at a retail price. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase goat meat at a wholesale price and resale at a retail price .

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is a 34-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business. She lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Renalyn is borrowing PHP 21,000 to purchase fishing gears and equipment. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Renalyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. Her photo was taken after the center meeting. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao is a widow with two children, one of whom is a recycle materials seller, and the other is a student. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot land where she grows rice on some parts to sell, and on other parts to feed her family.  

In order to improve her family living, Mrs. Mao wants to start a new business, but she does not have enough money to support it. Thus Mrs. Mao is requesting a loan to buy eight piglets and pig food.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is married with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and paraffin.

For over ten years, she has been selling fish from home to her neighbors and passersby.  Kanga faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry hot season, the availability of vegetables in the market is lower compared to the rainy winter season. She dreams of expanding her business and selling at wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of fish for sale. She joined Yehu microfinance to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of fish for sale.

loans.name: Egide

texts.en:
Egide was born in 1988. He is a single, hardworking man.

He owns a store in which he sells sugar, maize flour, rice and other items. He has done this business for one year.

He is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, salt and rice to increase his inventory. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and rice

loans.name: Wilma Dinurog's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Wilma D., a 46-year-old married resident of P2 Montol, Ozamiz City, is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, each is responsible for paying back the loan of her fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Wima D.’s Group.

Wilma has been planting and harvesting corn for sale for 10 years, earning approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In April 2010, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan 7,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase fertilizer, she is requesting her third loan of 10,000 PHP that will be used to pay for motor maintenance and corn fertilizer. Wilma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for motor maintenance and corn fertilizer

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy K. lives in the Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).  Dorothy has a business of baking. She has been in this business for six years, and she works six days out of every week. She sells her products in shops, by means of wholesale. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baking flour and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Dorothy include defaulters and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand her business. She stays in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jeanneth

texts.es: Jeanneth tiene la edad de 43 años, está casada  y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su cafetal y así poder obtener buenas cosechas este año.  Ella cuenta con el terreno sembrado y lo que pretende es mejorar su cosecha tanto en calidad como en cantidad, para así obtener ganancias para seguir adelante con el cultivo y tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Ella quiere llegar a ser una caficultora de la zona de buena producción y ser ejemplo para que las personas no desistan con sus pequeños proyectos. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Jeanneth is 43 years old, married, and she lives with her 3 children and their husband. They are her greatest priority. She plans providing maintenance to her coffee plantation in order to obtain a good harvest this year. She has an already planted field and she plans on improving the harvest, in quality and in quantity, to improve her earnings, to move forward with her cultivation, and to improve her quality of life and that of her family. She wants to become a good coffee farmer in the region and to be an example for others, to not give up on their small plantations. this is the second loan she receives from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). She had not had previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur has granted her a loan through an easier process and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase products for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen  se dedica a la compra de muebles usados y venta de muebles nuevos, la señora se dedica a esta actividad hace 3 años, vende cerca del mercado la pampa donde tiene su puesto de venta, vive en domicilio ajeno con contrato en anticrético, su esposo se encuentra en Brasil donde fue a trabajar en costura, tiene 2 hijos actualmente se hace cargo de los estudios y manutención de sus hijos, su trabajo es muy sacrificado tiene que viajar por 3 días a otras ciudades a comprar los muebles para su negocio, la señora indica que el crédito que se le otorgo es de gran ayuda porque con este dinero incrementara su capital de trabajo adquiriendo muebles para después venderlos, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carmen buys used furniture and sells new furniture.  She’s been in this business for three years.  She sells near the La Pampa Market where she has her sales stand.  She lives in someone else’s house under an “anticrético” contract (a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you.)  

Her husband is in Brazil where he went to work sewing.  She has two children in her care; she sees to their education and sustenance.  Her work is very demanding.  She has to travel three days to other cities to buy the furniture for her business.  

She indicates that the loan she was granted is of great help because this money will allow her to increase her working capital buying furniture for subsequent sale.  She is a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Charlot

texts.en:
Charlot is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Charlot has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Charlot has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Charlot hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como la subidita al cielo en el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen las socias  del Banco Comunal Subidita Al Cielo, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Manuela, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo el mismo que ya es mayor de edad y  estudia en universidad, el ya está comprometido pero aun vive en su casa junto a su mujer. El marido es taxista.
 
Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de artículos tanto personales como para el hogar (planchas, licuadoras, colchones, zapatos, teléfonos, etc.) a través de cartillas. También vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días en los momentos que está desocupada, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Nos cuenta que lleva  10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, zapatoa, ventiladores, planchas, licuadoras entre otras cosas que tiene pedido. Esta desde el principio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The members of the Community Bank Subidita al Cielo located in the neighbourhood of San Pablo in the town of Portoviejo meet every two weeks. It is a highly populated urban area.

42-year old Señora Manuela is a member of the bank. She is in a common-law relationship and has a grown son who is studying at university. He is engaged but still lives with his mother. Manuela’s husband is a taxi driver.

Manuela is a housewife who in order to have an income of her own sells items both for personal use and for the home (irons, blenders, mattresses, shoes, telephones etc). She also sells Avon beauty products such as cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories. She sells door-to-door and works every day when she has no other duties. Her customers buy on credit and then Manuela collects money every week. She has been doing this work for ten years and it is going well. 

The loan is to be used to buy perfumes, creams, shoes, fans, mattresses, blenders etc. for which she has orders. She has been a member of her bank since the beginning and enjoys it because it is easy to make the repayments. Manuela’s dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, shoes, fans, mattresses, blenders etc

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with two children aged 12 and 7. She has been running a retail shop for the last 4 years. In the next 5 years she wants to open up several outlets so that she will be able to venture into other counties for business.

She wants a loan of 9,000 Kenyan shillings to buy an environmentally friendly solar lamp. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has become more self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy an environmentally friendly solar lamp

loans.name: Kibondo Group

texts.en:
Vedasto, who is in his mid 30s, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. He has been selling second-hand clothes since 1997. He works from 9a.m to 10p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.
This will be Vedasto's first loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use for buying more second-hand clothes to sell. His dream is to be able to finish his house one day. He will share this loan with his loan group "Kibondo," which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Alba

texts.es: Gloria D. 59 años vive en Arjona, un municipio del departamento D. Bolívar, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos en las edades D. 27 a 31 años D. edad. Gloria tiene un negocio donD. venD. forros,  chalecos, cascos y mangas y accesoR. para motociclistas,  que inició hace 6 años  vendiendo minutos  con un chaleco que decía “Llamadas”, y muchas personas D. este gremio, le preguntaron si ella vendía chalecos. D. allí salió la idea inicial D. comercializarlos, como le fue bien  le agregó otros productos como  en su negocio  accesoR. para motocicletas, cascos, y  adicionó vitrinas bien surtidas. Su negocio ha tenido un buen crecimiento y está entusiasmada en hacerlo crecer porque ve sus utilidades muy pronto, esta es la razón por la cual acuD. a su credikiva, para comprar D. contado y en mayor volumen materiales para fabricar chalecos y manijas, además D. una máquina D. coser con los cuales iniciara un proceso productivo ella misma  D. mejor calidad. Gloria ha recibido 6 créditos D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo durante 2 años,  con los cuales ha logrado progreso en su negocio. Mientras Gloria se esmera por alcanzar sus sueños en su negocio, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 42,9% con la cual proyecta seguir fortaleciendo sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Gloria, 59, lives in Arjona, a town in Bolívar Department.  She’s married and has three children whose ages range from 27 to 31 year.  

Gloria has a business where she sells accessories for motorcyclists: seat covers, vests, helmets and sleeves that she started six years ago selling vests that said “Llamadas” and lots of people who are into motorcycles asked her if she sold vests.  This is where the idea to sell them arose.  Since she did well, she decided to add other similar products, like helmets, to her motorcycle accessories business.  She installed well-stocked display cases. 

 Her business has been growing well and she’s excited to help it grow because she expects to see profits very soon.  This is why she’s calling on Kiva to pay cash for larger amounts of material to make vests and handles as well as to buy a sewing machine so that she can start manufacturing higher quality items herself.  

Gloria has received six loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo during the last two years that have helped her business progress.  While Gloria strives to reach her business dreams, she maintains a profit margin of no less than 42.9% that she foresees will continue to strengthen her family income.

loans.use: to pay cash for materials at wholesale and to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 46 years old. She is a widow with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling food in her restaurant in Kaya-road in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to buy cattle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to operate her restaurant

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 39 years old and is a married woman with two children, ages 7 and 8 years old. Myrna and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Myrna’s husband also manages a fishpond. To help augment their income, Myrna decided to put up a small sari-sari store. She sells items like canned goods, noodles, coffee and sugar. She said she could do household chores while managing their store.

Myrna has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to sustain her children’s education through their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a businessman who does tailoring.  He has been in the business for six years and has employed two people.  He also does farming to earn extra income for his family.  Through Faulu Kenya, he was able to buy business premises where he now operates his business.  So far, he has employed two people in his business. His desire is to expand his business in five years for more income.
Peterson has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino tiene 40 años, convive con lucia de 35 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada, en la comunidad de Nueva Fortaleza, Pichari. Él proviene de una familia cuya tradción se han dedicado a la agricultura, es así que con el transcurrir del tiempo continúo con esta actividad, pero ahora tiene más experiencia. Desde entonces le va muy bien con el trabajo que realiza, sin embargo hay etapas en las que necesita de jornaleros para que lo ayuden a sembrar y a cosechar. Al final sus productos son llevados a los centros de acopio de su ciudad, recibiendo a cambio considerables ganancias. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 soles que solicita, podrá contratar personal para que realicen la poda de sus cafetales.
texts.en: Paulino is 40. He lives with Lucia, age 35, with whom he has two children. They live together in their own home in the Nueva Fortaleza community, Pichari. Paulino comes from a family of farmers, and he is continuing this work; he now has more experience. His work is going very well for him, but there are stages during which he needs day labourers to help him to sow and harvest. In the end, his products are brought to the city's distribution centers; in exchange, he makes a considerable income. This will be his first loan with MFP, and he promises to be punctual in the repayment of his quotas. With the 1,000 requested soles, he will be able to hire labourers to prune his coffee plants.

loans.use: to hire day labourers.

loans.name: Samat

texts.en:
Samat (pictured with her loom), 40, is a weaver. Her husband, Bunly (41), is a rice farmer and raises cows at home. They have been married since 1992 and have two sons. One is a construction worker and another is in school. The family is living in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Samat is asking for a loan of 400 USD to assist her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is a 45-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in the construction field.

Lan has run a general store in front of her house for 20 years. She sells instant food, basic groceries and personal items for people in her community.

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more beverages, confectionery, and shampoo. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages, confectionery, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard working woman who has practiced mixed farming for the past five years. 

Eunice is applying for her first loan, which she will use to buy farm inputs and in a grocery business. 

Eunice intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: 03.9.114.thiệu Dương Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuận has a service business repairing phones. She is requesting a loan to purchase mobile phones to resell.

Thuận is 28 years old. She is married with one child.

Thuận is the group leader of the 03.9.114.Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. 

In 2010, Thuận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thuận has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thuận has been involved in this business for five years.

The main harship that Thuận faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thuận hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones to resell.

loans.name: Jeanie

texts.en:
Jeanie is 49 years and lives in Canlambo, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married and has three children.

To earn a living, Jeanie is engaged in a backyard piggery business and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP5000 to buy feed and medicines for her pig raising business.

Jeanie has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 9 months. She would like to improve the living conditions of her family and able to sustain her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pig raising business.

loans.name: Reynante

texts.en:
Reynante is 23 years old and single. He was unable to pursue a college education due to financial problems. He is a responsible son and, in order to help his parents earn a living, he began farming.  For the past four years, he has cultivated a hectare of land, planting and harvesting corn to sell to traders.

Reynante hires additional laborers to help him cultivate the field and plant corn seeds. Because this is an additional expense for him, Reynante is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for land cultivation and buy corn seeds to grow. He hopes this loan will be granted to him, as it is his only hope to improve the yield of his cornfield.

Though he did not finish his education, Reynante hopes to help his family live comfortably by increasing his corn production.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy corn seeds to grow.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Emma has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy beauty products from Natasha and Avon. Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en:
Helaria is a married woman and has seven children. She is 45 years old and resides in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Helaria owns and operates a farm, where she plants and harvests corn for sale in order to earn a living.  She has eight years of experience in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Helaria has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, Helaria wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is 29 years old and is married. He has one child who is 5 years old. Simeon sells spare parts in his business, working from 5am until 5pm every day, with two employees to help him.

Simeon has requested a loan from Kiva lender, Vision Finance company to help him expand his business by financing more spare parts to sell. With this profit from this loans, Simeon will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Chang

texts.en:
Chang, 61, is a skillful farmer who has been involved in crop husbandry for more than 20 years. However, she performs her farming tasks by using traditional methods as do other local cultivators. She knows how to keep her land fertile and how to protect her crops from the challenges of insects. She has been blessed with five children, four of whom are already married and all live independently except for her youngest child. 

Chang is seeking a loan from our lenders to pay for rented farmland, on which she will grow rice and potatoes as well. For her business goal, she aims to own a few plots of farmland, thereby increasing her household income.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmland

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe Benkadi  sont des hommes mariés qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Ils vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Manakoro,  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla.
Ils sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
Pour l’utilisation de ce prêt, N’GAMI, 2 eme personne assise de la droite vers la gauche compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 3 hectare de maïs.
La production est vendue au niveau de Fana, Marka-Coungo après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 450 000FCFA après la campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The eight members of the group "Benkadi" are married men averaging 52 years of age and five children each. The men live for the most part in polygamous families in Manakoro, a village in Commune de Fana, in Dioïla Prefecture. They are on their fourth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of carrying out their rainy season work. They grow corn exclusively, as it remains the dominant crop in the area. 

To put this loan to use, N’GAMI, who is the second person sitting from the right in the photo, intends to buy supplies and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 3 hectares of corn. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana and in Marka-Coungo to a customer base composed of men and women. He plans on making an average profit of about 450,000 francs CFA after the planting season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and also to help out his extended family in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding, and sundry farm equipment

loans.name: Fatou Lokar's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois créé le 22 décembre 2010, est composé par des femmes du même village. Des femmes dynamiques et solidaires. Elles font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche.
Debout à droite de la photo, Thiata est âgée de 35 ans. Elles mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 garçons. Elle fait parti du Banc Villageois et depuis son adhésion elle exerce l'embouche.
Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter 4 moutons et leur nourriture. 
Avec le reste de l'argent elle va acheter du mil qu'elle va stocker pour le revendre au moment opportun.
Les bénéfices gagnés lui permettent d'entretenir sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The banc villageois established December 22, 2010 is composed of women from the same village. These women are dynamic and supportive of each other. They make a living through commerce and from raising and fattening animals. 

Standing on the right of the photo and raising her hand, Thiata is 35 years old, married, and a mother of six children, including two boys. She is a member of the banc villageois and since she joined, she has been raising and fattening sheep. With this loan, she is going to buy four sheep and their feed. With the rest of the money, she is going to buy millet to store and resell when the time is right. 

The income earned will allow her to support her family and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet and four sheep to fatten

loans.name: Permadi

texts.en:
Permadi runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. Permadi lives west of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Permadi is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Permadi began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Akueli Group

texts.fr: AKUELI est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Hortense(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 32 ans. Hortense est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de Oscar. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Hortense vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Hortense et son mari. Pour cette raison, Hortense vend des plastiques, des tissus et des bijoux dans sa région depuis cinq environ ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Hortense s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Hortense sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe AKUELI, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des plastiques, des tissus et des bijoux.

loans.name: Heremakono 6 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe HEREMAKONO 6  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: l’arachide et le mais avec FATOUMATA la personne au milieu sur la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1/2 hectare. La production est vendue à FAKOLA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Farida is happily married. Together with her husband, they are blessed with three children. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming and sheep farming. Because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek advice on the best farming practices. Farida has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. 

Dairy farming in Nandihills is a very profitable venture. In the recent past, milk prices have been going up, so Farida, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy-processing firms. 

She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Farida hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. It is clear that this smallholder farmer is determined to reach her goal, and her request should be considered. Her positive attitude and desire to get ahead reveal the immense desire in this smallholder-farmer Kenyan mum to better herself and get a favorable response to her loan request.
Support her during this festive season!

loans.use: to buy another quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 44 years old. He is married with four children. He has had a retail shop business for four years. He will be using the loan to purchase shop inventory, e.g., eggs, milk, sugar, salt, soap, etc. and hopes this will help him to provide for his family and educate his children well.

Paul's hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his shop and his maize farming. He is in his second loan cycle and has borrowed KShs 40,000 to be repaid in 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase shop inventory, e.g., eggs, milk, sugar, salt, soap, etc.

loans.name: Marlou

texts.en: Marlou is from CAlamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years of age. He and his partner have 2 school-age kids. This year, 2011, he joined Paglaum MPC and he appreciates the programs and services of the said co-op. From his desire to help the family, he engaged in selling fish in different barangays in municipality of Sergio Calamba. Only his motorcycle was used as his source of transportation to reached the different barangays and sell fish. His source of income existed for seven years now. In need of additional working capital, he requested a financial assistance from Paglaum MPC an amount of Php 5,000.00 to purchase more stocks of fish. Through this, he hopes to increase and/or has more income for he is able to provide for the daily needs of his family and also he is happy he can support the education of his children which is his main priority of his hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish for selling

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
The need for an extra income was what pushed Hermelinda to start selling shoes by catalogue, seeing as her husband does not have a good income. Her primary concern is to be able to provide her 3 children with the education they require to be able to have a future with dignified quality of life. It has already been two years since she started her project, and thanks to the unconditional support of her own and the love of her family, she has been able to continue until now.

Hermelinda now requires a loan of $475 that will be used to purchase merchandise that her clients have asked for, as she does not have the needed capital to increase her selection. She plans to repay the full amount of her loan in a term of 5 – 10 months. Don’t doubt it and decide to help Hermelinda to continue moving forward and help her dream become reality, to provide her children with the education they need. They will thank you forever.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La necesidad de ingresos extras, fue lo que impulso a Hermelinda a iniciar a vender zapatos por catálogo, ya que su esposo no tiene un buen ingreso. Su principal preocupación es poder brindarles a sus 3 hijos la educación que requieren para poder tener un futuro con una calidad de vida digna. Ya son dos años de que ella comenzó con este proyecto, y gracias al apoyo incondicional de los suyos y al amor a su familia ha logrado continuar hasta el momento.

Hermelinda en este momento requiere de un préstamo de $475 DLLS, mismo que utilizará para la compra de mercancía que sus clientes le solicitan, pues ella no posee el capital para surtir. Ella planea cubrir el monto total de su préstamo en un plazo de 5-10 meses. No lo dudes y decídete a apoyar a Hermelinda a seguir adelante y poder hacer realidad la ilusión de brindarles a sus hijos la educación que necesitan. Ellos te lo van a agradecer siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta D. lives with her three daughters, Maria Esther, Bartola and Carolina in there home in a small town called Juan Pablo Duarte. Roberta has established her business in this community as having delicious dishes including Yaniqueque (johnnycake) which is a popular and inexpensive Dominican dish, which consists of meat and cheese wrapped in bread and cooked on a griddle. This loan will allow Roberta to go from serving a small number of families in her community, to being able to cook for and sell to the growing number of patrons.

All that Roberta manages to save is going towards a $2,000 operation for her 19-year-old daughter, Maria Esther (pictured center) who has been diagnosed with cancer. Roberta has been managing her small business for more than 10 years and with this loan she will be able to expand and provide better the basic needs of her family.

NOTE: Roberta is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying $150 each of this $750 loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Purchase bread, meat, cheese, vegetables, cooking oil, dishes and materials for her food stand

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mr. Men S. is 41 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and their 3 children--one of whom works at the local garment factory.  Men S. buys and sells motorcycles for a small profit, generally earning about $15/day.  He will use this loan to purchase more motorbikes for his business.  In the future, he would like to grow his business so that he can send his children to university.

loans.use: To purchase motorbikes for resale

loans.name: Francisca Orfilia

texts.es: Hello, my name is Francisca A. and I make and sell corn tortillas. I have had my business for 4 year and I my daughters help pack and distribute my product. I have loyal customers because my product is sold in different grocery stores and markets in our neighborhood. With the loan, I will be able to remodel the store and build another furnace.

loans.use: Purchase corn flour, lime, salt, water, firewood, matches and coal

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
I am Mumtaz B. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan, with my husband and six children. My husband is a wall painter, however, his income is not a steady source of money because he is just on on-call, contract work.

For a living, I make paper envelopes. A shopkeeper gives me the raw material (paper) and then I turn this into envelopes. Despite this dedicated and hard work, I am underpaid for my work.

I know that it is very important to get our children educated these days but I am not in a position to afford paying for their education. I wish to improve my income by purchasing the paper to manufacture the envelopes instead of making it for the shopkeeper. There is a large demand for paper envelopes and I believe that I have the right expertise to respond to this market demand. Therefore, I am asking for a loan of $225 USD.

loans.use: To buy paper for making paper envelopes

loans.name: Che Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is a single mother of four children, two of which are below the ages of 15 years. Even though she is a single mother, she tries her best to see her children get the minimum education. Her business selling food items has been their only source of income.

In order to invest more capital in to this business, she requested a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA). The profit will be used to meet the basic needs for her children and pay their school fees.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase food items, soap, matches and toilet paper

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tea farming business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is a joyful, loving and hard-working mother. Her meager financial resources and the arrival of her first child did not allow her to complete secondary school. She held several different jobs in order to generate her own income and proviD. well-being and security for her baby. Now with two teenage children, she is working as an assistant in a dental clinic. In addition to this job, she sells dental supplies to dentists in the city of Juliaca, and above all to dentistry students at the two universities in the district of Puno. Cecilia's wish is to proviD. her two children with a profession, so that in the future they can have a career that allows them to make a living and get ahead in life. To put her plan into place she is asking for your kindhearted support in the form of a loan to be repaid in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer

Cecilia es una alegre, amorosa y laboriosa madre, sus bajos recursos económicos y la llegada D. su primer bebé no le permitieron concluir sus estudios superiores razón por la cual se puso a trabajar en diferentes actividades para generar sus propios ingresos económicos y brindarle bienestar y seguridad a su pequeño . Actualmente ya con dos hijos adolescentes viene trabajando como asistente en una clínica dental, adicionalmente a este oficio se dedica a vender material dental a los dentistas D. la ciudad D. Juliaca y sobre todo a los estudiantes D. la carrera D. odontología D. las dos universidades del departamento D. Puno.
