El deseo dedoña Cecilia es ofrecerles una profesión a sus 2 hijos, para que en un futuro tengan una carrera con que defenderse y progresar en la vida, para concretar sus planes en esta oportunidad recurre a tu generoso corazón y hace la petición D. un préstamo monto que será repuesto en un lapso D. seis meses.

loans.use: Increase in capital to purchase a greater quantity of dental supplies.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Señora Norma is 42 years old. She has three children who are the reason for her progress. She is a very active woman who during the school year sells sweets in a park near her home. When school is out, Señora Norma sells groceries. Norma and her husband Señor Edgar struggle to come out ahead and, above all, to provide an education to their beloved children. Señora Norma wants to increase the production of her business and, with time become a wholesale distributor of groceries and sweets. Because of this she also would like to purchase a vehicle so that she can get around and deliver her products to those who need them. Señora Norma awaits the selfless assistance of your kind and sincere heart.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

La señora Norma de 42 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos los cuales son la razón de su progreso, ella es una mujer muy activa pues vende durante el tiempo escolar dulces en un jardín cerca de su domicilio, y en época de vacaciones doña Norma se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Ella en compañía de su esposo el señor Edgar luchan por salir adelante, y sobre todo por brindarle educación a sus queridos hijos.La señora Norma desea incrementar los productos de su negocio y con el tiempo llegar a ser una distribuidora mayorista de abarrotes y dulces, para esto requiere también de una movilidad y quiere comprarse un mototaxi para movilizarse y llevar sus productos a quienes lo requieran. La señora Norma espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble y bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Business Improvements

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania is a street vendor who sells pork and chicken rinds in her stand at the 16 de Juilio market in the city of El Alto. Her husband is currently unemployed, so he helps her with the business. They have 3 school age children and live in the Villa Ingenio zone in the city of El Alto.

The loan is needed for the purchase of products (papa, chuño) in order to restock for a period of time, since the prices for these products are rising because of the high inflation that the country is experiencing. If she manages to buy these products at a good price, then her meal prices will not increase, so she will sell as much as usual.

This is her second loan request via Kiva. Her excellent payment history allows her to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Epifania es vivandera tiene su puesto de venta en la feria 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto; el producto que comercializa es chicharrón de pollo y cerdo; su esposo es desempleado actualmente y esta ayudando a la esposa; tienen tres hijos que están en edad escolar y vive en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para comprar mercadería (papa, chuño) para poder abastecer por un determinado tiempo ya que estos insumos están subiendo de precio, debido a la inflación que actualmente se vive en el País. Si logra comprar los productos a buenos precios, entonces el precio de sus platos de comida no se incrementará y podrá seguir vendiendo como hasta ahora.

Es el segundo crédito vía Kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró le faculta para otorgarle otro préstamo.

loans.use: Purhcase of potatoes, chuños (freeze-dried potatoes) and other products before prices increase

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a tent and chairs

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo is 33 years and and married. He lives with his 27 year old wife in their own house along with their five children: 3, 5, 7, 8 and 10 years old. Eduardo has worked in his tire workshop for several years and has a good location on his town's main avenue. There is a fair amount of competition--several other tire shops around--but due to Eduardo's time with the business and his good location he is seeing good demand.

His curreny loan application is to buy used tires and inner tubes to fix them up and sell them. This is Eduardo's fifth loan with Fundación Agrocapital and he has always been punctual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Eduardo tiene 33 años de edad y actualmente se encuenra casado, vive con su esposa de 27 años en su casa propia, la pareja tiene 5 hijos de 3, 5, 7, 8 y 10 años de edad. Eduardo trabaja en su gomería desde hace varios años atras, esta se encuentra bien ubicada ya que está en plena avenida principal de la comunidad. La competencia es mediana ya que existen otras gomerías por el lugar, pero debido a su antiguedad y ubicación del negocio es que cuenta con bastante demanda. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de llantas y camaras usadas para acomodarlas y luego poder nuevamente comercializarlas. Esta es la quinta secuencia de Eduardo con la institución y siempre demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.

loans.use: Buy used tires and inner tubes for his tire workshop

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Mr. Andrés Y. lives in his own home in the Bajo Tacagua zone of La Paz. Andrés works as a chauffer and is the owner of a minivan in the city´s public transportation system.

The loan he is requesting will be for maintenance and to purchases tires for his minivan, which is his means of support.

This is the fifth time he has asked for a loan and a socioeconomic analysis rates him favorably for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Andrés Y. vive en casa propia, en la zona Bajo Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Andrés trabaja como chofer y es propietario de un micro en el transporte público de la ciudad.

El crédito solicitado será destinado al mantenimiento y a la compra de llantas para su micro, que es su herramienta de trabajo.

Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: For maintenance and tires for his minivan.

loans.name: Yukea

texts.en: Mr. Yukea P. lives in Trapaing Pouv Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and works as a fisherman. Mr. Yukea P.’s boat has a leak and cannot be repaired, meaning that he cannot gather any fish to support his family. Thus, Mr. Yukea P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat and bamboo to make fishing equipment. His wife, Mrs. Nimul Lanh, is a Khmer cake maker and seller. Mr. Yukea P. is 21 and the father of two children, both of whom are too young to work or attend school. Mr. Yukea P. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a new boat and bamboo to make fishing equipment.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a married woman with one child, age 7. She has been a clothes seller since 2001. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US90 from her sales.

Prisca now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: This is the third cycle of Mrs. Kong D.'s loan request to improve her living conditions in the Pour Mras village in the Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Em Vannarith, who is a rice wine maker that processes wine from rice. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it, so his wife, Mrs. Kong D., has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice for her husband's business. Mrs. Kong D. is 20 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Kong D. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's current business. She has fully paid it back. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to ask for a loan to buy more rice to process into rice wine.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, desde siempre quiso tener un kiosco para la venta de diversos productos, gracias al trabajo de años y el esfuerzo de cada uno de los miembros de su familia logró conseguir abrir su tienda, en la cual le va muy bien y es muy amable con sus clientes, razón por la cual su negocio es el más concurrido de su localidad.Ella siempre ha teniendo habilidad para las ventas y sobre todo de conocer las necesidades de sus clientes para tratar de satisfacerlas. Por ello, requiere de la suma que solicita para la compra de productos y mercadería necesaria para ampliar su negocio y surtirlo con mejores y variados productos, ya que así sus ganancias serán mayores y solventará los gastos de su hogar.Esperamos que usted pueda ayudar a Norma con sus planes de negocio y que prontamente tenga un negocio próspero y consolidado.
texts.en:
Norma has always wanted to have a kiosk to sell all kinds of products, and thanks to years of hard work and the support of her family members she was able to open her store. Everything has gone very well and Norma is very warm to her customers, the reason why her store is the most visited in her neighborhood. She always has had the ability for sales and, above all, knows the needs of her clients and how to try and satisfy them. To do that, she is requesting a loan to purchase necessary products and supplies to grow her business and stock it with more and better merchandise, which will help increase her earnings and help her cover household expenses. We hope that you can help Norma with her plans so that she will quickly have a prosperous and stronger business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with new and diverse merchandise

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mom L. is a villager in Sen Born village in Takeo Province. She is a housewife who takes care of her children. Her husband Mr. Tho To is a construction worker. They have four children. One child is employed as a security gaurd and the other three children attend the local school.

They do not earn enough money to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Srey Mom L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband. The motorbike will allow her husband to work more. She hopes to increase the family's income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nidia Del Carmen

texts.es:
El nacatamal es una de la comidas típicas de Nicaragua y a la elaboración de este alimento se dedica la señora Nidia P. en la ciudad de Masaya. Ella aprendió a elaborar este alimento gracias al apoyo de su mamá quien de muy pequeña le enseñó a prepararlos y a la vez para que le sirviera como negocio con el cual mantener a sus hijos.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar créditos 	que le permitan comprar la materia prima como lo es la hoja, cebollas, chiltomas, tomate y la carne de cerdo. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma mejorará su condición económica en su hogar.
texts.en:
The nacatamal is a typical Nicaraguan food, and Mrs. Nidia P. prepares nacatamales in the city of Masaya. She learned to make them thanks to the support of her mother, who taught her how to prepare them from a very young age, so that it would serve her as a business with which she could support her children. Today, she has come to Ceprodel to ask for loans that will help her buy the necessary ingredients, such as mint leaves, onions, sweet peppers, tomatoes, and pork. She hopes quite confidently that she will receive her loan, and in this way will improve her household's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients to make nactamales

loans.name: Fozia Hafiz Tahir Group

texts.en:
My name is Fozia and I am 25 years old and a married lady. I reside in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrines. Many people come to visit the city of shrines. I feel lucky that I got a blessing from God to live in this city. I completed my education until the 5th standard (grade). I have no kids. My husband's name is H. T., and he is a wholesaler. He sells wheat and rice in food markets. He has 25 years experience in this business. I help my husband in filling the wheat and rice sacks. I am applying for a loan to buy more wheat and rice to resell. 

I am a group leader of a few more members of my locality. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy washing powder (soap) to resell. Rashda baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell. Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wheat and rice to resell

loans.name: Halicha

texts.ru: Халича  замужем, имеет 4 детей. Халича  получает кредит для расширения бизнеса. Ее точка находиться  в не очень хорошем условием: зимой  сквозняк, а навес, покрытый целлофаном  протекает вот время дождя, но все-таки  выгодное место, не далеко от прохода базара, люди проходят мимо обязательно что-нибудь купят. Она торгует конфетами и печеньями, которые привозят поставщики или какие – либо фирмы снабжают. Ее доход позволяет рассчитываться с ними за 2-3 дня, в зависимости от сезона продажи.  Свою прибыль Халича  рассчитывает по ровно, часть на бизнес в оборот –приобретает конфеты , часть  для домашнего быта.  Она планирует расширить  свой бизнес увеличив и  разнообразив ассортимент.
texts.en:
Halicha is married and has four children. She wants to get a loan to expand her business. Her vendor point location is not in a very good condition: in the winter it's cold and the roof is covered with cellophane which leaks when it rains, but nevertheless is a profitable place, not too far from the market where people pass by often and stop by to buy something. She sells candy and cookies which suppliers or other firms bring in. Her income let's her pay them back in two-three days depending on the season's sales. Halicha divides her profits in half, one part goes back into business to by more candy and other half info the household. She plans to expand her business by increasing and diversifying the variety of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr:
F. Cathérine a 35 ans et est originaire de Adjohoun. F. Cathérine est mariée à DADJO Félix, un conducteur de vehicule, au ministère de la culture et du tourisme. F. Cathérine a deux enfants:un garçon et une fille,tous scolarisés. F. Cathérine a décidé de se lancer dans le commerce des produits vivriers afin d'aider son mari dont le revenu est presque insignifiant, à véritablement faire face aux charges familiales et assurer un avenir meilleur à leurs enfants. F. Cathérine achette des produits vivriers dans les marchés locaux du Bénin, en dehors de la ville de Cotonou. De retour des marchés locaux, elle se rend directement à TOKPA (le marché international du BENIN) et vend ces produits vivriers aux semi-grossistes et aux détaillants, qui à leur tour les revendent dans le même marché TOKPA. L'activité de F. Cathérine évolue de jour en jour; c'est pourquoi elle sollicite un nouveau prêt pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest. Le Bénin est à coté du Nigeria; son PIB par habitant est de $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux à 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Cathérine ADONOUGBO is 35 years old and is from Adjohoun. She is married to Félix DADJO, a driver for the ministry of culture and tourism. She is a mother with two children (a boy and a girl), who are both in school. No longer wanting to let her husband cope alone with the day-to-day household expenses, she has decided to use her almost-insignificant income to get started in the commerce of staple foods. This will also help her husband to ensure the best future for their children. For this, she acquires her goods at the local marketplaces outside the city of Cotonou. Upon returning from the market, she goes directly to TOKPA (the international market of Benin), where she delivers her goods to wholesalers and retailers, who in turn resell them at TOKPA. Let us note that staple foods cost more at TOKPA than at local marketplaces. Her business is continuously evolving, and this is why she is requesting a new loan to satisfy her customers. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three 50-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: Makunguru Group

texts.en:
Joyce has been a snack seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2004). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business for 6 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Joyce is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Neema and Suzana. Each woman has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola lives in Agege, but travels to Edo state, a journey of about five hours by bus, to buy plantains. Bukola goes to different markets within Edo state. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. Bukola is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more plantains to sell. She thanks you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Stella K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child, who is one year old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Stella has been running a charcoal business since 2007. Charcoal is used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite a good business. Stella works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by her husband. Stella currently earns about 100 USD from her business.

Stella is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Stella thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk for her business

loans.name: Ajibola

texts.en: Ajibola sells planks. She is 42 years old and married to S. who is a teacher and they have three children. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet operates a hog-raising business. She is married, 47 years old, and has children living in Barangay Catayauan Lallo, Cagayan.

Juliet has raised hogs for many years. She hopes that the business will somehow become progressive for her family, especially for her four children. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 that she needs to purchase a feed supply for her hogs.  

According to her, the business is doing well and it really contributes a big help in sending her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Rosario Alejandra

texts.es:
Rosario vive en la avenida Santísima Trinidad de la zona villa Cooperativa  en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Ella es soltera vive en casa de sus padres. 

Trabaja como enfermera auxiliar, en un hospital de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara  para continuar sus estudios superiores. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Rosario lives in the Cooperativa zone in the city of El Alto. She is single and lives in her parents’ home. She works as an auxiliary nurse in a hospital in the city. The loan will be used to continue her higher education studies. This is her second loan with Impro, and the evaluation carried out qualifies her to be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (which will be used to continue her higher education studies).

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita F., a 33-year old mother of seven, has a positive attitute and is hardworking and tenacious. She works double-time as mother and micro-entrepreneur. Her family has been living in a rented house in Malaria, Caloocan City for the past six years. Raising her brood has been a financial challenge, so her husband decided to work as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) to provide for the family's needs and to save money for the education of their children.

On her own, Marita tends to the family's electronics repair business. She earns income by providing repair services and selling unredeemed repaired items. Her membership in the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) gave her access to additional capital for the business. She is now applying for her second loan of PHP4,000, which she will use to purchase electronic parts for her growing repair service.

Marita's business earnings are the main source of income for the family. They have been particularly helpful in sending five of her children to school (one high school, four elementary). Marita's business has also blessed other families in their community by employing two service workers and generating income for them.

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Wendy Del Carmen

texts.es: Wendy del Carmen N. D. D. resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango en el departamento D. San Salvador. Wendy vive con su esposo quien tiene un negocio que es un taller automotriz, en su casa también los acompañan sus cuatro hijos, todos aun menores D. edad y estudiantes D. primaria. Wendy ayuda a su esposo en los gastos familiares apoyada D. los ingresos que obtiene por su negocio que es la venta D. comida y bebidas, también Wendy es socia D. una marca D. productos D. belleza en la cual obtiene comisiones por la venta D. productos D. ese catalogo, pero ahora Wendy solicita un crédito para la compra D. materia prima para la elaboración D. su comida que ofrece en su negocio.
texts.en:
Wendy del Carmen N. D. Duenas lives in the municipality of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. Wendy lives with her husband who has an auto body shop, their four children live with them at home, they are all still kids and are on elementary school. Wendy helps her husband with the family expenses thanks to the income she gets from her business selling food and drinks, Wendy is also a member of traD. mark beauty products company for which she obtains commission from sales of their catalogue products. Wendy is requesting the loan to buy groceries to prepare the food she sells at her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to prepare the food she sells

loans.name: Sylivia Nakawooya’S Group

texts.en:
Sylvia is the leader of a group of four members. She is 24 years old and married with two children aged 1 and 3 years. One of her children goes to school. She owns a two-room house where she is staying with five people. Sylvia takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day.

Sylvia resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Sylvia sells passion fruits in Nakulabye market in one of Kampala's suburbs She incurs extra transport costs traveling to and from shopping at Owino market, one of the busiest markets. Sylvia sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Sylvia sells mainly on a retail basis. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises.

Sylvia has been in this business for the last 5 years She has been with MCDT for over two years and is applying for her fourth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of passion fruits and oranges. Sylvia aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own permanent business premises. .

loans.use: To buy more sacks of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ce crédit sera utilisé pour l'achat de la machine de vulgarisation

loans.name: Apineru

texts.en:
Apineru V. is a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Nonoa. She is single and does not have any chlidren. To make a living, Apineru owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting bananas for sale. Apineru has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Apineru joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Apineru has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Apineru is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Apineru plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Niza

texts.en: Niza D. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 41 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Niza owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Niza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Niza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette S. is from the village of Mantic Tangub. She is 40 years old. Bernadette is married. To make a living, Bernadette owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store where she sells daily-use products and dried goods in the local community. Bernadette has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Bernadette joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadette is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Bernadette's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia C. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a ready-to-wear clothing business. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 74 años y es madre D. 07 hijos,  02 que aun depenD. D. ella y está estudiando.Juana, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en el Mercado Central D. su Distrito y lleva 27 años en el negocio, tiene un puesto muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores D. la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, venD. en las mañanas D. 9:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente con ganas D. seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda D. abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs Juana belongs to the communal bank “Las Trabajadoras” (the Workers), in the Juanjui District, in the Province of Mariscal Caceres, San Martin Department. She is a widow, 74 years old and the mother of 7, 2 who are still her dependents and are students. Juana has been selling prepared food in the Central Market of her District for the last 27 years. She has a well-appointed stall to serve her customers. She tells us that every day she has many customers because of the tasty food that she prepares. Her main customers are residents of the city, passersby, and regulars who already know her. She is very popular. Currently she is still doing the same business and she’s very happy with her daily work. She sells in the mornings from 9 am to 2 pm. She is the one who personally takes care of her customers with her characteristic enthusiasm. With the loan of 1,500 soles, she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of the food such as kilos of rice, sugar, gallons of oil, bags of potatos, quantities of chickens, vegetables and also utensils to improve her business and to better care for her customers. She is determined to get ahead. She has many dreams and goals in her life, such as to open her own well-stocked grocery store. She would like to thank the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for their help in starting her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Ramazon

texts.en:
M. Ramazon is a married man with five children. His children are the reason that he tries so hard to provide them with a stable family life and an education for their future. For the past two years Ramazon has sold rice. This is a profitable business in his neighborhood, and his sales have increased considerably year after year. His start-up capital was from the severance pay he received from where he used to work. 

To expand his business, Ramazon is requesting a loan of $3000, which he intends to use for increasing the size of his inventory. The loan will greatly improve Ramazon’s income and his family's standard of living. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Mamus

texts.en: Mamus I. sells colorful shoes and bags at retail prices to her customers. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Mamus is 30 years old, single without children. She hopes to get married very soon. She is hoping for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: K. Louise est née le 26 octobre 1960 au Bénin. Louise vit depuis 40 ans à Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à TCHICOHOSSOU Claude un conducteur de poids lourds, Louise est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Le couple a sept autre enfants à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble à Fidjrossè. Louise vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Louise n’a fait que l’école primaire. Il y a environs 25 ans que Louise vend des bois de chauffage et du charbon de bois, à son domicile. Louise s’approvisionne dans les forêts du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Louise a obtenu déjà trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Louise désire agrandir davantage son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, mais elle ne dispose pas suffisamment de fonds pour y parvenir. C’est la raison pour laquelle Louise sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Louise K. was born October 26, 1960 in Bénin. Louise has lived in Fidjroose a Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, for 40 years. Married to Claude Tchicohossou, a heavy truck driver, Louise has one child who is in school. The couple takes care of seven other children. The family lives together in Fidjrosse. Louise helps her husband support the family. She did not go to elementary school.

About 25 years ago, Louise started selling firewood and charcoal out of her home. Louise stocks up in the forests of Bénin and in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Louise has already received three loans from ALIDé, loans which she repaid in full. Louise would like to grow her business more in order to better satisfy her customers, but she does not have enough funds to manage this alone. For this reason, she is asking for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Wholesale Firewood

loans.name: Mhamadi

texts.en:
Mhamadi is a 25-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their two children. Mhamadi has been working as a truck driver since 2000. He will transport anything that his clients request. His clients can be anyone from his region, but they are mainly firms. 

He has requested a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase tires for his truck. This is the first time that Mhamadi has requested a loan. His business is speciA. because he knows how to treat his clients and is punctuA.. When he first started his business, he had difficulty paying for his truck expenses. He decided to start his business because he likes to work independently work and be his own boss. In the future, he plans to improve his business so he can improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his truck

loans.name: Pajero Group

texts.en:
Jambo from Tanzania!

This is Iddy S. and the Pajero loan group from Dar es Salaam. The group named itself after the Pajero car. There are sixteen men and women in this group. In the photo Iddy is second from the left in the back row wearing a white cap. 

Iddy S. is 41 years old, married and has one son who is 11. He has been operating a "duka," or shop, since 2007 where he sells items like oil, soap, sugar, tea, matches and other household items. His duka is open from 6am until 9pm every day. Iddy's shop is named "Father D Shop" and is located in the Kunduchi area of Dar es Salaam. This is a very popular area near the beach and Iddy, therefore, often runs out of stock. He buys more stock three times a week. Iddy is able to employ his younger brother at the shop and makes a monthly profit of 300,000 Tanzanian shillings (~$225 USD). 

This will be Iddy's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. He repaid the first one successfully. When asked about his future plans for his business Iddy says that he wants his shop to grow very big. He hopes that eventuA. he will make enough profit to buy a "pikipiki" (Swahili for "motorbike") to help him transport stock. Iddy says, "I feel very happy about getting this loan because I was down before, but now I'm going up and up a little at a time". Thank you for your support of Iddy and the Pajero loan group in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania!

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, soap, matches and other items for store

loans.name: Dasak

texts.en:
Mrs. Dasak S., 27, and her husband, Mr. Sophak Horng, 30, have been married since 2007 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of them still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her husband has had full-time employment in Phnom Penh for ten years.

Dasak has just started a business selling rice. She does not have enough capital to purchase more rice for resale, so she is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to add to her capital. On the other hand, a part of her house needs repair so it’s difficult for her family to live in it. So she will also use a part of her loan to make house repairs.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to sell and to repair her house

loans.name: Kasimova Rukiyahon`s Group

texts.en: K. Rukiyahon is married with 4 children. Her husband is a builder who usually works in the nearby villages and cities. Her main place of work is a local medical center. Her family also has its own business cultivating potatoes and onions on their own land. Her husband takes an active role in the family business. This loan will be used to buy seed potatoes. They started farming in 1996 when they harvested their first crop. They find it a very interesting and effective business. Adinahon, 28, is married with 3 children: 2 sons and 1 daughter. Her husband also works as a builder. Her 2 eldest sons go to school. They fatten cattle at their house. They have a ltttle yard where they keep all the animals. She is asking for a loan to buy 1 calf. Bahriddin is 35 years old. For the last few years, he has worked in Russia. After he returned he decided to start his own business. The most suitable one was livestock breeding. Now he has 4 cattle. This loan will be used to buy 1 calf and fodder for his animals. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of both its customers and the society), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please click here If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes

loans.name: Mario Andres

texts.es:
El   Señor Mario Andrés C. López, Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene  seis  hijos a su cargo,  y cuatro  se encuentra en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado seis créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los seis créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como, piso, cemento, y mano de obra para su casa de habitación ya que esta era de concreto.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Mario dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Andres C. L. is a hygenist. He works at Managua's East Market. He is married and has six children; four are school-age. Mario has had six loans with CEPRODEL, and has been working with the organization for six years. His credit has gone toward home improvements. He'll use this loan for construction materials like flooring and cement, and it will also help him pay for labour. Mario's goal is to improve the living conditions of his children, and help them to feel secure. Mario says this loan will only be used for home renovations.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and renovation

loans.name: So Phea's Group

texts.en:
Eleven members make up this village bank loan located in Sophi village in Takeo province.  Mrs. So Phea S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.  They will use the loans for different purposes. 

Mrs. So Phea S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Tha N., is a palm juice collector who can earn a small income to support his family.  In order to increase their income and improve the family's living situation, Mrs. So Phea S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding and to buy a cow cart to support her farming transport. 

Mrs. So Phea S. is a mother of six children; one is a farming laborer, three are students in the local school who also support their parent's businesses, while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo A. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
El señor Ricardo trabaja como albañil en construcciones privadas, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de la obra fina de dos habitaciones y así concluir su vivienda.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ricardo A. lives in his own home with his wife and three children in La Paz’s Pasankeri neighborhood. He works as a bricklayer at private construction sites; he uses his earnings to support his family. He will use the requested funds to finish work on two bedrooms thus completing building his home. This is his first loan request and the socioeconomic evaluation done indicates that he qualifies for it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building two rooms.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en: Aurora A. is from the village of Olango. She is 33 years old. Aurora is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Aurora raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aurora has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Aurora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Aurora is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Aurora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Azucena Altagracia

texts.es:
la sra. Azucena Altagracia D. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en la Aldea Corinto a la par de la refinadora de Sal INSAL. San Lorenzo, Valle.
Azucena se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia, en estos momentos la pulperia esta mejorando en las ventas, pero se esta quedando corta de producto, es por eso que necesita el credito para comprar mas productos y asi poder surtir bien la pulperia. Azucena dice sentirse muy contenta ya que la situacion se esta mejorando y las ventas estan creciendo, espera que para fin de año su pulperia cambie completamente y este bien surtida.
texts.en:
Azucena Altagracia D., 44, lives in the village of Corinto near the INSAL salt refinery in San Lorenzo, Valle. Azucena sells popular consumer products; she has a small grocery store. Recently the grocery store has been seeing improved sales, but this has left her short of products, and for this reason she needs a loan to buy more products so that she can restock her grocery store. Azucena says she feels very pleased that the situation is improving and her sales are growing. She hopes that by the end of the year she can change her grocery store completely and have it very well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beans, butter, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, bread, cookies, corn and flour tortillas, margarine, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, salt, condiments, eggs, soap, soup and grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel D. is from the town of Aurora. She is 34 years old. Maribel is married and has three school-age children. She dreams for her children to someday finish college and find suitable jobs for themselves in the future. 

To make a living, Maribel owns a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, which mainly consists of planting and harvesting rice for sale.

In 2009, Maribel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maribel from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house and supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Roció trabaja como empleada y su esposo es artesano zapatero, tiene 6 hijos tres están a su cargo y los demás son independientes. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Rió Seco  de la ciudad del Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de  material de construcción para refaccionar su vivienda.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro. El análisis de ingresos y egresos muestra su capacidad de pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rocio works as a maid and husband is a shoemaker. She has six children. Three live at home and the other three are now independent. Her home is located in the Rio Seco zone in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials for remodeling her home. This is his her first loan with Impro. The analysis of her income and expenses shows her ability to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials which are to be used in renovating her home.

loans.name: Holali Anita

texts.en:
Madame Holali Anita Adjeoda is a young entrepreneur living in Lome, Togo. At 27 years old, she has a successful beauty salon called Holani Coiffure. Her specialty is hair and beauty for her clients. She has had her business since 2004.

In order to continue to grow her business and satisfy her customers, Holali would like to purchase more cosmetic products to sell. She gets these products over the border in Accra, Ghana. To this end she has taken a loan of 400,000 XOF in order to pay for the purchase and transportation of these items. Madame Adjeoda is married to a mechanic and they have one child.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie S. is 45 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Barangay Bonfal West in Bayombong municipality, a part of the province of Nueva Vizcaya on the Luzon islands. Elvie owns a general store from which she sells products for daily use such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elvie joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a new loan, her first from ASKI, of 7000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use all additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Maria Dávalos quien está domiciliada en el barrio San Miguel de Ciudad del Este. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su comunidad.
El comité se Denomina Kuña Guapa  están en el Décimo Ciclo   con 20  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas.
Maria se dedica a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante, recorriendo varias localidades del país para vender sus ropas. 
Además de ropas ella también vende calzados deportivos y sabanas.
En ocasiones ella deja sus mercaderías a crédito y luego pasa a cobrarlos, comente que la actividad es muy sacrificada pero que le ayuda a su familia especialmente con la alimentación diaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas como remeras, camisas, suéter, pantalones, buzos y otros.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a los KIVA por la ayuda crediticia.
texts.en:
In forming this group, the main contact was Maria Dávalos, who lives in the Barrio San Miguel neighborhood of Ciudad del Este. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the communal bank in her community. The communal bank is called Kuña Guapa. There are 20 members, and they are in their tenth cycle. The group stands out in the neighborhood for being united, supportive, and responsible with each other. Maria sells clothes in an itinerant manner. She goes to different locations in the country to sell her clothes. In addition to selling clothes, she sells athletic shoes and sheets. Sometimes she sells her merchandise on credit, and later she goes to collect. She says that this activity is very demanding, but it helps her family, especially with the daily food. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes like t-shirts, shirts, sweaters, pants, sweatshirts, and others. She is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the financial help.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes like t-shirts, shirts, sweaters, pants, sweatshirts, and others

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen G. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old and is married with seven school-aged children. Belen owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Belen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Belen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer es un padre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pátapo, un distrito agrícola situado a  mas de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chicayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno desde hace mas de cuatro años, el cuenta con cuatro vacas de las cuales extrae diariamente la leche que producen para comercializarla con un acopiador de la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte) con la cual brinda servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros. Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades se encarga de hacerse cargo de los gastos familiares.

Elmer desea aumentar la producción de su ganado adquiriendo alimento balanceado para lo cual ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un joven padre que dia a dia se esfuerza en su trabajo para sacar adelante a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Elmer is a 23 year old father who lives with his wife and two children in Pátapo district, a farming area located more than 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a dairy farmer for over four years. He has four cows that he milks daily to sell the milk to the area milk consolidator. He also has a mototaxi (motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to provide transportation services) that he provides cargo and passenger transportation services with. Income from these activities allows him to meet family expenses. Elmer wants to increase milk production by providing his cows with nutritionally balanced feed. He has found it advisable to request a first, 1000 new sol loan, from Edpyme Alternativa. He is a young father who struggles daily in his work to support his family. People who know him hold him in high esteem and consider him to be a levelheaded, trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed to increase his dairy cattle’s milk production.

loans.name: Alice Jumamosi

texts.en:
Alice Jumamosi Lokidiya is a hardworking lady of 37 years. She is married and together they have four children, aged nine, seven, five and two years. She has been operating a boutique shop for the past nine years and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs.).

She learnt about KADET LTD and she had no history with any other MFI (microfinance institution) before. She  is applying  for her second loan of Kshs. 40,000, which she intends to use to purchase more clothes for the boutique  She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to start a secondary business; that is, dairy farming.

Alice hopes to grow her business and become the leading local investor in Kapenguria, Kenya, and to see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes adding stock in the boutique

loans.name: Vilma Rosario

texts.es:
Vilma de 56 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). Tiene un local de reciclaje que comprar y vende. 

Hace 10 años comenzó con el negocio de reciclaje con la idea y ayuda de uno de sus hijos pudo mejorar la recolección de botellas, tachos, cartones, etc. Poco a poco fue dividiendo los sectores donde recolectaba. En la actualidad trabaja con la ayuda de su hijos recolectando y clasificando desde las 09h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. En las horas libre que tiene se dedica a confeccionar ropa con una maquina de coser que tiene en su casa.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y tachos para ubicar los reciclajes. En el futuro quiere mejorar el lugar donde tiene las cosas reciclada.
texts.en:
Vilma is 56 years old and lives in El Guasmo in Guayaquil, an area characterized by the fact that the majority of its residents are informal merchants. She has a recycling business in which she buys and sells.

She began with the recycling business ten years ago with the idea and the help of one of her children. She was able to improve the collection of bottles, containers, cardboard, etc. Little by little, she began dividing the sectors where she collected. She currently works with the help of her children, collecting and sorting from 9am to 6pm every day. In the free time that she has, she makes clothing with a sewing machine that she has in her house.

With the loan, she wants to buy fabrics and containers for identifying the recycled materials. In the future, she wants to improve the area where she has the recyclables.

loans.use: Fabrics, supplies.

loans.name: Hiam

texts.ar:
هيام في عمر ال 47 متزوجة ولديها ولد تعمل في مجال الاشغال اليدوية تحب عائلتها وابنها وهي محبوبة جدا بمحيطها تلقى دعم كبير من عائلتها                                                                                                       
حيث بداءت هذه المهنة منذ اكثر من 7 سنوات طموحة ولديها ذوق كبير في مجال عملها لكن ما ينقصها هو المال لكي تطور مهنتها    هيام تريد قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء بضاعة جديدة لتوسيع العمل, تريد ان تبدأ بتزيين حفلات                                الأعراس
texts.en: Hiam, 47, is married with a boy. She works in handicrafts. Hiam loves her family and son and is known in her neighbourhood for having a very amiable character. She enjoys huge support from her family. Hiam started her business more than 7 years ago. She is ambitious and has excellent taste in her work but she lacks the capital needed to develop her business. Hiam applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy new goods to expand her business. She wishes to start working in decorating wedding areas.

loans.use: to buy goods and expand her business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa C. is from the village of Puntabon, Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Narcisa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Narcisa owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling medicinal or therapeutic coffee, tea and food supplements from LINGZHI products in the local community. Narcisa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Narcisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narcisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory for sale and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Narcisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for sale and working capital.

location.town: Puntabon, Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de muebles y también se dedica a la venta de artefactos como radios, televisores, equipos de sonido y otros artefactos, la socia trae artefactos de la ciudad de Tacna y lo vende a las diferentes personas y también vende a pedidos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artefactos al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gladys belongs to the “Ricchary Cusco” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Gladys is 44 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  Gladys divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling furniture.  She also sells appliances such as radios, televisions, sound systems, etc.  She brings appliances from the city of Tacna and sells them to different people.  She also sells to order.  Gladys would like to expand her business.  She is requesting her loan to buy appliances wholesale.

Gladys is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy appliances wholesale

loans.name: Safy

texts.fr: Madame Safy B. est une commerçante âgée de 33 ans qui vie avec son mari et ses enfants sis sur la photos dans un quartier populaire de Mbour. Son activité principale est la commercialisation de fruits et légumes et quelques fois du poisson frais  dans localités pour éviter à certains déplacements aux femmes ménagères. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités en l'octroi de stock de marchandises suffisantes à son exploitation
texts.en: Mrs. Safy B. is a merchant who is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and with their children, seen here in the photo. They live in the famous quarter of Mbour. Her business is the sale of fruits and vegetables although sometimes she also sells fresh fish to private homes to cater to housewives. She requests this loan to support her business with the purchase of quantities of merchandise for resale.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco José tiene 51 años, es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte  la cual surge como una nueva fuente de ingreso para su familia. Este le ha permitido mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y brindarle ingresos a su familia por, lo que tiene una ruta destinada en donde sus diferentes clientes disfrutan de su servicio. Y es por esto que solicita a Fundación León 2000 un financiamiento de manera que le permita comprar llantas, repuestos y otras reparaciones necesarias. Los deseos de Francisco son aumentar sus ventas y mantener el núcleo familiar estable en todos los ámbitos.
texts.en:
Francisco José is 51 years old, married and has two dependent children in his care.  His business activity is providing transport services.  This is a new source of income for his family which has allowed him to improve his quality of life a little and provide income for his family.  He has a set route where his different customers enjoy his service.

Francisco José is requesting a loan from Fundación León 2000 so that he can buy tires, spare parts and make other necessary repairs to his vehicle.  Francisco's wishes are to increase his sales and to keep his family unit stable in every way.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose Bartolome

texts.es: El Sr. José se dedica al servicio de transporte desde hace dos años, cuenta con vehículo de su propiedad, lo trabaja de manera personal desde horas muy tempranas, solicita el monto principalmente para la refacción de su vehículo y también para comprar material de construcción  como  vidrios y yeso para su domicilio ya que esta en obra gruesa, actualmente vive en su domicilio  conjuntamente su esposa que se dedica a labores del hogar y su  hijo que esta estudiando, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José has been providing transportation services for two years.  He has his own vehicle, which he works with starting at very early hours.

He is requesting a loan primarily to make repairs on his vehicle.  He will also buy construction materials like glass and plaster for his home because it is in rough shape.

He currently lives in his home with his wife, who devotes herself to the household chores.  He also lives with his son, who goes to school.

He is a very responsible and hard-working person.  He is always thinking about his family’s well-being.

He is very grateful to the institution for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Repair his vehicle and construction on his house

loans.name: Zereba

texts.en: Zereba is currently in the business of selling beverages such as mango and orange drinks and water. She is 34 years old, married to a housing sales manager, and has 7 children who all go to school.  She borrowed a loan to stock more beverages like orange and mango drinks, and water to sell.  With the extra profits, Zereba hopes to open a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To stock mango/orange drinks and water to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn M., 22, is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. She has a live-in partner and one small child. To make a living, Roselyn owns a general store selling snacks and other delicacies. 

In 2010, Roselyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000.00 PHP from PMPC which was used to start her business. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients to make a food products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Roselyn from PMPC.  

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her business

loans.name: Temirlan's Group

texts.en:
Temirlan S. is a member of this group. He is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village on the south coast of Lake Isykul. He is 27 and married. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, her started to breed livestock animals and resell them at a higher price after fattening. In this way he earns 6500 soms. That income has made it possible for his family to save money and open a kiosk.  

With money received from the loan he wants to purchase five more livestock animals in order to resell them after fattening. In the near future, Temirlan plans to repair his house and then save money to purchase a piece of land in Bishkek to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Indira Magaly

texts.en:
Indira is 30 years old, married, and has two children who are currently in school. When she was younger she studied to work in the nursing field. She currently works as a nursing assistant and has been doing so for six years. She hopes to one day run her own clinic. Her husband works in the cable television industry and helps support the family. 

Indira is requesting a loan to help pay for the remodeling of her family’s home. She lives in the cold highland region of Totonicapan. This is Indira´s third loan with ASDIR, and the previous two loans have been paid back in full.

loans.use: to remodel the family's home.

loans.name: Margarita Katty

texts.es:
Margarita de 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que inicio con la venta de cosméticos para apoyar a su familia está casada  y de su relación tiene dos hijos . Su conyugue trabaja como maestro albañil.

Ella trabaja en la tarde haciendo lo pedidos de sus clientes y a la vez va hacer sus cobranzas ya que lo deja créditos. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, bloques. Su anhelo más deseado es termina de adecuar su casa para así tener una vida plena con su familia y nada le falten a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old; she is a hardworking woman that began selling makeup to support her family. She is married and from that relationship she has two children. Her husband works as a mason.
Margarita works in the afternoons getting her customers’ orders and collects their debt. With the loan she wants to buy more construction materials such as cement, sand, and blocks. Her biggest dream is to finish fixing her home so that she can have a fulfilling life with her family and that her children will not lack for anything.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and blocks

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo D. is from the village of District 1. He is 56 years old. Cirilo is married and has five school-aged children. 

To make a living, Cirilo raises livestock, primarily pigs, for breeding. Cirilo has been engaged in his business for over 17 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cirilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Cirilo is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Cirilo from ASKI.
