In her communal bank she is a very happy member who is always adding humor to the group. She will use the requested 500 soles to buy more fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to take care of her crops

loans.name: Leonor Indiana

texts.es:
Leonor Indiana es una mujer activa de 64 años de edad, desde hace años logro poner su propio negocio un pequeño comedor que ha logrado hacer crecer con los años.
Procreo dos hijos los cuales la apoyan con el negocio, entre las dificultades es que son días variados, unos días se venden mas y otros poco, pero es un negocio que no se deja de vender.
Con este financiamiento lograra aumentar la inversión de alimentos para su comedor, en donde comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, harina, frutas y verduras, carnes, pollo en cantidades para la preparación diaria del menú.
A través de estos años, ha logrado la clientela, lo que se siente sastifecha de poder conservar su negocio.  Que es su fuente de ingreso para subsistir.
texts.en:
Leonor Indiana is an active, 64-year-old woman. Years ago she managed to start her own business, a small dining room, that she has managed to grow over the years. She has two children which she supports with the business. Among the difficulties she faces are that some days she sells more and other days she sells little. But it is a business where she can not stop selling. With this credit she will manage to buy more food for her dining room, such as rice, beans, sugar, flour, fruits and vegetables, meats, and chicken in quantities for the daily preparation of the menu. Through the years, she has attracted a growing clientele. She feels satisfied to be able to preserve her business, which is her source of income to subsist.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for the preparation of dishes for her restaurant

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: Hà Nguyễn Thị (20201020048) is a 28 year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Hà is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm Xá Nhóm 14 (Nhóm 14). Hà is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hà owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Hà has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,800,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2007, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by her from SEDA. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nghiêm Thị L. (0) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Hà Nguyễn Thị (20201020048) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các tH.nh viên. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nghiêm Xá nhóm 14 (Nhóm 14). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND. Vào 2007, Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nghiêm Thị L. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in a city called Multan, Pakistan, famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She owns a small house of two rooms where she lives with her seven children and her husband of over 20 years.

Zarina has five sons and two daughters: her elder son has a timber-selling business; next to him is a painter who paints walls and windows on call; the next two work in a factory on monthly wages; the youngest of her sons is free and doesn’t do anything; her daughters stay at home and help their mother in managing the household chores.

Zarina’s husband is named N. M. and he has a job in the government sector as a security guard but earns a low income.

Zarina herself owns and operates her sewing business. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband and to make him relax from this aspect. Her care for him makes her unique and he respects her a lot.

Zarina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her elder son. With the loan, he will buy timber in bulk and increase his sales by selling to more customers. Zarina is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan.

loans.use: To purchase more timbers for her son's timber-selling business

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita B. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Tita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Tita owns & operates a business venture providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Tita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Prum Ngim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people make up this village bank loan located in Putthi Sam village in Takeo province. Mrs. Prum N., 40 years old, is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Soy Kem, is a rickshaw driver. 

She has a problem because her home is uncomfortable to live in. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. Prum N. is asking for a loan to fix up her own house. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer, and the other is attending school. (The man in the back wearing a baseball cap is not a village bank member.)

loans.use: To fix up her own house

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle C., age 33, is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, Cotabato. Anabelle and her husband have one school-aged child. To make a living, Anabelle owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily-use products in the local community. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Anabelle joined HSPFI his year to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cecilia Ama

texts.en: Cecilia Ama E. sells foodstuffs such as fresh tomatoes, onions, and other items at Elmina.  She has attained junior high level of education.  She is married to a security man and has four children. The loan she hopes to get will be used to buy more foodstuffs for resale. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She hopes to reinvest her profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills. 

For over twelve years, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. Flora faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and purchase a taxi (motor vehicle) in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase ten bags of maize and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Estrella's Group

texts.en:
Estrella A. is from the village of Bugallon, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Estrella is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Estrella is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector selling agricultural supplies. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling animal feed and mash to local farmers. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Mariana Alexandra

texts.es:
Mariana de 19 años,  es madre soltera con un niño de 1 año, tiene una pequeña papelería en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una casa que solo cuenta con luz como servicio ubicada en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín. 

Decidió aprender cómo administrar una papelería para poder mantener a su hijo. Con unos ahorros compro papelería para venderla en la parte delantera de su casa. En l actualidad tiene distribuida su propia papelería con cuadernos, plumas, laminas etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y artículos para la papelería. 

En el futuro quiere tener bien surtido de mercadería su negocio para que sus ventas se incrementen y asi poderle dar una buena vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mariana, 19, is a single mother of a one year old son.  She has a small stationery shop in the front part of her house.  She lives in a house that’s only utility is electricity located in a periurban zone called Fortín.

She decided to learn how to run a stationery shop to support her son.  She used her savings to buy stationery items to sell in the front part of her house.  She currently has her shop stocked with notebooks, pens, diagrams, etc.  She is open from 7am until 8pm every day.  She wants to use the loan to buy notebooks, pens and other stationery items.

In the future she’d like to have her store well stocked with merchandise so that sales will increase thus being able to provide her son with a good life.

loans.use: For notebooks and pens.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Greetings from Theogene in Kigali, Rwanda! Theogene is 28 years old and married.

Theogene has been a motorbike taxi driver for 6 years. He works long hours transporting people to their work places. Currently he has to rent his motorbike and he plans to use this loan to help purchase his own motorbike.  He will use any profits to help his friends and family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, su mamá vive con ella en su casa. El marido es médico veterinario. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, pero ella también tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en temporadas de inicios de clases elabora y entrega uniformes a escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja con la ayuda de su mama todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, los productos de la tienda los recibe en su casa.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar hilos y otros materiales para la costura, así como también productos para surtir su tienda. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque siempre cumplen con lo que prometen. Sus sueños son tener su propia casa ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
The ladies of the Positive Women Community Bank meet every other week in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which for many years has been known as the city of Reales Tamarindos.

Here we find Mrs. María, who is 53 years old and involved with a man. Together they have three children who are grown and living independently. Her mother lives with her in their home. Her partner is a veterinarian. Many years ago she learned how to sew.

She has a small grocery store and also also has a small sewing shop. Many years ago she began sewing clothing, making all types of clothing based on specific orders from customers or during back-to-school season, making uniforms to sell to the local schools. She works with her mother's help from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm every day and sometimes later when she has orders to deliver. The products for her store are delivered to her house.

She will use the loan to buy thread and other sewing supplies, and also to buy products to stock her store. She is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because they always fulfill their promises. She dreams of having her own home since her current house is her mother's.

loans.use: To buy thread, buttons, zippers, groceries

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Santiago; el tiene 50 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cabina de internet y también se dedica a trabajar como profesor de un instituto, el socio trabaja en su negocio de cabinas de internet desde las 2:00 p.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de cabina de internet. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar suministros para las computadoras.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Llapanchispac Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Santiago is 50 years old, single, and has two children. He alternates his daily activities with his internet cafe business and he also works as a professor at an institute. He works at his internet cafe business from 2pm to 10pm and wants to expand this business. He is requesting the loan to purchase supplies for the computers.

Santiago is happy for the loan and promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the computers

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia tiene 52 años de edad, está casada con el sr. Higinio Leiva hace ya 35 años, juntos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 hijos están trabajando en Brasil en un taller de costura de prendas de lencerías para damas, y otro hijo está trabajando en Argentina, y la última hija también trabaja en forma independiente en la venta de joyas de plata en la ciudad de Asunción.
La misma es costurera y también confecciona las prendas de lencería para damas, para lo cual tiene máquinas de coser. En este ramo trabajó muchos años, ella vive junto con su esposo y su hija en la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Comenta que en este momento las ventas de las lencerías han disminuido bastante, por lo que emprendió otro negocio con la venta de platería (cadenas, anillos,pulseras, aros).
Ha retirado ya varios créditos, que le sirven mucho para su capital, dichos créditos son una herramienta muy importante para poder crecer dentro de su microempresa, y de esa forma mejorar también su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Alicia is 52 years old and has been married to Sr. Leiva for 35 years. They have four children, two of whom work in Brazil at a textile factory that makes women’s lingerie. Another child works in Argentina and the youngest daughter works independently selling silver jewelry in city of Asunción.

Alicia is a seamstress who also makes women’s lingerie garments and has sewing machines to perform her work. She lives with her husband and daughter in the city of Villa Elisa.

At the moment Alicia says that sales of lingerie have diminished significantly, so she started another business selling silver jewelry (chains, rings, bracelets, and rings). She has already taken several loans that have provided capital. The loans have been an important resource so that she can grow her small business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase silver jewelry (chains, rings, bracelets, and rings)

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Compostela, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, hog raising and motorcycle transport. Her husband Osias, who is 42 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have three children who are between 7 and 16 years old. Josefina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josefina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Josefina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza. In 2008, Ahmad opened his own electronics store in which he fixes and sells computers. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to increase the size of his store and buy cell phones for his store. He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To increase the size of his store and buy cell phones for his store

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.en:
Maria Nicolasa is 31 years old, married, and has two children. One of her children is currently studying in school. Maria works as a weaver and has four years' experience in the business. She started out operating a machine but now specializes in working by hand. She hopes to one day own her own machines and have working capital for her business. 

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase land for her family. This is Maria´s second loan through ASDIR. The previous loan has been paid back in full with no problems.

loans.use: to purchase land for family use.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabián, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, tiene 43 años de edad, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, esta casado con Celsa de 40 años y fruto se esa relación concibieron 02 hijas Karina de 16 años y Ana María de 13 años, juntos viven en su propia casa en el distrito de Santa Rosa. Fabián, empezó su aventura como agricultor desde muy niño en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por el agro lo llevó adquirir sus propias tierras donde viene trabajando 11 años de manera independiente; en el cual viene cultivando plantas de cacao, café y hojas de coca. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto y de esa manera logra avanzar con su trabajo. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que los frutos de sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de producto vendido; cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias así impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando a los frutos de sus plantaciones. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido. Con los 500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Fabian is originally from the district of Santa Rosa. He is 43 years old and he is a very happy and hardworking man. He is married to Celsa who is 40 years old and their relationship produced 2 daughters, Karina, 16 years old, and Ana Maria, 13. They live together in a home that is their own in the district of Santa Rosa. Fabian started his adventure as an agriculturist since he was a boy on his parents' land. His passion for agriculture led him to acquire his own land where he has been working independently for the past 11 years. He cultivates cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves. During the harvest he has help from farm hands who can quickly harvest the product and he therefore is able to advance with his work. He feels a great sense of commitment to his work. It is thanks to his daily efforts that today he is able to enjoy the fruits that the plants give him. He has obtained good earnings for each kilogram of product he has sold. He says that the winter season is not his favorite because during those months insects and rain are in abundance and it prevents him from doing his work efficiently and the products of the plantations are damaged. 

The loan which he requests will be used to acquire cocoa plants to graft them and take full advantage of the product when the weather is better. But his priority now is to purchase new land in order to expand his plantations and to increase production. This is his eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to make all of his payments on time, especially because he wishes to access other loans in the future. He is a very well liked member of is communal bank. With the 500 nuevos soles which he requests, he will purchase cocoa plants to graft them and to take full advantage of the good weather season.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa plants

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en:
Jro Ayu Putu P. A. is getting a second loan from MUK. The loan will be used to buy three piglets, which will be maintained for six months. 

Because the price of the special quality of feed needed is quite expensive, Jro Ayu Putu P. A. will feed the pigs with a combination of feeds, partly the good quality feed together with various types of leaves  that she can find in her garden.

Jro Ayu Putu P. A. has a dream of developing a bigger business raising pigs. With the profits she gets, she will build an additional stall to raise more pigs.

loans.use: To buy three piglets.

loans.name: Berlita

texts.en:
Berlita is 58 years old and married with eight grown children. She and her family lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur.

To earn an income, she operates a sari-sari store and cultivates their rice fields. Her business started three years ago and provides her family with PHP 4,000 per month. Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: En una tienda del barrio donde vive, Maria Isabel vende al detal productos de la canasta familiar a todos sus vecino de un amplio sector muy cercano al liugar de su vivienda;  ella iniciò este negocio hace mas de 7 años cuando lo comprò y aunque esta ubicada en un local arrendado le ha ido muy bien y ha logrado comprar vitrinas adicionales, las cuales le ayudan a hacer una mejor exhibiciòn de sus mercancias; Su poco capital de trabajo muchas veces no le permite hacer inversiones de mercancia en volumenes y ganar descuentos, por eso busca la oportunidad de aumentar su capital de trabajo a travès de credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, el cual dirigirà a la compra de ranchos, viveres y una nueva vitrina. Su sueño es tener su propio local para ahorrarse el arriendo y generar mayores ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia, conformada por sus 3 hijos en las edades de 18 a 26, años con quienes sueña ver exitosos y son su principal motivacion en la vida.
texts.en:
María Isabel sells at retail products common to the family grocery basket in a store located in the neighborhood where she lives to her neighbors in a wide area around where she lives.

She started the business over 7 years ago when she bought it and, although it’s located in a rented space, she’s done very well and has managed to buy additional display cases which help her display her merchandise better.

Her little working capital sometimes makes it impossible for her to invest in larger volumes of merchandise and earn discounts and that’s why she’s looking for an opportunity to increase her working capital through a Kiva loan which will be her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy snacks, foodstuffs and a new display case.

Her dream is to have her own locale to save on rent and generate higher income to support her family which is composed of three children between the ages of 18 and 26; she dreams with seeing them become successful and they are her main motivators in life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, foodstuffs and a new display case.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to boost her son’s business of selling clothes. His shop is located in the market and he sells different varieties of clothing to his customers. He purchases the clothes from Multan and Faisalabad which are known for their textiles. 

Razia is the mother of two sons and both of them have the same business. Her husband is elderly and can’t work due to his older age; that’s why he spends time at home. 

Razia is confident about the positive growth of her son’s business and about the better financial future of her family as a result of a loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden is 56 years old, married and has one child. For the last 10 years, she has made a living by running a retail store where she earns PHP 4,500 a month. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, coffee and bread to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to continue to have access to credit, because this will allow her to expand her business and provide her family with daily necessities.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, coffee and bread to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jerus

texts.en:
Jerus, a 52-year-old married mother of five children, lives in the Philippines where she has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and rice by the kilogram.

In business for 12 years, she is requesting a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy snacks, sacks of rice and canned goods. A member of HSPFI since 2003, Jerus hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sacks of rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Bartazard

texts.fr:
Client de 45 ans, marie et pere de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 15 ans.En 2005 il ouvre un pressing pour laver les vetements hommes et femmes, ses revenus sont de 10.000 a 25.000 fr par jour.

A l'octroi de son pret, il va acheter des detergents de differents qualite, des sachets pour emballage, des douzaines des cintres et il est entrain d'epargner pour acheter un groupe electrogene de 3kv pour palier au probleme d'electricite.

Pour le futur il a l'intention d'ameliorer ses conditions de travail,et travailler plus qu'avant pour ouvrir un autre pressing plus moderne.
texts.en:
He is a 45 year old client who is married and father of 3 children who are between the ages of 5 and 15.In 2005 he opened a laundry for men and women’s clothes, his income is of 10.000 to 25.000 per day.

When he receives his loan he will buy different quality detergents , bags for wrapping  the clothes, dozens of clothes hangers and he is in the process of saving up to buy a 3kv generator to resolve the electricity  shortage.

In the future he aims to improve his working conditions and work more than before in order to open another, more modern laundry.

loans.use: purchase detergents of different quality,bags ,and dozens of clothes hangers.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with five children. Three of her children are adults and two still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past six years, Rosemary has operated a business selling and distributing fresh water. She sells water from her home and also door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Rosemary's major business challenge is transportation.

Rosemary decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to purchase plumbing materials, pipes, taps, and an electric meter. In the future, Rosemary dreams of expanding her business to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing materials, pipes, taps and an electric meter

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria, se dedica a la venta de tamales, cuajada y queso, vive con sus dos nietos, ella se dedica al negocio de varios productos, como se menciona vende tamales de pollo dos veces a la semana, cuajada y queso todos los días los vende en su vivienda.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de leche para la elaboración de queso y cuajada, también comprara pollo, aceite y maíz para la preparación de los tamales, con el financiamiento podrá tener todo lo necesario para continuar en su negocio. 
Su aspiración es mejorar la vivienda, ya que tiene algunas deterioros, además de instalar una tienda fuerte así como la tuvo hace algunos años.
texts.en:
Apolinaria sells tamales, milk curd and cheese. She lives with her two grandsons. She is dedicated to her business of selling various products. She sells chicken tamales two times a week and sells milk curd and cheese from her home every day.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy milk for making milk curd and cheese. She will also buy chicken, oil and corn for preparing tamales. This loan will allow her to continue her business.

Apolinaria's dream is to improve her home, as it has some damage. She would also like to start up a good store like the one she had years ago.

loans.use: to buy milk for making milk curd and cheese, as well as chicken, oil and corn for making tamales

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina has been operating her boutique and hair dressing salon for the last six years, She is a 32-year-old single lady.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add to her stock of clothes for sale.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be able to export clothes outside the country.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 45-year-old man and lives in Paynesville. He is married and his wife is a business woman. They have eight children, ages 6 to 24, who all live with their parents and are attending school.

For the past four years Isaac has been selling charcoal and cold water. He is requesting a loan to purchase 500 bags of charcoal for his business. Isaac hopes to be a successful business man in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 500 bags of charcoal for his business

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en:
Ibrahem is a 56-year-old man. He is married and has three sons. He lives in Ramallah city in Palestine. He is a construction worker with a decent salary. 

Ibrahem wants to complete finishing his house by purchasing doors, windows, tiles, etc., but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay so he needs to take a loan in the amount of $1030 from FATEN. When Ibrahem takes the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay to purchase the needed things to complete finishing his house. In this way he will help to improve his family life and live in better and healthy conditions. Ibrahem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for completing the finishing on his house by purchasing doors, windows, tiles, etc,  in order to live with the family in better conditions.

loans.name: Gioconda Del Carmen

texts.es: Ella vende además de desayunos y  almuerzo, ella realiza fritanga como enchiladas, tacos, pollo frito y carne…etc. El crédito lo invertirá en aceite, arroz, carne, pollo, repollo y tortillas…etc. para su negocio
texts.en: Besides selling breakfasts and lunches, she also sells fried fast food items like enchiladas, tacos, fried chicken and meat, etc.  The loan will be used to buy oil, rice, meat, chicken, cabbage, tortillas, etc. for her business.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, meat, chicken, cabbage, tortillas, etc.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 38 years old and has five children. She is married and four of her children are in school.

Margie is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Margie has been buying and selling livestock for eight years now. She has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is married and blessed with one child. He runs a retail shop to make a living.  He has been in the business for one year.  He is also employed. He has employed one person to help him run the business. Andrew has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, salt and cooking fat for resale.

loans.use: buy sugar, salt and cooking fat

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 51 years old and is a widow. She has six children, four of whom are currently in school. She sells vegetables in a market, which she has been doing for 10 years. Jacqueline would like a loan to buy more peas, carrots, and beans to sell at the market. 

She will save the profits with the goal of expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Lucresia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lucresia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucresia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 30 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 4 children. 

Evangeline has a shop where she sells canned goods, toothpaste, soap, shampoo, etc. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP11,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, toothpaste, soap, shampoo, etc.

Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Evangeline hopes to send children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, toothpaste, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж занимается бизнесом, а сын находится на заработках в России. Сама Гавхар занимается торговлей свадебной национальной одежды. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Gavhar is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  She is 48 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is involved in business, and her son is in Russia for work.  Gavhar in involved in selling national wedding clothing.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy enamel ware, including pots and pans, for resale.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. Angelina is married and has a broom-making business in the Philippines.

Angelina requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Angelina has been in this business for 26 years now.

In the future, Angelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en:
Talosaga is thirty-three years of age, married, and has one child.

Talosaga owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.   Talosaga needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Talosaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Talosaga's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make fried food products for sale.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita, 55, is a married with four children. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She plants, harvests and sells bananas and coconut to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and she earns 7,500PHP a month. Clarita has been a member of GDMPC since last year. She is requesting a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase additional like fertilizers such as manure and seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, seedlings and young plants to grow.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 32-year-old mother from Kakamega region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married and blessed with three children. She supports her family of five people. She has a dressing stall, which has been operating for the last nine years, and generates a monthly income of KES 7,500. 

She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase cloth materials and secondhand clothes. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the current business. Her hope and dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes and cloth materials.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma.Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma.Elena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ma.Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana runs a small market out of her home where she sells chicken, beef, pork and sausages. She started the business only 6 months ago with the help of her husband who gave her $80 to start off with. She put a sign outside of her home and has been spreading the word within the community. She is now ready to take the next step in her business and begin fixing up her home so it is more attractive to clients. With the loan, she plans on making the lower sector of her house into a store where she can sell other products such as rice and cooking oil.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in her home

loans.name: Natiga

texts.en: Natiga was born in 1963 in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is married and has a child. She has sold perfumery and decorations for 3 years. In the beginning of her business, she took a loan of $500 and bought perfumery. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy perfumery and decorations.

loans.use: To buy perfumery and decorations

loans.name: Pauline Ngum

texts.en: Pauline is married with three children. Her supportive husband is a day-laborer. Their children's  school demands have increased. She also lacks capital and courage to request loans. This is her motivation to get into petty training. With her training in marketing techniques, credit management, and available support from group and center members, given a loan of $75 Pauline plans to start a road-side fast-food restaurant roasting corn, plantains and plums as snacks. She plans to repay her loan during the term.

loans.use: Restaurant

loans.name: Saoaiga

texts.en: Saoaiga M. is an active and honest member in South Pacific Business Development. She is on her sixth loan, and she is still running her shop successfully She also has a Fishing Business . These two businesses are both going well at this  time. The shop is open seven days a week. The sale she can get for the day is eight hundred to thousand a week. She also sells fish and usually gets about thousand a week. These are her two major source of income. The income she gets from fish assists her with her shop and also supports her family. She is a very successful businesswoman and she is looking for better ways of expanding  the shop  and export her fish to overseas market. She is requesting a loan of $750 to buy a freezer and enlarge her shop.

loans.use: Buy freezer and help to enlarge the shop”

loans.name: Olinda

texts.pt:
Olinda was born in the province of Inhambane. She is married and has 4 children. She started in the FDM credit prgram in 2006. She used her first loan of $125 to invest in her business. Now she is in her second loan cycle and she needs a $275 loan to buy food and vaccines for her chickens to be able to sell them to her clients. Her business is growing and with her income she is able to cover her household costs and further wants to finish construction on her home. All of her children attend school.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Olinda e natural da Provincia de Inhambane. Ela e casada e tem 4 filhos. Entrou para o programa de credito do FDM em 2006. O primeiro emprestimo que ela tomou foi de $125 para investir no seu negocio. Agora ela esta no segundo ciclo e vai tomar $275 para poder adquirir racao, vacinas para os frangos enquanto os clientes nao os compram. O negocio dela esta a crescer. Com os rendimentos para alem de comparticipar nas despesas da casa ela quer contribuir na conclusao da construcao da casa. Todos os seus filhos vao a escola.

loans.use: To buy food and vaccines for her chickens.

loans.name: Mermena

texts.en:
Mermena dedicates herself to the sale of natural juices and fried food.  She started to run this business five months ago with a loan she had obtained from FSMA.  Profits from that activity helped her repay the loan and take care of her two sons (2 years old and 1 year old).  Her husband works as a blacksmith.  Actually, the couple’s weekly income is about USD 100.00.
The entrepreneur is asking for a second loan to enlarge her business.  With the funds, she will buy large amounts of raw materials so that she can prepare and sell more goods.  She will also buy a small freezer so as to preserve the fruits and keep the juices iced .  Like so, the beverages will be more pleasant to the customers.  The entrepreneur really worries about offering good quality service to the clients.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to prepare food and natural juices and to buy a small freezer to preserve fruit.

loans.name: Marsonah

texts.en: Marsonah is 43-year-old woman who produces cakes and sells them door-to-door around the village. She could earn US$7.50 per day. Her husband, L., has no fixed income. Marsonah requests a loan to expand her business to earn extra income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
Francisco José B. is a native of the city of Bluefields. He is 48 years old and married to Socorro Urbina. They have 3 minor children who are enrolled in primary school. For more than 10 years, Mr. B. has been buying basic grains and dairy products from small local producers and supplying the owners of small package stores, who are his potential customers. With the growing demand for these products, Mr. B. needs to buy 2 short hundredweights of cheese at $96.00 for each short hundredweight, 50 pounds of cream at $0.80 a pound, 50 pairs of curd at $0.80 a pair and 28 pounds of butter at $1.00 a pound, so that he can supply other package stores.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Francisco José B. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Socorro Urbina ambos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que cursan estudios primarios. El Sr. B. tiene mas de 10 años de comprar a los pequeños productores de las comunidades granos básicos y lácteos para poder abastecer a los dueños de las pulperías que son sus clientes potenciales con la creciente demanda de estos productos el Sr. B. necesita comprar 2 quintales de queso a $96.00 dólares cada quintal, 50 libras de crema a $ 0.80 centavos dólar la libra, 50 pares de cuajada a $ 0.80 centavos dólar el par de cuajada y 28 libras de mantequillas a $ 1.00 dólar la libra para poder abastecer a otras pulperías.

loans.use: Purchase cheese, cream, butter and  curd.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mrs. Soeun S., 27, is a housewife who stays at home and looks after the children. Her husband Mr. Chut Chung, 34, is a motor-taxi driver, making on average about $5 a day. As now their house is very old,  this couple is requesting a loan of $700 to renovate their house. (Mrs. SOEUN posed for the photo with her elder sister; she on the left-hand side.)

loans.use: renovate their house as now their house is in ill-repair

loans.name: Toulaye

texts.fr:
Toulaye C. is 39 years old, is married a has been member of the Tilène Daraal village bank in Ziguinchor for the past 6 years. She would like to buy and resell "crinting", an artisanal material for building fences. In order to be able to provide for her needs, Toulaye would like to grow her trade and is asking for a loan which she intends to refund in 6 months in only one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Toulaye C., 39 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Tilène Daraal à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans . Elle veut acheter et revendre des crinting, un matériel de fabrication artisanale utilisé pour la construction de clôture. Afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins, Toulaye souhaite renforcer son commerce et sollicite un prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of "crinting" - a building material

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
Albertina is 47 years old and originally from the capital city Maputo. She is a widow as her husband passed away after more than 15 years of marriage. She has 6 children and 3 grandchildren, but only the 3 youngest children (ranging from 14 to 8 years old) and the 3 grandchildren live with her. They all attend school, apart from the youngest grandchild who is only 3 years old.

Albertina moved with her family to Namaacha, a village bordering Swaziland, when she was little. She went to school until third grade, but stopped due to her family’s difficult financial situation. She got pregnant with her first son at 17 years old and has been living with her future husband ever since, taking care of the house and the children.

Soon after Albertina’s husband passed away in 2001, Albertina started to sell clothes in Namaacha. She has a stand at the local open market that is open twice a week (Wednesdays and Saturdays). During the other days of the week, Albertina sells from her house. The most sold items are sheets; each is sold for Mozambique Metical (MZN)15 or 30, depending on the quality and design. Albertina goes to Maputo to buy merchandise once a month, paying around MZN60 in transportation costs. At the market, Albertina makes between MZN300 and 1,500 per day, really depending on the season and weather conditions.

Albertina first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who was a client. This will be Albertina’s second loan. The first loan was used to buy inventory and helped increase sales. Albertina was extremely happy with the loan, as it helped her buy basic needs for her children and also increase her monthly profits. This time Albertina intends to use the loan to buy winter clothes, as winter will soon start and she thinks she will be able to sell a lot.

In the future, Albertina would like to ask for a new loan to help her finish building a shop in front of her house, where she would be able to sell not only clothes, but also food and basic needs products. The picture shows Albertina with the sheets at her house.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen wanted to work and increase her household income, so she and her oldest daugher decided to begin making and selling jewelry. They learned the process, and are now partners in making beautiful handmade jewelry in the comfort of their own home. They then sell their wares--along with a mix of other products--in different parts of the city, such as the Concepcion market. Their goal for the future is to have an actual store from which to sell their work; they continue to work hard in pursuit of this goal.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Las ansias de trabajar y apoyar a mejorar la economía de su hogar motivaron a Carmen a incursionar en el negocio de la bisutería, junto a su hija mayor. Se capacitaron y hoy son socias en la elaboración de bellas joyas artesanales en la comodidad de su casa para luego venderlas en diversos lugares de la ciudad como la feria de Concepción surtiéndola con diversos artículos. Su meta a futuro es poder tener un local estable para realizar sus ventas es por esa razón que seguirá esforzándose para alcanzar su objetivo.

loans.use: Expand product offerings

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty M. sells provisions and groceries. She is single and her income is not sufficient for Gifty and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business selling provisions and groceries.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Sonrisa Village Bank.

Maritza is a single 29-year-old mother of one son. Maritza works at a jewelry store that sells rings, necklaces, and earrings, located in the artisan markets of the city. With her brothers, sisters, and father she makes altarpieces (artisan work in traditional drawers of wood) that she sells at the same store.

Maritza needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($725 USD) to invest in wire, flint, thread, triplay, plaster, rubber and paint to further expand her business.

Maritza´s dream is to improve her business, build a home and move forward for her son.

loans.use: Maritza needs a loan to invest in wire, flint, thread, triplay, plaster, rubber and paint to further expand her business.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.en:
Gisela is a 27-year-old married woman with a 1-year-old child. She has been a clothes seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 1am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US50 from her sales.

Gisela now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing inventory for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.ru: Насиров Абдуманон  житель района Бохтар. Возраст 33 года, женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее.Клиент занимается  занимается куплей продажей  велосипедов. Имеет опыт в этом бизнесе 11 лет. Этот вид деятельности является основным источником дохода его семьи.В данный момент клиент хочет увеличить товарооборот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdumanon N. is a resident of Bohtar region. He is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has secondary education. Abdumanon is in the business of buying and selling bicycles. He has been in this business for 11 years. This activity is the single main source of income for his family. At this point in time, Abdumanon would like obtain a loan to increase his inventory.

He plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Martha Sarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha desde hace dos años buscando la manera de apoyar con la economía de su casa, es por eso que emprendio su negocio y comenzó a comprar y vender bisutería de plata, vendía al principio por medio de catalogo hasta que logro hacerse de su propio muestrario, debido a lo bien que le ha ido ahora desea aumentar su inventario y poder obtener mayores ganancias.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha has been looking for a way to support the family's economy for the past two years. For this reason, she started her business of buying and selling silver jewelry. At first, she was doing catalogue sales until she was able to have her own sample collection. Since she has been doing quite well she wants to increase her inventory and to be able to obtain a bigger profit.

She needs a loan of $150, which will be repaid over a period of 3 months, to buy merchandise and to offer a better service to her clients. With your support she will be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat B. is 46 years old. She is a widow and the mother of 4 children. Over the years, as her family has been living off the crops they grow, the property has been divided among the children and grandchildren. Since she is divorced, it is very difficult for her to raise her children alone. But the love for her children is what made her to work hard day by day. 

Now all of her children are adults and alongside them, she works cultivating wheat and different kinds of vegetables. When their crop comes in, they transport it to Dushanbe city for sale. This activity has helped to pay the expenses of her family and to give an education to her children. 

Today she needs a loan for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing wheat. With this desire in mind, she asks your consideration to receive her family into your kind heart. She is requesting 800 USD for a term of 12 months. Adolat wants to thank everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Seeds and mineral fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Mohammad Rahim

texts.en:
M. Rahim is 20 years old he lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is responsible for his family because his father died during the war in Kabul 10 years ago. He just finished school and started working. He worked in the Ministry of Education in Kabul as a computer worker. He lives with his family in a rented house but he has some land. 

He wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghans for the term of 12 months to complete his stock and start working to build his house has soon as possible. It is one of his best wishes to do in the future.

M. Rahim wants to thank both Kiva and AFSG for this successful loan process  in this country.

loans.use: To buy material and build a house

loans.name: Naheed Aziz Ahmad Group

texts.en:
My name is Naheed, and I am a 46-year-old lady. I completed my education up to 10th standard. I have been living in this city for the past 15 years. My husband name is A. A., and he is a farmer. I am the mother of two kids: one daughter and one son. My daughter's name is Mahak Sitara. Mahak is in 8th standard.

My son has a mobile phone shop where he sells and repairs mobile phones. I work in a decorative embroidery business. I have 6 years' experience in this business. I use my earnings to pay the school fees of my daughter. I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institution in Pakistan). Now I am applying for a loan to buy more handsets to grow my son’s mobile phone business.

I am the group leader for a few more women in my locality. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy biscuits and candies wholesale to sell in various shops. Saima baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to re-sell. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy wooden beams for her shuttering business. Shamim Akhtar baji and Noreen baji each want a loan to change the body of their auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more phone handsets to re-sell

loans.name: Kulmahmat

texts.ru: Эралиев Кулмахмат житель города Турсунзаде.Возраст 57 лет,женат,имеет 5 детей.Клиент при доме имеет небольшой земельный участок,на котором  сеет пшеницу.Собрав урожай ,клиент в течении года не покупает на рынке муку и хлебо-булочную продукцию.На получененый кредит Кулмахмат хочет купить минеральные удобрения для пшеницы.Планирует погасить крдит в тчении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Kulmahmat E. resides in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 57 years old, married and has five children. At home he has a small plot of land, where he plants wheat. After he harvests his crop, he has no need to buy flour or bread products for a year. With this loan Kulmahmat wants to buy chemical fertilizer for the wheat. He plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Bắc năm nay 37 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi lợn nái và  tiền công làm thợ xây của chồng. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Bắc đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Bắc, 37 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, the main sources of income for her family are raising sows and the wages her husband earns as a construction worker. With a monthly income of 3,000,000 VND (178 USD), the lives of Mrs. Bắc and her family are steadily improving. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND (475 USD) to buy more pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising sows

loans.name: Amadeu Artur

texts.pt:
Amadeu Artur M. é natural da cidade de Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de uma filha com 5 anos de idade qual estuda na primeira classe. Alem da sua família sustenta a mãe enviando dinheiro periodicamente.

Amadeu estudou até 12ªclasse e parou quando a família foi abalada por problemas sociais tendo um irmão gravemente doente e ele era obrigado a tomar conta dele assim perdeu o ano dê arrumou um emprego. Aos 14 anos mudou se da cidade de Maputo para distrito de Boane junto com os pais.

Amadeu trabalha no distrito de Marracuene que dista a 60km do distrito em que tem a sua família como auxiliar administrativo a 9 meses, antes trabalhou numa ONG Helvetas. Tem um salário mensal de 2524,00mt trabalhando das 7:30 as 15:00h. Vive numa casa própria.

Para Amadeu este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende Continuar com a construção da sua casa concretamente na reabilitação. Futuramente vai solicitar mais empréstimo para a sua ampliação diz ser pequena para as suas intenções.
texts.en:
Amadeu Artur M. is a native of the city of Maputo. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of a 5 year old daughter who is in the first grade. Besides his family he also supports his mother by sending her money periodically. Amadeu went to school through the 12th grade and stopped when his family was shaken by social problems. He had a brother who was gravely ill, and he was obliged to take care of him. He lost a year trying to find a job. When he was 14 years old he moved from Maputo to the district of Boane with his parents. Amadeu works in the district of Marracuene that is 60 km from the district in which his family lives. He has been an administrative assistant for 9 months, and before that he worked for the NGO, Helvetas. He has a monthly salary of 2,524MT working from 7:30am until 3:00pm. He lives in his own home. This is Amadeu's first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva, with which he intends to continue the construction on his home that is well into rehabilitation. In the future he is going to solicit another loan and he says it will be small for his intentions.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Askarali

texts.en:
S. Askarali is a dynamic and ambitious young man, very professional and focused on his business. He has a business selling cement and feed for cattle in the neighborhood of “Dehkon” market. He has been in this business for 4 years and has gained a rich experience. He has a special warehouse where he keeps his goods in safety. He knows how to store cement so that it doesn’t deteriorate.

All this allows Askarali to make his business quite successful and it brings in stable income for his family. With the profit from his business he has been continuously supporting his 4 children with education and food. Today, knowing that the price of the cement is presently low but will increase soon for sure, he wants to purchase more goods to store up. For this reason he is asking for a loan of 3000 USD for the term of 12 months. Askarali expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cement and feed for cattle for re-sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Grace S. K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has five children who are between the ages of 23 and 33. She is also responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan. Grace has been selling medicines made by a company known as GNLD since 2006. This company allows people to become agents to sell their products and Grace is one of them. She works at her business for nine hours a day, six days a week and is helped by her husband. Grace currently earns about $130 a month from her business. She has applied for a loan to buy medicines in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Grace thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, because they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional medicines in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann A. is 28 years old, married to Ronnie A. and blessed with one child. Presently she resides at Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. Pig-raising is her project, for which she has borrowed PHP 10,000 to buy pigs, feed, and vitamins. Mary Ann wants to have a pen for her pigs. She also wants to own a concrete house and to have her child be able finish school in the near future.

loans.use: To buy pigs, feeds and vitamins for her pig-raising

loans.name: Gulhumor

texts.ru: Кузиева Гулхумор проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 44 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Гулхумор имеет свою пирожочную, которая находится на рынке. Ее муж тоже работает на рынке, а старший сын подрабатывает в России. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 15 лет. Клиентка хочет получить у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот. Т.к. у нее очень много клиентов.
texts.en:
Gulhumor K. lives in Gissar. She is 44 years old and is married with 3 children. Gulhumor has a pastry shop at the market. Her husband also works at the market, and their elder son works in Russia. Gulhumor has been selling pastry for over 15 years. She has many clients and she is applying for a loan in order to increase cash flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Estrellas Del Rey Group

texts.es: Los integrantes del grupo  “Estrellas del Rey”  están representados por la señora Maruja y compuesta por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a la venta de productos como zapatos, artesanías, gorras, celulares, ropa, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio y al servicio de electricista domiciliario. A pesar de sus escasos recursos y la competencia en el mercado de venta de productos siempre salen adelante impulsados por sus ganas de trabajar y su experiencia. El destino del crédito es principalmente para el incremento de capital de trabajo y la adquisición de mercadería, materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia de los socios ya obtuvieron financiamientos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital conociendo la modalidad de trabajo grupal y demostrando responsabilidad y buen manejo de los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Estrellas del Rey" (Stars of the King) are represented by Mrs. Maruja. The group has 12 members, who mostly sell products such as shoes, handicrafts, hats, cellphones, clothes, and groceries in neighborhood stores, and who work as electricians for households. Despite their scarce resources and competition in the market, they always finish ahead, thanks to their desire to work and their experience. The loan will be used mostly to increase working capital and to acquire merchandise, materials, equipment and tools and will help generate more capital and consequently a better quality of life for their families. With regard to their experience with loans, they have already obtained financing from institutions similar to Agrocapital, showing how they work together as a group and demonstrating responsibility and good management of the funds granted to them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mendbayar B. is a 31-year-old married man and father of two. Two years ago his family moved from the country to the center of Uvurhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Before then he was a herder and had a few sheep and goats. Since that wasn't enough to feed his family, Mendbayar decided to live in an urban area to improve his life.

After moving to the center of the province, he started running a carpentry business, making a variety of furniture such as beds, chairs, table, "avdar" "Avdar" is a box for keeping small items such as traditional silver cup and horse reins, horse shoes made of silver, expensive stones, etc. Most Mongolian country households have silver cups and silver horse reins, horseshoes, etc.

Mendbayar's spouse Enhtsetseg helps her husband's business every day by painting and polishing furniture. As they are getting experienced and the furniture they make is beautiful and high-quality, their number of customers is increasing. Mendbayar is a very humble person. He requests a loan to purchase raw material such as planks, glue, paint, and wool for his business.

loans.use: To purchase planks, glue, paint and wood

loans.name: Jacinta Isabel

texts.es:
La señora  Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Chimu, el distrito D. Puno, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 51 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, y es madre D. 6 hijos.  Tiene estudios D. primaria completa, vive en La Comunidad D. Chimu Barrio Progreso Sector Calcota.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 7 años,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la elaboración D. quesanas (tipo D. esteras).

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. material totora y chillihua (árboles), para la fabricación D. quesanas (tipo D. esteras), para vender en las minas, allí las compran para protegerse D. las bajas temperaturas.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y las forma D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel is a member of the "Las Totoritas" Village Bank, located in Chimu Community of Puno Department/Province. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. She completed primary school, and currently lives in the Calcota sector of the Progreso neighborhood. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 7 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, and she used it to make "quesanas," a type of rush mat. She currently needs a loan of 2,700 soles to buy totora reeds and chillihua wood to make her quesanas, which she will then sell in mines to the workers, who use the mats to protect themselves from the cold temperatures. She hopes to continue working in the future. She appreciates the savings accounts and working methods of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chillihua wood and totora reeds to make rush mats

loans.name: Meminetou

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, son mari est un fonctionnaire. Pour aider son époux dans les dépenses du foyer elle a entamé le commerce de céréales. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays. Elle réalise de bonnes recettes tous les jours. Voulant agrandir son stock, elle sollicite un crédit  pour acheter 10 sacs d’haricots, 10 sacs de maïs, 4 sacs de sorgho et 1 sac de mil. Avec ce nouveau stock elle pourra vendre plus.
texts.en:
This is a married lady and the mother of two. Her husband is a civil servant. To help him with household expenses, she began a business in grains. She gets her stock from the country's interior. Every day, she brings in a good income. Wanting to enlarge her inventory, she is requesting a loan to buy ten sacks of beans, ten sacks of corn, four of sorghum, and one of millet. With this new inventory, she will be able to sell more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains

loans.name: Ericka De Los Angeles
