texts.es: La señora Erica de los Ángeles de 39 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos un par de gemelos de  12 y 3 años de edad, los gemelos están estudiando, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino, su esposo trabaja como conductor en las rutas que día a día transportan a miles de Nicaragüense que abordan a sus trabajo. Doña Erica con mucho esfuerzo para ayudar en su hogar tuvo la iniciativa de comenzar a vender ropa para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, lo cual inicio con ahorros y luego con préstamos en Afodenic, lleva diez años en las altas ventas de ropa y cosmético, con este préstamo lograra invertir en la compra de ropa variada, cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes y captar nuevos cliente, vende al contado y al crédito. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios que hasta ahora ha logrado. A futuro espera seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Erica de los Ángeles is 39 years old, and is married with three children. She has a pair of 12-year-old twins, and a 3 year old; the twins are studying. She resides in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. Her husband works as a conductor on the routes that transport thousands of Nicaraguans daily to their jobs. With much effort and in hopes of helping in her household, Erica took the initiative to begin selling clothing to help husband with expenses. She began this business with savings and later with loans from Afodenic. She has sold large quantities of clothing and cosmetics for ten years, and with this loan she will be able to invest in the purchase of assorted clothing and cosmetics to offer her clients, and this will also help her acquire new clients. She sells for cash payments or on credit. She thanks the Afodenic institution for the good that she has accomplished to date. In the future she hopes to continue making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais

loans.name: Mr. Oeurn San Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of seventeen people is located in Ta Sman village in Takeo province. Mr. Oeurn S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns 1-hectar field to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this farming, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough moN. to buy fertilizers to support the field so he decided to buy fertilizers to make his crop more productive and he also use the rest of the loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Teav Chantha, helps him on the farming. Mr. Oeurn S. is 25 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of a year. 

All the members in this village bank loans are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is married with 5 children, and she is 40 years old. She sells blocks and cement. She has been in this line of business for over 15 years now. She is from Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cement. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cement and other materials for her business

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun V., 28, is married and lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She grows and sells rice, typically making about US $5 each day. Her husband is a construction worker who specializes in building houses. On average, he makes US $3.30 per day.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have made this a tough economic year for many Cambodians, Sun V. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase rice with the intention of reselling it and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a way to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: purchasing rice to sell

loans.name: Sègbégnon Nathalie

texts.fr: Z. Sègbégnon Nathalie est née en 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Sègbégnon Nathalie est mariée à PADONOU Antonin et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Sègbégnon Nathalie vit avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou, depuis 15 ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Sègbégnon Nathalie n'a pas été à l'école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Sègbégnon Nathalie vend des feuilles d'emballage d'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs), des nattes en raphia et également de la boisson alcoolisée locale à Kpondéhou. Sègbégnon Nathalie s'approvisionne à Djèrègbé, non loin de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C'est depuis douze ans que Sègbégnon Nathalie exerce cette activité. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien et sans difficulté ses crédits. Sègbégnon Nathalie sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour agrandir davantage son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Z. Sègbégnon Nathalie was born in 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to PADONOU Antonin and is the mother of four children who are all in school.  She has been living with her husband and children in the Kpondéhou district in Cotonou for fifteen years.  The couple provides for the family jointly.  Sègbégnon Nathalie has not been to school.  To support herself and her family, she sells leaves for wrapping akassa (a local food made with cornstarch), raffia mats, and also the local alcoholic drink in Kpondéhou.  She stocks up in Djèrègbé, not far from Porto-Novo (the administrative capital of Benin).  She has been in this business for a dozen years.  She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans without a problem.  She's requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé to expand her business further and to satisfy her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leaves for wrapping "akassa" and some raffia mats

loans.name: Vilma Cardona Group

texts.en:
Vilma C., from the village of Buena Suerte, Cauayan City, Isabela, is the 41-year-old leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Vilma, who is married and has 2 school-aged children, owns and operates a general store whose income derives primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Vilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan, her third, of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Claire

texts.fr: D. Claire est née le 12 Août 1959 et vit à Trokpocodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une dizaine d’année. Mariée à ADJA Maurice, Claire est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Claire a un autre enfant à charge. La famille vit ensemble à Trokpocodji à Cotonou. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Claire n’a fait que le cours primaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins quotidiens, Claire vend de la nourriture (riz, haricot, accompagné de sauce, etc.) en face du Ministère des Finances à Cotonou. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Claire s’approvisionne. Claire est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Claire voudrait agrandir davantage son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Claire sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Claire was born on August 12, 1959, and she has been living in Trokpocodji in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about ten years.  Married to ADJA Maurice, she is the mother of four children who are all in school.  And she has another child to support.  The family lives together in Trokpocodji in Cotonou.  The couple is covering family expenses jointly.  Claire attended primary school only.  To address her day-to-day needs, she sells food (rice, beans, served with sauce, etc.) across from the Finance Ministry in Cotonou.  She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans.  She would like to expand her business further and to satisfy her customers more.  For these reasons, Claire is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice and beans and sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, etc.)

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa A. A. tiene 31 años y vive en la zona de A. Rancho en la zona Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Josefa está casada con el señor Wilson Escalera por más de 10 años, ambos tienen dos hijos pequeños que acuden a la escuela de la zona. Josefa se dedica a la producción de leche cruda y su posterior venta a una empresa que elabora toda clase de productos lácteos. En su casa tienen 10 vacas lecheras que fueron la herencia que le dio su mama para que ella se haga cargo, ya que su familia es conocida en la zona por los muchos años que trabajan con vacas lecheras. Mientras que su esposo viaja de ciudad en ciudad colocando postes de luz para una compañia de energia electrica.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de otra vaca lechera, para de este modo poder incrementar su producción lechera y sus ingresos. Josefa nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder incrementar de tal manera su ganado lechero que pueda dejarle una herencia a ambos de sus hijos con lo cual ellos puedan tener una calidad de vida buena.
texts.en:
Josefa A. A., 31, lives in the A. Rancho area in the area south of the city of Cochabamba. Josefa has been married to Wilson Escalera for over ten years. They have two small children who go to school in the area. Josefa’s business is the production of crude milk. She then sells it to a company that makes all kinds of dairy products. She has ten head of dairy cows at home. Her mother gave them to her. Her family is well known in the area for the many years they have worked with dairy cows. Her husband travels from city to city placing light poles for an electrical company. The loan is to buy another dairy cow in order to be able to increase milk production and her income. Josefa tells us that her greatest dream is to be able to increase her livestock to be able to give both of her children an inheritance in order to have a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is 44 years old and is married with seven children with ages 1, 8, 10, 13, 16, 18 and 22 years. Gaspard and his family live in Burera, in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

It is in this area where Gaspard owns a butcher shop. This is his twentieth successful year in the business of selling beef. He employs three people and the hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. every day.

Gaspard is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business as well as for buying a cow to sell. With the use of this loan, Gaspard will be able to satisfy the demands of his customers whose number keeps growing day by day.

Through selling meat to a large number of customers, Gaspard will continue to pay school fees for his children as well as saving for them so that he will be able to pay for their university studies as well as building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To expand his business and to buy a cow to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell smoked fish

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mr. Sarom R. is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Tun Chanthorn, is a mango seller (she is on the right in the photo). He is the father of a child who is attending the local school. They are villagers in Preak Traeng village in Kandal province. 

Although they work hard, they do not earn enough income to support the family. Thus, Mr. Sarom R. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Gerlita

texts.en:
Gerlita M. has fully repaid her previous Kiva loan. She is happy to have purchased an additional motorcycle for her transportation business. She is pleased to help her husband, a surveyor for a telecommunications company, earn money to give their five children, aged 10 to 27, a better future. Gerlita is hoping that she will stay healthy and free from sickness so that she can continue to reach for her dreams.
Gerlita is again requesting a loan from ASHI through Kiva because she wants to start a hog-fattening business. By fattening hogs/pigs in four months, she will have a profit by selling them either slaughtered or alive to people in her village or to meat vendors in the market.
Being a very good member of ASHI, Gerlita is qualified to request a much larger amount of loan to be able to achieve her dreams and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for a fattening business

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea T. is 34 years old and lives in Pou Roung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Tharn Kang, are farmers who own a 1.3-hectare field on which they grow rice. To make it possible to produce a good crop, Sophea has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline and to hire a helper. Mr. Tharn Kang supplements his farming income by also working as a fisherman. The couple has three children, all of whom are students in a local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline and to hire a helper.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 37 años, casada y madre de tres hijos que aún son menores, y juntos viven en una pequeña casa, ubicada en la zona selva de Ayacucho. Perseverante y trabajadora, desde niña le prohibieron sus padres que trabajase para dedicarse por completo a los estudios. Con el pasar del tiempo se convirtió en madre y se dio cuenta que le faltaba algo por lo que determinó instalar un negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, por lo que ya lleva trabajando casi 4 años en esta actividad, proporcionándole buenas rentas, no contenta con ello, también cultiva cacao, pero en pequeñas parcelas. Generalmente trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo, quien la ayuda a vender su cosecha en su propia comunidad. En el futuro espera comprar terrenos para que cultive diferentes productos y en grandes volúmenes. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por consiguiente se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, durante las fechas establecidas, además no tiene dificultades con su grupo  comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos que tiene mayor demanda y necesidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz, 37, is married and has three minor children; they live together in a small house in the Ayacucho jungle. Persevering and hard-working, as a young girl her parents would not allow her to work but insisted she concentrate on her studies. As time went by and she became a mother herself, she realized that she was missing something. She decided to open a grocery store that she’s now had for almost 4 years; it has produced good profits. Not content with just this, she also farms cocoa beans on small lots. She usually works alone but sometimes her husband helps her sell her harvested crops in her community. She would like to buy land in the future in order to grow large quantities of a variety of crops. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion; she also has no problem with her communal allotments. She will use the requested funds to buy the stock items that are in most demand in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sim Y. is 37 years old and lives in the village of Chamka Doung in the Kandal province. Mrs. Sim Y. was selected by five members to be the leader of the group loan. Each of the members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Sim Y. and her husband, Mr. Sean Soeun, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow crops for a living. Aside from farming, Mr. Sean Soeun is a fisherman who earns a small income to support his family. In order to support her husband's fishing business, Mrs. Sim Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing supplies. This couple has a child who is a student in a local school.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and rental of tractors for labo

loans.name: Lilia Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Lilia tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda. Vive en casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y son solteros. Es jubilada desde hace 26 años. Requiere el crédito para terminar la construcción de su vivienda. Es una  persona muy trabajadora, que le ha  brindado una buena  educación a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y pretende tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa. La Sra. Lilia agradece la ayuda que le podamos brindar a traves de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Lilia is a 62-year-old widow. She lives in her own home with her 3 grown children, who are all single. She has been retired for 26 years. She is requesting this loan to complete the construction of her home. She is a very hard-working woman, who strove very hard to offer her children a good education. She hopes to gain a better quality of life. Her dream is to finish the construction of her home. Lilia is grateful for the help offered through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Malumbo Group

texts.en:
Kurwa S., 44, is married with 3 children ages 20, 18 and 12, all of whom go to school. Kurwa also supports his brother in law who is 14 years old and goes to school.  He has had a Genge Duka (kiwahili fruits, vegetables, rice, sugar, wheat flour, etc) and a men's salon business since 1999.   He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and he is able to make a monthly profit of about $645.

This will be  Kulwa’s first Motisha loan (a loan given to clients who pay their dues on time and in full) from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He wants to get a loan to increase stock in the Genge Duka. He hopes that when he makes a good profit and has enough savings, he will be able to pay school fees; he also dreams of building his own house.

Kulwa will share this loan with his loan group Malumbo, which totals 6 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Kulwa is the only man.

loans.use: increasing store inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her corn crop

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama B. sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), corn dough, soap, canned tomatoes and other foodstuffs at Elmina. She has no educational background. She is a widow taking care of two children and ensures the welfare of her children with the income she makes from her sales.

Ama’s loan, which is going to serve as additional capital, will be used to buy more of her foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her business.

loans.use: To serve as additional capital to buy more of her foodstuffs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna A. is from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 53 years old. Lorna is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lorna buys and sells fruits and vegetables in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items in order to expand her product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items in order to expand product offering

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina T., from the town of Talibon, is 46 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rufina owns and operates a business gathering seaweed and selling it at the market. She hopes to achieve a stable income in order to sustain her children's education.

Rufina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase equipment for gathering seaweed, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for gathering seaweed

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald T. is from the village of Sampaguita, Solana, Cagayan. He is 32 years old and married. To make a living, Ronald owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 17 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per harvest.

Ronald joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Ronald’s 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his immediate family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros T. is from the village of Malasin Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 58 years old. Milagros is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Milagros owns & operates a business selling a variety of different products in the local community. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Milagros joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Milagros from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A., from the village of Disud, is 48 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Jocelyn is just starting this business.

In 2007, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, Jocelyn is requesting her eighth loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jehová Jireh Group

texts.es: Decisión, iniciativa y buenas propuestas de negocio es lo que identifica a este grupo de socias llamado Jehová Jireh el cual está conformado por 9 integrantes hace ya 4 años, todas ellas se conocen bien entre ellas ya que son vecinas. Cabe mencionar la iniciativa que presentan cada día para lograr éxitos en sus negocios. Una de las integrantes es Elsa Q. de 49 años de edad casada y con 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 aun siguen en el colegio. Ella se levanta todas las mañanas muy temprano para realizar la venta de tortas y pasteles el cual es su negocio diario, los ingresos económicos de estas ventas le han generado gratas satisfacciones como la compra de muebles para su hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, en el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda de veta de ropa de temporada. Con el presente préstamo comprara complementos para los adornos de las tortas. No puedo concluir sin antes mencionar el desempeño y el entusiasmo de cada integrante de Jehová Hireh para llegar a un objetivo en común el cual es la estabilidad económica para sus familias y el progreso de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Decision, initiative and good business proposals are the words that identify this group of nine borrowers who have been together for four years now and called themselves Jehová Jireh. They all know each other well because they are neighbors. It is worth mentioning that they display initiative daily to be successful in their businesses.

Elsa Q. is one of the group members. She is 49 years old, married, and has three children, two of which are still in school. Every morning she gets up early to sell cakes and pastries, which is her daily business. Her income from these sales have provided her with fulfillment, as she has purchased furniture for her home and used it to pay for her children’s schooling. In the future, she would like to have a seasonal clothing store. With the current loan, she will purchase accessories for the cake decorations.

Before ending the description, it is necessary to mention the work and enthusiasm of each member of Jehová Jireh, as these are applied for the common goals of financial stability for their families and the progress of their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for cake decorations.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya D. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Bugnay, Brgy. Daan Banua, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: a general store, a coffee shop, and a chicken inasal business. 

Her husband Alejandro D., who is 56 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living. They have no children. 

Ligaya joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ligaya has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 14,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future of her family's needs. 

Ligaya D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). 

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Working capital for businesses

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his brother. He has been working as a home painter from the past 6 years and in 2007, he started working independently on a freelance basis. He takes on small projects to earn income and he cooperates with his brother to pay the expenses of the home, electricity, food, etc.  Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional tools and external scaffolding for his newest project. In the future, he is planning to take on bigger projects and work with construction entrepreneurs to expand his business level.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and external scaffolding for his newest project

loans.name: Norlan Jose

texts.es: Norlan José tiene 36 años, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos. Su actividad es la carpintería. Inicio hace 7 años, pues siempre está buscando la forma mejorar su negocio y la calidad de vida anteriormente Norlan se dedicaba a brindar el servicio de triciclo y ha sido con el paso del tiempo que ha mejorado su negocio. Es una persona que disfruta de su actividad ya que tiene ciertos pedidos para esta semana. El crédito será invertido en la compra de madera, herramientas, maque entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en: Norlan José is 36 years old.  This is not the first time that he has requested a loan.  He works as a carpenter and started his business 7 years ago.  He is always looking for ways to improve his business and his quality of life.  He used to provide a 'triciclo' (three-wheeled cycle) service and over time he has improved his business.  He is a person who enjoys his work and he has a number of orders.  His loan will be invested in buying wood, tools and varnish, along with other things he needs.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Avenir Plus Group

texts.en: Benz is a leader of a Community bank named “Avenir Plus”, which means “Future” in English and is composed of 11 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. Benz, 40 years old, is the father of two children aged 4 and 7. Both attend school. He has been a micro entrepreneur since 1996. He runs a telephone booth. His business is located in eastern Kinshasa. He is working hard because his ambition is to open other telephone booths. Benz is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC who has already received seven different loans and has repaid them properly. The loan he’ll obtain next will be used to buy more prepaid cards with the aim of increasing profits. Wanting to develop and diversify his business, he decided to join one of Hope’s groups in 2009. Currently, he makes a profit of about $90 per week. Benz has succeeded with good strategies to build up permanent customers. He always talks with his customers whom he knows by name, and never runs out of stock.

loans.use: purchasing more prepaid cards to resell with the aim of generating profit

loans.name: Carmen Odila

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Tamarindos de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas.
 
La señora Carmen esta en el Banco comunal hace 15 años  y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las amigas que ha hecho en todo este tiempo. Tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer de un camión.

Se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa interior de damas de la marca Leonisa, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Flavio Alfaro a realizar sus ventas, deja a crédito y cobra  semanalmente dice que le encanta vender. Y que no se siente bien sino realiza alguna actividad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería como ropa intima, bisutería, cremas y perfumes.  Sus sueños son tener un bazar en su casa ya que el tiempo va pasando y se siente cada dia mas cansada.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of 'Las Orquideas' (The Orchids) community bank meet in the Los Tamarindos neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi.  This city has been known for many years as 'The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Carmen has been a member of this community bank for 15 years.  She likes the bank for the additional benefits that its members receive from the institution and because of the friends that she has made during her time as a member.  Carmen is 57 years old, married and has 5 children who are all now grown up and living independently.  Her husband is a truck driver.

Carmen sells products from catalogs.  She sells Avon, Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She also sells Leonisa-brand ladies' underwear.  She works every day from 8.30am to 5.00pm.  She makes her sales door to door and she travels to the town of Flavio Alfaro to make her sales.  She leaves her goods on credit and collects payment for them every week.  She says that she loves to sell and that she doesn't feel happy unless she is carrying out a business activity. 

Carmen will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as underwear, costume jewelry, creams and perfumes.  Her dream is to own her own store in her home as time is passing and she feels more tired every day.

loans.use: To buy underwear, costume jewelry, cream and perfume

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es:
María Victoria R. D. A. es una mujer emprendedora, pues gracias a su buena sazón y a su empeño por salir adelante, desD. hace 3 años le dio vida a su negocio D. comidas rápidas “La Sazón D. Vicky”, microempresa que le ha dado la oportunidad D. trabajar como independiente y aportar a los gastos D. su hogar. 

Aunque en las temporadas D. invierno las ventas disminuyen, Vicky como es conocida en el sector no deja D. abrir ningún día, pues considera que así sea poco algo se hace. Para continuar con su negocio, espera mejorar en muchos aspectos, con el fin D. llegar a innovar ofreciendo platos diferentes, por ahora, esta emprendedora necesita D. un préstamos para comprar un fogón, una olla, recipientes y algunos insumos que le permitirán incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María Victoria R. D. A. is an enterprising woman. She is a great cook with that special touch and thanks to her drive to succeed, she opened her fast-food business "La Sazón D. Vicky" (Vicky's Flavor) 3 years ago. Her microbusiness gave her the opportunity to work as an independent and contribute to household expenses.

Although her sales volume declines in winter, it does not prevent Vicky (as María Victoria is known in her sector) from opening every day, because she believes that every small step is progress. To go on with her business, she hopes to improve it in many ways. She will innovate and offer various dishes. Currently, the entrepreneur needs a loan to buy a stove, a cooker, pots and ingredients. All this will enable her to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a stove, a cooker, pots and ingredients

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma nació en la ciudad D. Puno y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 60 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Norma tiene un pequeño negocio D. crianza D. cuyes, ella nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño galpón donD. cria a los animales, ella a los animales los alimenta los hace crecer y después los venD..
 
Norma forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” D. la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra animales y alimentos para los cuyes. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol).

Norma se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norma was born in the city of Puno, but she currently lives in the city of Cusco.  She is 60 years old, married, and has three children.

Norma has a small business raising guinea pigs.  She tells us that she has a small shed where she raises the animals.  She feeds the animals so that they grow.  Later, she sells them.

Norma is part of the “Inti” Communal Bank with the Arariwa Asociasción.  She needs the loan to invest in buying animals and feed for the guinea pigs.  (Inti is the Quechua word for Sun).

Norma is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she pledges to make her payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy animals and food for the guinea pigs

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
G. Fatima lives in Jaranwala, a small city in the Punjab region of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for more than 20 years. G. Fatima is a housewife; she stays at home and does her household work. In her spare time, she also supports her husband by taking care of his buffaloes. G. Fatima has 3 daughters and 5 sons. Her 2 eldest sons work in a factory for a small salary. Three of the remaining children are in school while the others stay at home.

G. Fatima has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband, who operates a dairy business in the community. He will use the loan to buy another buffalo to produce more milk and to sell to many more customers. He started this business 5 years ago and is now getting good at it. G. Fatima is hopeful that by purchasing another buffalo, her husband’s business will expand and he will be able to increase his clients and profit. G. Fatima is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, G. Fatima is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy another buffalo

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad P. is from the village of Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 55 years old, widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Solidad owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Solidad has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Solidad joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Solidad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pasuc Group

texts.es: Doña Pascuala confesora, es la representante D. este grupo, es casada, tiene 51 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad  D. estudiar, tiene 8 hijos 1 D. los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la crianza D. animales, cuenta con 15 años D. experiencia, empezó con entusiasmo y esmero para tener una pequeña granja D. pollos, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la confección D. prendas, solicita un prestamos para comprar mas gallinas para la granja que tiene, deciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un prestamo e incrementar su capital D. trabajo, los integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza D. animales y tambien la confección D. prendas.
texts.en: Pascuala Confesora is the representative of this group.  She is 51 years old, married, and didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  She has 8 children, 1 of whom is studying.  Pascuala's business is raising animals and she has 15 years experience in this business.  She started out with enthusiasm and great care, and set up her own small chicken farm.  She has the support of her husband who makes clothes.  Pascuala is requesting this loan to buy more hens for her farm.  She decided to form a group to request a loan and increase her working capital.  The other members of the group raise animals and make clothes.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora de 31 años, natural del distrito de Quimbiri, convive  con  David de 40 años de edad, tienen 02 hijos Leydi de 10 años y Jhosep de 02 años juntos  viven en su casa propia situado en el distrito de Quimbiri. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar y ha ganarse el dinero a cambio de esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza es comprar los productos a los campesinos tales como: café, achiote, cacao y palillo; son productos netamente de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Tiene 14 años trabajando, asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien se encarga de cargar y pesar los kilogramos de cada producto, y que posteriormente son llevados a vender a las empresas acopiadoras de gran renombre como: Cooperativa Agraria, Cacao Vrae y Machupichu; quienes le pagan un gran porcentaje por cada kilogramo de carga entregada. Su negocio le es muy, además le premian con una buena cantidad de dinero anualmente. Los meses de enero, febrero y marzo, son épocas de lluvias y derrumbes en las carreteras, por lo que perjudica mucho sus viajes para poder trasladar los productos. Los planes que tiene es seguir trabajando con el mismo ahínco que le caracteriza para así  sacar adelante a los miembros de su familia. Con el crédito solicitado, le servirá como capital para comprar  productos a los campesinos. Este es su 11avo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos, Nora es socia de los bancos comunales, por ser una socia puntual en sus pagos accedió a crédito individuales. Con el crédito solicitado, le servirá como capital para comprar  productos a los campesinos.
texts.en:
31 year-old Nora is from Quimbiri district.  She lives with her partner, 40 year-old David, and they have two children: 10 year-old Leydi and 2 year-old Jhosep.  They live together in their own home which is located in Quimbiri district.

Nora's parents taught her the value of work and the need to work hard to earn money since she was a little girl.  Nora's business activity is buying products from farmers, such as coffee, annatto, cacao and turmeric.  These are all products which are native to the rainforest area of the Apurimac River Valley.

Nora has been working for 14 years and she has the support of her partner who is in charge of loading and weighing the produce.  Nora then takes the produce and sells it to well-known wholesalers such as Cooperativa Agraria, Cacao Vrae and Machupichu who pay her a percentage for every kilogram of produce she delivers.  Nora's business makes her a good quantity of money each year.  However, January, February and March are rainy months and roads wash away.  This affects the journeys that she makes to transport her products.

Nora's plans are to continue working with the same determination in order to get the members of her family ahead in life.  She will use the loan she has requested as capital so that she can buy products from farmers.  This is Nora's 11th loan from MFP and she has been very punctual in repaying her previous loans.  Nora is a member of a community bank.  However, because she is a member who repays her loans punctually, she is also able to access an individual loan.

loans.use: to buy coffee, annatto and cacao from farmers

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo tiene 48 años de edad. Vive con su pareja y un hijo en el distrito de Olmos, en un caserío cerca de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y caprino. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años. Conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende a los negociantes que suelen visitar las zonas. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Eduardo solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá aumentar sus ingresos  mejor cubrir sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Eduardo, age 48, lives with his wife and son in the in the district of Olmos in a small village near Olmos, a rather busy agricultural zone in Lambayeque Province. He is situated more than one hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Eduardo raises and sells sheep and goats. He has been in this business many years. He is very knowledgeable in this field. When his animals have reached a good size and weight, he sells them to merchants who visit the area. He has a well established clientele.

Eduardo is applying for a loan of 100 new soles in order to purchase more animals and balanced feed. With this investment he will be able to increase his income and better cover his family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock and balanced feed.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION-ANTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales y también se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones,blusas,polos y chompas en la feria del distrito de anta llamada feria de Ancahuasi y también cría animales como ganados y ovejas, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y comprar ropa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana, 44, is a member of the “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION-ANTA” communal bank located in Anta District which belongs to Anta Province, Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and four children.  She alternates her daily chores with the business of raising animals and she also sells clothes.  She sells pants, blouses, polo shirts and sweaters at the Anta district’s market called Feria de Ancahuasi.  She also raises animals like cattle and sheep.  Through these small businesses she raises her children.  She wants to expand the animal raising business and the clothing sales business and is asking for a loan to buy animals and to buy clothes.  She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy animals and to buy clothes.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Miscelánea “La Gloria de Dios es el negocio que emprendió Rogelio y su esposa al salir de su pueblo natal y llegar a la gran ciudad con expectativas de alcanzar el éxito trabajando. Ellos iniciaron con un pequeño capital y vendiendo pocas mercancias, lo que gradualmente ha dado resultados y se ha reflejado en el bienestar de su familia que la integran su esposa y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 26 a 35 años y especialmente en el mejoramiento de las condiciones habitacionales.
Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Rogelio hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprará mercancías variadas como gafas, camisetas, ganchos, esquelas, papelería chancletas y accesorios femeninos. Su meta más adelante es  reactivar la confección pues tiene una infraestructura que desea reactivar y ofrecer en su punto de ventas y a través de vendedoras. Su máximo desafió es su capital de trabajo, pues en comparación con el mercado que maneja, es muy pequeño para responder a su demanda  de manera oportuna. Mientras logra aumentarlo, dirige todos sus esfuerzos a mantener  su sostenibilidad en el negocio que en la actualidad le representa una utilidad no menor de un 50%.
texts.en:
The store named "La Gloria de Dios" is the business that Rogelio and his wife started after they left their birthplace and when they came to the big city. They had great expectations to be successful in their work. They started out with a small capital fund and they had few merchandise but they gradually saw results and this has been mirrored in the wellbeing of the family. His family is made up of his wife and their 4 children, aged from 26 to 35. They have especially seen improvements in the condition of their home.

This Kiva loan is the first loan that Rogelio has had through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it he will purchase a variety of merchandise, such as eye glasses, t-shirts, hooks, school supplies, sandals, and ladies' accessories. His goal for the future is to restart production, especially because he has the infrastructure ready to use, and to sell in retail and through other merchants. His greatest challenge is his working capital. IN comparison with the competition the business is very small to be able to respond to client demands in an opportune manner. While he works on expanding, he directs all of his efforts to maintain his business profitable. Currently that represents a profit margin of no less than 50%.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise, such as eye glasses, t-shirts, hooks, school supplies, sandals, and ladies' accessories.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school, and she also takes care of additional family members (father). Hasifa has operated a restaurant for 3 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products at the market. Hasifa has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas, beef, rice and sweet potatoes.

Hasifa also generates additional income selling soft drinks. Her main business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of food and thieves. Her goals and hopes for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to build her own rental house. Hasifa lives in a home that she rents; she has no access to electricity nor to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as bananas, beef, rice and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Aisada's Group

texts.en:
Aisada is the leader of this group. She is 25 and married to a tractor driver. The family lives in Karabalta, a small town near Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). A year ago the family got livestock as an inheritance from their parents.  At the moment in order to meet their daily needs, Aisada sells milk.  In this way she earns 1000 soms per month. 

Aisada wants to start breeding, fattening and reselling livestock. She hopes to get this loan in order to increase the number of livestock. In the future she wishes to further improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anna Maria

texts.en:
Anna Maria is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Anna Maria has a retail shop that sells furniture. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed to make furniture.

Anna Maria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy materials to make furniture

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: La Sra. Aurora  es Divorciada, tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Prosperidad y Amistad” grupo  conformado por 7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Aurora  trabaja desD. hace   5 años en la venta D. comida D. Ceviche, Gaseosa, Golosinas  y  Mazamorra en un puesto en el mercado, este negocio surge a raíz D. su divorcio, ya que  Aurora tenía que mantener a sus 4 hijos , Aurora nos cuenta que nada fue fácil tuvo que trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante su negocio y sacar adelante a sus hijos.Su sueño es tener una bogega deabarrotes y ser mayorista , gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos van al colegio,se ha comprado artefactos electricos, y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una  mejor calidad D. vida, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos (golosinas). Sabemos que Aurora  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Señora Aurora is divorced and has four school age children. She is currently a member of the “Prosperidad y Amistad” communal bank. The group is maD. up of seven members that that work in different commercial enterprises. 

Aurora has worked for the past five years selling ceviche, soft drinks, sweets and mazamorra [a Peruvian corn-based desert] at a stall in the market. This business began as a result of her divorce. At that point Aurora had to support her four children. Aurora tells us that nothing was easy and she had to work very hard to get ahead in her business and help her children get ahead.

Her dream is to have a grocery store and be a wholesaler. Thanks to her great effort and dedication she has been able to increase her income, her children go to school, she has purchased electric appliances and above all her family has a better quality of life. To continue growing, she has requested a new loan to buy supplies of candies.

We know that Aurora will accomplish her goals with a lot of work and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy supplies of sweets.

loans.name: Sulaika's Group

texts.en:
Sulaika, 49, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). Together with her husband, she has raised two sons. About 20 years ago, Sulaika got cattle as an inheritance from her parents. Since that moment, she has been breeding cattle and reselling it after fattening. She also sells dairy products to make additional money. In this way, she earns 9000 soms per month. Sulaika applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase more cattle. She hopes it will help her to increase the volume of dairy products. In the future, she wants to expand a shed where she keeps cattle. With the profits gained from the trade, Sulaika wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchae cattle

loans.name: Mercedes Graciela

texts.es:
Mercedes Graciela tiene 69 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos de 15 y 23 años, en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Mercedes se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.
 
Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla e insumos agrícolas. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios. 

Le gusta caminar, y realizar actividades domésticas.
texts.en:
Mercedes Graciela is 69 years old, married, and she lives with her husband and their children, aged 15 and 23. They live in the canton of Chillanes, in the province of Bolivar.

The communal bank "Nueve de Abril", meaning "April Nine" is located in the Parrish of San Jose del Tambo, belonging to the canton of Chillanes. The members of this group are agriculturists who primarily cultivate corn and cocoa.

Mercedes cultivates corn and cocoa. She buys and sells her products in the market in San Jose del Tambo. 

She requests a loan to purchase seeds and agricultural products. the loan will help her supply her financial need and to improve her agricultural activities. She faces challenges such as the drop in prices of the products that she sells, as well as middle-men. Her dream is to see her children complete their studies.

She enjoys walking and household activities.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and agricultural products.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet has been operating a boutique in Oloitoktok town for the last three years. She is 26 years old and married to William. Together, they are blessed with two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add stock of clothes in her boutique.

In the future, she hopes to open a chain of boutiques in Oloitoktok town.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes in her boutique.

loans.name: Sandra Bibiana

texts.es:
Sandra es una emprendedora que siempre quiso trabajar como independiente y aportar a su hogar con sus ingresos, es así como después de estudiar algunas cosas propias del oficio de la belleza, se dedica a realizar manicure a domicilio. 

Teniendo en cuenta que Sandra también tienen conocimientos de corte y cepillado, tinturas, entre otros, esta emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos utensilios que le permitan prestar este tipo de servicios y así mejorar sus ingresos. 

En el futuro, Sandra espera tener su propio local con una Sala de Belleza que ofrezca todos los servicios propios de estos negocios.
texts.en:
Sandra is an entrepreneur who always wanted to work independently and contribute to her household with her income, and so after studying several things about the beauty profession, she decided to provide manicures from her home.  

Given that Sandra also has knowledge of cuts, blow-outs, dying and other things, this entrepreneur needs a loan to buy some tools that will allow her to offer these types of services and so improve her income.

In the future, Sandra hopes to have her own premises with a Beauty Salon that will offer all these services.

loans.use: to buy a dryer, enamels, and dyes.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, 58 years of age, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a farmer, and is a mother to their four children. One is working as a caretaker of their fruit stand, another one is settled down with his own family, the youngest child is just staying at home and the daughter is already working as a factory worker. By the grace of God at this time, she is working hard to sustain their family needs everyday. 

Virginia operates a fruit and vegetables stand along the road. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines, like pineapples which are grown mostly in the southern region of Luzon. She also sells coconut, a root crop (Ube), papaya, and other Filipino fruit staples. Also in her store she sells coffee, bread, biscuits, and chips for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 370 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Virginia dreams of being able to give her children a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Juana Lissette

texts.es: Juana Lissette se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más 2 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella es una mujer responsable, junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad que están bajo su cargo es una madre que siempre está pendiente de lo necesario para sus hijos. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de cosméticos, bolsos, ropa en general, calzado entre otros. El obtener este financiamiento le será beneficioso para lograr variedad en lo que ofrezca a sus clientes.
texts.en: Juana Lissette sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for more than two years. She is a responsible woman. Her two minor children are in her care, and she is a mother who is always looking out for her children's needs. She is asking for this loan to purchase cosmetics, bags, general clothing, and shoes, among other items.  Obtaining this loan will help her achieve variety in the products she offers her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, bags, general clothing, and shoes, among other items

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single, with 2 children. 
Anabella has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Anabella has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anabella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mehrubon

texts.ru: Мехрубон замужем на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Ее муж работает бухгалтером. В  бизнесе ей помогает ее дочь. Она занимается торговлей продовольственных товаров. Продукты питания всегда являются востребованными товарами, и товары Мехрубон всегда пользуются большим спросом и все время нуждаются в расширение ассортиментов. На полученный займ она хочет увеличить количество товаров и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Mehrubon is raising two children.  Her husband works as an accountant.  Her daughter helps her with the business.  Mehrubon is involved in sales of grocery products.  Food products are always in demand, and Mehrubon's products are also always in high demand and their assortment constantly needs to be expanded.  She plans to use the obtained loan to increase the quantity of products and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food products in order to expand product assortment

loans.name: Omaira Estrella

texts.es:
Con el objetivo de ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus hijos de 10 y 15 años, Omaira se ha venido dedicando por cerca de 2 años, a la venta de mercancía.

Esta mujer trabajadora no se ha dejado vencer por la adversidad y a pesar de que la falta de recursos siempre ha sido un obstáculo para invertir en su negocio, ella sigue perseverando en su propósito de salir adelante. Es por ello, que en este momento lo que más requiere son los recursos económicos para invertir en la compra de surtido y de una vitrina, mediante la cual podrá atraer a más clientes gracias a lo llamativo de la exhibición que se propondría tener.
texts.en:
With the goal of offering a better future to her children who are 10 and 15 years old, Omaira has been selling merchandise for about two years.  This hardworking woman has not let herself be defeated by adversity and despite the lack of resources that has always been an obstacle for her to invest in her business; she continues to persevere in her determination to get ahead.

This is why at this moment what she most needs is economic resources to invest in a selection of merchandise and to buy a display case so that she can attract more customers thanks to the showy display she’ll be able to have.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business and a display case.

loans.name: Nanjikabe Shg Group

texts.en:
Dismus is the facilitator of the Nanjikabe SHG group. Dismus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Dismus takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Dismus had a very good maize yield harvesting six bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Dismus was only able to harvest 2 ½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dismus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Dismus will educate his children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Nanjikabe SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Dismus is pictured with his group members. The field officer appears on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Shahera

texts.en:
Shahera, 24, is married and has one son. Shahera is a conservative woman, so her husband, Younis, is photographed instead.
Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Shahera has a Play Station cafe and she wants to expand and improve her cafe by purchasing more Play Station machines. The amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. 

When she gets the loan, she will purchase more Play Station machines. This will increase her customers and improve her work positively. It will increase her income so her family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more Play Station machines.

loans.name: Nurkul

texts.ru: Нуркуль 48 лет, замужем и  воспитывает троих детей. Нуркуль работает медсестрой в местной больнице. В 2003 году, в поисках средств к существованию для своей семьи, Нуркуль начала свой бизнес в разведении скота и перепродаже сельхоз продукции. Нуркуль использовала стартовую сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, и сумела развить свое хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день пять бычков, с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме около 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуркуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Нуркуль планирует увеличивать поголовье  скота.
texts.en: Nurkul is 48 years old, married and is raising three children.  She works as a nurse at the local hospital.  In search of means for survival for her family, Nurkul started her own business of breeding livestock and reselling agricultural crops in 2003.  She used an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock and was able to grow her business to currently have five bulls and a monthly profit of about 30,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Nurkul requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase heifers.  In the near future, she plans to increase livestock headcount with the help of the profits from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 37 years old and is married. She sells clothes in a shop she has run for 8 years. She would like a loan to increase her inventory of clothes. Beatrice will use any profits to build a house. She dreams to have a prosperous store with a variety of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 42 years old and she is married to Samue. They are blessed with three children aged 10, 8, and 5 years respectively. She has been in the farming business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Stella will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to export her farm's produce and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Jiovanna Mirian

texts.es: La señora Jiovanna vive en la casa de su suegro, cuenta con una tienda de barrio hace 5 años y una pequeña peluquería, vive con sus tres hijos, pocas veces recibe apoyo de su pareja puesto que el sr. Trabaja en provincia y llega poco a su domicilio, con esta actividad ella sola mantiene el hogar,  el crédito lo necesita para poner abarrotes en su tienda y mejorar sus ingresos, la zona donde vende y vive es periurbana, el sector es de alto comercio ya que existen varias construcciones aledañas, y esta es la única tienda de barrio por la zona y ella tiene mucha venta por tal motivo desea surtir su tienda, la Sra.se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Ms. Jiovanna lives in her father-in-law's home and has a neighborhood grocery store which she's had for five years and a small beauty salon. She lives with her three children and receives support from her partner infrequently since he works in the province and does not get home much. With this business she supports the household on her own. 

She needs the loan to stock her store with groceries and improve her income. The area where she sells and lives is semi-urban. The zone is largely commercial as there are various buildings around the area. This is the only neighborhood grocery store in the area and she gets a lot of sales, and so she wishes to stock her shop. 

She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her shop such as rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Ding

texts.en:
Ding is 45 year old a married woman with five children, all of whom are in school.  For the past 2 years, she has a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan.
Ding is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Rodolfo's Group

texts.en:
Rodolfo and Felix live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In El Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out, which they mention can last up to 8 days whenever it rains due to their geographical conditions. They believe a solar system will have great value through savings on their electricity costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes. 

Both Rodolfo and Felix have made a great effort to support their children continuing school; Rodolfo has two kids, one in preschool and one in elementary school, and Felix has four: two in elementary, one in a remote secondary school and one studying a technical career in a town nearby, but still living with his parents. When there is a several days blackout, all of Rodolfo´s and Felix children have to study in their homes by the lights of candles. A loan for a solar home system will not only provide better studying conditions for his children, it will allow both families to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work to continue supporting their children so they don't have to leave school to support family income.

loans.use: Rodolfo and Felix each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and support their children education

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in Magodi, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees.

Samuel is married and has nine children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 50 years now and they are currently growing cashew nuts in their farm. Samuel is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey.

This is Samuel’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to build a house. Samuel’s hope for the future is to improve his farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.
